original: 'on te shes pa gzhan gyis /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa gzhan gyis /
translated: Or by another cognition?

original: de la re zhig de nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni ;
analyzed: de la re zhig de nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni ;
translated: Here, first, it is said that it is not by itself.

original: rang rig pa rang bzhin tsam nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa rang bzhin tsam nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBy the mere nature of self-awareness.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: rang bzhin tsam la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin tsam la zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBecause of the mere nature.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni rang bzhin tsam rig pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni rang bzhin tsam rig pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained as ‚ÄúBy the mere awareness of self.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir snyam pa la gnyis rtogs nas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam pa la gnyis rtogs nas zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why is that? It is said, ‚ÄúBecause of the realization of duality.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba rten dang brten pa rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba rten dang brten pa rtogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚ÄúIn that way, the realization of the supported and the support.‚Äù

original: dper nas phyogs dang bum pa dag la bzhin no //
analyzed: dper nas phyogs dang bum pa dag la bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the directions and the pot.

original: 'on te sdug bsngal shes pa na /
analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal shes pa na /
translated: If it is thought, ‚ÄúWhen suffering is known,

original: bdag nyid dang 'byung ba chen po yang rtogs pa yod pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: bdag nyid dang 'byung ba chen po yang rtogs pa yod pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: the self and the great elements are also known,‚Äù

original: der yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: der yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIn that case.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal gyi shes pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi shes pa la yang ngo //
translated: It is also in the knowledge of suffering.

original: de ltar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni gnyis rtogs pa ste /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIn that way,‚Äù which is the realization of duality.

original: rang yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it has the nature of self-awareness.

original: des na de nyid ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po rnam par 'jog par byed pa ma yin no zhes grub po //
analyzed: des na de nyid ni rten dang brten pa'i dngos po rnam par 'jog par byed pa ma yin no zhes grub po //
translated: Thus, it is established that it does not posit the relationship of the supported and the supporter.

original: 'on te gzhan gyi yin no zhes dogs na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi yin no zhes dogs na /
translated: But if you suspect that it is the other,

original: bag chags cam gyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bag chags cam gyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúmerely a latent impression.‚Äù

original: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi mngon sum gyis ni gnyis rtogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyir de la rnam par rtog pa nyid gzhan yin par lus pa yin no //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rang bzhin gyi mngon sum gyis ni gnyis rtogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyir de la rnam par rtog pa nyid gzhan yin par lus pa yin no //
translated: Since it is a direct perception that has the nature of self-awareness, it is incompatible with the realization of duality. Therefore, the other, namely, conceptualization, remains.

original: de yang bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And that arises from the power of latent impressions.

original: 'byung ba dang sdug bsngal gyis shes brtan dang brten pa yin pa ni bag chags tsam gyis byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang sdug bsngal gyis shes brtan dang brten pa yin pa ni bag chags tsam gyis byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the arising and cessation of the supported and the supporter are merely created by latent impressions.

original: de lta yin dang rnam par rtog pa tsam du 'ba' @111b zhig tu 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rnam par rtog pa tsam du 'ba' @111b zhig tu 'gyur gyi /
translated: If that were so, it would be mere conceptualization alone.

original: des kyang 'byung ba chen po sdug bsngal gyi shes pa'i gzhi yin par ni mi 'grub po //
analyzed: des kyang 'byung ba chen po sdug bsngal gyi shes pa'i gzhi yin par ni mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, the great elements are not established as the basis of the consciousness of suffering.

original: des na rten la sogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na rten la sogs pa ni rnam par rtog pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that the support and so on are mere conceptualization.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba chen po nyid tha dad pa ni ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'byung ba chen po nyid tha dad pa ni ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said that the great elements are not different.

original: de yang rnam par rtog pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang rnam par rtog pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are also mere conceptualization.

original: yang rnam par rtog pas 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa tha dad pa mi rtogs pa gtan tshigs ci ste snyam na /
analyzed: yang rnam par rtog pas 'byung ba chen po la sogs pa tha dad pa mi rtogs pa gtan tshigs ci ste snyam na /
translated: Again, if one wonders why the great elements and so on are not realized as different by conceptualization,

original: rang gi rang bzhin tsam gyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin tsam gyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that it is by their mere intrinsic nature.

original: 'o na de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'byung ba chen po yang bag chags kyi stobs las byung bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'byung ba chen po yang bag chags kyi stobs las byung bar 'gyur ro//
translated: If one thinks that in the same way, the great elements also arise by the power of latent tendencies due to the nature of conceptualization,

original: des na mi rtogs pa'i nyes pa med do snyam na /
analyzed: des na mi rtogs pa'i nyes pa med do snyam na /
translated: then there is no fault of non-realization.

original: bag chags kyi stobs las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bag chags kyi stobs las zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is by the power of latent tendencies.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po rnams bag chags kyi stobs las byung bar 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po rnams bag chags kyi stobs las byung bar 'dod na /
translated: If you maintain that the great elements arise in that way due to the power of latent impressions, which have the nature of conceptualization,

original: de'i tshe de dag de ltar yin yang skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe de dag de ltar yin yang skyon med do //
translated: then there is no fault in that, even though they are like that.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'jig rten nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i snga ma dang phyi ma'i 'jig rten nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that the previous and subsequent worlds of that kind are not destroyed.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having completed the digression,

original: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba chen po las gzhan yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de nye bar sdud pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba chen po las gzhan yin no zhes rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de nye bar sdud pa ni /
translated: he sums up the point that consciousness is different from the great elements:

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //üîΩtha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o // tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore,üîΩit is different.

original: tha dad pa des na'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa des na'o //
translated: By that difference.

original: 'o na gal te zhes bya ba ni phyir bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na gal te zhes bya ba ni phyir bzlog pa'o //
translated: If, then, is a reversal.

original: gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba ma yin pa'i sems can mi gtsang ba'i yul du 'gro ba gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir srog chags ni 'byung ba chen po tsam las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba ma yin pa'i sems can mi gtsang ba'i yul du 'gro ba gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir srog chags ni 'byung ba chen po tsam las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i don to //
translated: The point of the opponent‚Äôs argument is that since it is not tenable that any other sentient being, who is not guided by another, goes to an impure place, a living being is born from the mere great elements.

original: grub pa'i mthar ni thos pa med pa smad 'tshong ma'i khyim du 'jug pa bzhin du /
analyzed: grub pa'i mthar ni thos pa med pa smad 'tshong ma'i khyim du 'jug pa bzhin du /
translated: In the philosophical system, it is like entering the house of a prostitute without paying the fee.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las phyin ci log dang srid pa dag mi gtsang ba'i yul du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin par mi 'gal ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las phyin ci log dang srid pa dag mi gtsang ba'i yul du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin par mi 'gal ba'i phyir na /
translated: Since there is no contradiction in error and existence being the cause for going to an impure place through positive and negative concomitance,

original: gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyid nyams so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyid nyams so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the point is that the untenability of any other is lost.

original: don gnyis po 'di yang rnam par 'grel bar gsal bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gnyis po 'di yang rnam par 'grel bar gsal bar bya ba'o //
translated: This second point should be clarified in the commentary.

original: gdod ma nas zhi ba'i sems pa de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: gdod ma nas zhi ba'i sems pa de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The reality of that mind, which is primordially peace, is just that.

original: de la zhi ba ni nye bar 'tsho ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhi ba ni nye bar 'tsho ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: There, peace is the absence of appropriation.

original: gdod ma'i sgra ni phyis skye ba med pa lhur ston pa'o //
analyzed: gdod ma'i sgra ni phyis skye ba med pa lhur ston pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúprimordial‚Äù indicates the absence of subsequent arising.

original: nye bar 'tsho ba mtha' dag ni gnyis dang 'brel ba yin na /
analyzed: nye bar 'tsho ba mtha' dag ni gnyis dang 'brel ba yin na /
translated: All the means of livelihood are connected with the two.

original: gnyis ni nam yang srid pa ma yin no //üîΩdes na rtag tu zhi ba @112a * //
analyzed: gnyis ni nam yang srid pa ma yin no // des na rtag tu zhi ba @112a * //
translated: But the two are never possible.

original: ni gdod ma nas zhi bar brjod do //
analyzed: ni gdod ma nas zhi bar brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the ultimate is peace from the beginning.

original: 'o na ci ltar nye bar 'tsho ba gnyis dang 'brel ba yin zhe na bden te /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar nye bar 'tsho ba gnyis dang 'brel ba yin zhe na bden te /
translated: But how can the means of livelihood be connected with the two?

original: de kho na yang dag par brtags na gnyis med la nye bar 'tsho ba yang med do //
analyzed: de kho na yang dag par brtags na gnyis med la nye bar 'tsho ba yang med do //
translated: It is true, but when reality is examined, there is no livelihood without the two.

original: 'o na kyang kun rdzob tu gnyis sgro btags pas nye bar 'tsho ba yang tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: 'o na kyang kun rdzob tu gnyis sgro btags pas nye bar 'tsho ba yang tha snyad byed do //
translated: But when the two are superimposed conventionally, livelihood is also conventionally expressed.

original: de kho na la mngon du phyogs na ni sgro btags pa yang 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de kho na la mngon du phyogs na ni sgro btags pa yang 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But when one is directed toward reality, there is not even any superimposition.

original: des na 'di mtha' dag ni nges par ma btags pa'i dus na yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na 'di mtha' dag ni nges par ma btags pa'i dus na yod pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, all of this exists only when not examined.

original: rnam par dpyad na ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But when examined, it does not exist.

original: des na mchog tu yid ches ba'i rgyu ni rnam par dpyod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na mchog tu yid ches ba'i rgyu ni rnam par dpyod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cause of supreme confidence is only analysis.

original: des na 'khor ba nyid med pa'i phyir yod pa gsal bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: des na 'khor ba nyid med pa'i phyir yod pa gsal bar mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, since cyclic existence itself does not exist, it is not to be clarified as existent.

original: 'on kyang rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: However, it is to be understood that it does not exist in any way.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi phyogs sdud pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob kyi phyogs sdud pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr‚Äù is a term that includes the side of the conventional.

original: mchog tu rtog pa ni blo ste /
analyzed: mchog tu rtog pa ni blo ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSupreme imagination‚Äù is the mind.

original: rnam pa gnyis spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the one that abandons the two aspects.

original: de ga la yod pa ni rtog pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ga la yod pa ni rtog pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere is it?‚Äù is the one that is associated with imagination.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIts reality‚Äù is that itself.

original: phyis dgag pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: phyis dgag pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: The inclusion of the negation is later.üîΩ‚ÄúGoing to a lower state‚Äù is the one that is associated with the one not having imagination.

original: dman pa'i gnas su 'gro ba ni rtog pa dang mi ldan pas sbyar ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dman pa'i gnas su 'gro ba ni rtog pa dang mi ldan pas sbyar ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni /
translated: This is clarified by the following:

original: bdag la chags pas bskul ba ni //
analyzed: bdag la chags pas bskul ba ni //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one impelled by attachment to self‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is the one that is associated with the one having imagination.

original: phyin ci log nyid du ci ste 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: phyin ci log nyid du ci ste 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúHow could there be error?‚Äù

original: de 'dra ba de ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de 'dra ba de ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat kind of‚Äù is stated.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir de spang ba ni mi rigs so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir de spang ba ni mi rigs so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that it is not reasonable to abandon that because it is beyond the senses.

original: las gang gis phyin ci log bskyed pa gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba ma yin pa zhes sbyar ro //üîΩde lta yin dang mnar med ba /
analyzed: las gang gis phyin ci log bskyed pa gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba ma yin pa zhes sbyar ro // de lta yin dang mnar med ba /
translated: The action by which one is led to error is not to be led by another.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i las kyis grang ba'i rims chen po'i dbang gis de'i mi nyid la bde ba'i rgyur bsam pas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i las kyis grang ba'i rims chen po'i dbang gis de'i mi nyid la bde ba'i rgyur bsam pas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: If that were so, then the action of establishing the Avici hell would be the cause of happiness for the human being who is the agent, because of his intention.

original: de bzhin du phyin ci log gi blo can rtse bar 'dod pas ma la sogs pa'i gnas su 'jog go //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyin ci log gi blo can rtse bar 'dod pas ma la sogs pa'i gnas su 'jog go //
translated: In the same way, those who have the idea of error, desiring to play, place their mother, etc. in the place of a wife.

original: de ltar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, ‚Äúgoing‚Äù means

original: dman pa'i gnas su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dman pa'i gnas su 'gro ba'o //
translated: going to a lower place.

original: phyin ci log gi nus pa brjod nas /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi nus pa brjod nas /
translated: Having described the power of error,

original: srid pa'i nus ba brjod pa ni /
analyzed: srid pa'i nus ba brjod pa ni /
translated: he describes the power of existence:

original: bde ba dang zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: bde ba dang zhes bya ba'o//
translated: ‚Äúhappiness, etc.‚Äù

original: kyang ni rim pa bzhin du yin te /
analyzed: kyang ni rim pa bzhin du yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù is in order.

original: phyin ci log 'ba' zhig gis yin par ni ma zad kyi /
analyzed: phyin ci log 'ba' zhig gis yin par ni ma zad kyi /
translated: It is not only by error alone,

original: bde ba la sogs pa thob pa la sogs par 'dod bas kyang yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa thob pa la sogs par 'dod bas kyang yin no //
translated: but also by the desire to obtain happiness, etc.

original: gang gis gnyis rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyams par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis gnyis rgyu yin pa'i phyir gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyams par 'gyur ba /
translated: because of the two causes, the refutation of the non-establishment of the other is lost.

original: ci lta bu mthong ba yod dam snyam na /
analyzed: ci lta bu mthong ba yod dam snyam na /
translated: What is seen?

original: thos pa po zhes @112b gsungs te /
analyzed: thos pa po zhes @112b gsungs te /
translated: The hearer.

original: des na gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyams so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyams so snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the refutation of the non-establishment of the other is lost.üîΩIf the potency of God with regard to creation is stated, why is the refutation of the non-establishment of the other not stated?

original: gal te skye ba la dbang phyug gi nus pa brjod nas gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyams so zhes ci ste mi brjod snyam du zur na 'dug pa'i bsam pa dogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: gal te skye ba la dbang phyug gi nus pa brjod nas gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyams so zhes ci ste mi brjod snyam du zur na 'dug pa'i bsam pa dogs par byed pa ni /
translated: The doubt that is the suspicion of the thought that is set aside is stated in,

original: 'on te de ni dbang phyug gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te de ni dbang phyug gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut that is by God.‚Äù

original: sems can 'di'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di'o //
translated: This is the sentient being.

original: lan du rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúBy itself.‚Äù

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: thar pa'i bdag ni dbang phyug gis skul bar byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang so so'i skye bo yin no //
analyzed: thar pa'i bdag ni dbang phyug gis skul bar byed pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang so so'i skye bo yin no //
translated: The self of liberation is not impelled by God, but rather by the individual.

original: 'khrul pa de yang las kyis 'phangs pa yin pa'i phyir ngo //
analyzed: 'khrul pa de yang las kyis 'phangs pa yin pa'i phyir ngo //
translated: And that error is due to the projection of karma.

original: 'dod par bya ba don du gnyer bar nges par 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba don du gnyer bar nges par 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of the observation of the definite engagement in the pursuit of the desirable,

original: dbang phyug tu rtogs par dka' bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: dbang phyug tu rtogs par dka' bas ci zhig bya /
translated: What is the use of the difficulty of understanding God?

original: 'on te tshad mas grub pa la dka' ba dang sla ba bsam pas ci bya snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te tshad mas grub pa la dka' ba dang sla ba bsam pas ci bya snyam na /
translated: But if you think that it is useless to consider whether or not there is difficulty in establishing God by a means of valid knowledge,

original: re zhig mngon sum gyi byed pa med par ston pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig mngon sum gyi byed pa med par ston pa ni /
translated: first of all, we show that there is no operation of perception:

original: dbang phyug gis bskul bar ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis bskul bar ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGod is not impelled by anything.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa'i byed pa yang med do zhes ston pa ni dbang phyug tu rtog pa zhes gsungs sos //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i byed pa yang med do zhes ston pa ni dbang phyug tu rtog pa zhes gsungs sos //
translated: We show that there is also no operation of inference: ‚ÄúThe conception of God.‚Äù

original: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni brnyas thabs kyis rjes su dpag pa la brjod do //
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni brnyas thabs kyis rjes su dpag pa la brjod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúconception‚Äù is used to refer to inference by way of a contemptuous dismissal.

original: yang na rtog pa'i sgras ni rnam par gzhag pa sun 'byin pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: yang na rtog pa'i sgras ni rnam par gzhag pa sun 'byin pa ston par byed do //
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúconception‚Äù indicates the refutation of the positing.

original: the tshom tsam yang brtags par bsal bas bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: the tshom tsam yang brtags par bsal bas bkag pa yin no //
translated: Even the mere doubt is cleared away by the examination, and so is refuted.

original: de'i phyir bdag la chags pa nyid ces gsungs so//
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag la chags pa nyid ces gsungs so//
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúattachment to the self.‚Äù

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhin gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhin gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut‚Äù is for the sake of another opinion.

original: 'jig rten gzhan du yang gzhan gyis bskul lo zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan du yang gzhan gyis bskul lo zhes 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúHe is impelled by another in another world‚Äù is connected.

original: bsal ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsal ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The refutation is this:

original: gal te bdag la chags pa skul byed du mthong ba'i phyir de ltar rnam par 'jog na /
analyzed: gal te bdag la chags pa skul byed du mthong ba'i phyir de ltar rnam par 'jog na /
translated: If it is so posited because it is seen to be the instigator of attachment to self,

original: de'i tshe khol po la sogs pa yang gzhan gyis bskul nas 'jug par mthong ba kho na'o ;
analyzed: de'i tshe khol po la sogs pa yang gzhan gyis bskul nas 'jug par mthong ba kho na'o ;
translated: then it is seen that a slave, etc. is also instigated by another and acts.

original: des na gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba ci ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis bkri bar bya ba ci ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, how is it not to be led by another?

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the refutation.

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skul bar byed pa kho na zhes bya ba'i nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skul bar byed pa kho na zhes bya ba'i nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no certainty‚Äù means that there is no certainty that it is only the instigator.

original: nges pa med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nges pa med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of uncertainty.

original: de la re zhig bskul bar bya ba la ltos nas brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig bskul bar bya ba la ltos nas brjod pa ni /
translated: First, with regard to the instigator, it is said:

original: bdag la sred pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdbang phyug gis bskul yang de las kham gcig kyang re ba med cing /
analyzed: bdag la sred pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'o // dbang phyug gis bskul yang de las kham gcig kyang re ba med cing /
translated: ‚ÄúOne who has craving for self.‚Äù

original: phung bar yang mi mthong ba ni bskul bar mi nus so //
analyzed: phung bar yang mi mthong ba ni bskul bar mi nus so //
translated: Even though instigated by God, one who has no hope for even a morsel from him and who sees no danger is not able to instigate.

original: skul bar byed pa la ltos nas kyang bshad pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skul bar byed pa la ltos nas kyang bshad pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: With regard to the instigator, it is also said:üîΩ‚ÄúThat is also not so.‚Äù

original: sred pa dang ldan pa de yang ngo //
analyzed: sred pa dang ldan pa de yang ngo //
translated: and he is also endowed with craving.

original: 'dod chags dang @113a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang @113a * //
translated: He is not free from desire, etc.

original: bral ba la sogs pa de bskul bar 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: bral ba la sogs pa de bskul bar 'dod pa'am /
translated: He is not a bodhisattva who wishes to exhort others,üîΩbecause he does not see the cessation of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ldog pa ma mthong ba ni skul bar byed pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ldog pa ma mthong ba ni skul bar byed pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that he is an exhortor,

original: rtog pa dang mi ldan par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang mi ldan par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he would be devoid of imagination.

original: des na bskul mkhan yang chags sred pa dang ldan par thal lo //
analyzed: des na bskul mkhan yang chags sred pa dang ldan par thal lo //
translated: Therefore, it follows that the one who exhorts is also endowed with craving.

original: de ni snying rjes 'jug pa yang ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //üîΩched du bsams nas tshig la sogs pas bskul na ni de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas gzhan dogs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de ni snying rjes 'jug pa yang ma yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to // ched du bsams nas tshig la sogs pas bskul na ni de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas gzhan dogs par byed pa ni /
translated: And it has already been demonstrated that he does not engage in the practice out of compassion.üîΩIf he exhorts others with words, etc., after having reflected, then at that time this fault would occur.üîΩThinking thus, he is apprehensive of others.

original: de la bsnyen pa byas pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la bsnyen pa byas pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He is apprehensive of others because he has approached them.

original: 'gro ba ni bde 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni bde 'gro'o //
translated: The happy states of existence are the happy states of existence.

original: lan du mu stegs byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du mu stegs byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: The tirthikas are the tirthikas.

original: thams cad la bsod nams dang ye shes gnyis rab kyi mthar phyin pa med kyang /
analyzed: thams cad la bsod nams dang ye shes gnyis rab kyi mthar phyin pa med kyang /
translated: Although all do not reach the culmination of merit and wisdom,

original: skye bo gzhan la ltos nas khyad par yod pa'i phyir bsnyen pa la sogs ba cung zad tsam gyis bde 'gro la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bo gzhan la ltos nas khyad par yod pa'i phyir bsnyen pa la sogs ba cung zad tsam gyis bde 'gro la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is a difference in relation to other persons, a little bit of service and so on becomes the cause of happy rebirth and so on.

original: phul byung ba dang bcas pas de'i rgyu yin na ni dbang phyug la yang nges par mi nus so //
analyzed: phul byung ba dang bcas pas de'i rgyu yin na ni dbang phyug la yang nges par mi nus so //
translated: If it is the cause of that because it is the supreme, then it is not possible to ascertain that it is God.

original: des na dbang phyug skye ba la nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dbang phyug skye ba la nus pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, God does not have the ability to create.

original: de'i phyir de btags pas gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyams par ni mi nus so zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de btags pas gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyams par ni mi nus so zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to refute the impossibility of God by reification. This is the intended meaning.

original: rnam 'grel dang po'i don sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel dang po'i don sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary of the meaning of the first commentary is ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni smad 'tshod ma'i gnas la sogs par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni smad 'tshod ma'i gnas la sogs par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúElsewhere‚Äù means in the place of a prostitute and so on.

original: rnam 'grel gnyis pa'i don brjod pa ni gang la de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam 'grel gnyis pa'i don brjod pa ni gang la de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the meaning of the second commentary is ‚Äúin regard to that.‚Äù

original: 'on te de dag dang bral ba ni dbang phyug gis bskul bas skye ba thob par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te de dag dang bral ba ni dbang phyug gis bskul bas skye ba thob par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that those who are free from those obtain birth through being impelled by God,

original: de la zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: de la zhes gsungs te //
translated: then ‚Äúin regard to that‚Äù is stated.

original: phyin ci log dang bral ba la'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang bral ba la'o //
translated: but to one who is free from error.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log la sogs pa dang bral ba la dbang phyug gis skye ba sbyin bar nus so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log la sogs pa dang bral ba la dbang phyug gis skye ba sbyin bar nus so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means that the Lord is able to grant birth to one who is free from error, etc.

original: 'dis ni 'di skad cis /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad cis /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang la las kyi 'phangs pas blo phyin ci log dang sred pa yod pa de la de dag nyid kyis skye bar nus pa'i phyir dbang phyug gis ci bya ste don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la las kyi 'phangs pas blo phyin ci log dang sred pa yod pa de la de dag nyid kyis skye bar nus pa'i phyir dbang phyug gis ci bya ste don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since one who has error and craving due to the projection of karma is able to be born by those very things, what is the use of the Lord, because he is purposeless?

original: gang la de med pa de la yang dbang phyug gis ci bya ste /
analyzed: gang la de med pa de la yang dbang phyug gis ci bya ste /
translated: And what is the use of the Lord for one who lacks those?

original: skye bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is unable to cause birth.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The opponent says ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on.

original: sman pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: sman pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: The doctor would be purposeless.

original: de ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mi nus pa dang mi dgos pas zhes smras so //
analyzed: mi nus pa dang mi dgos pas zhes smras so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause he is unable and because he is purposeless.‚Äù

original: dgos pa ni don dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: dgos pa ni don dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Purpose is having a point.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is having a result.

original: de lta ma yin na ni mi dgos pa ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni mi dgos pa ste /
translated: Otherwise, it is purposeless.

original: 'bras bu dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bral ba'o //
translated: and it is devoid of effects.

original: des na dbang phyug mi @113b dgos pa dang mi nus pas ni sman pa yang mi nus pa dang mi nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na dbang phyug mi @113b dgos pa dang mi nus pas ni sman pa yang mi nus pa dang mi nus par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, since God is not necessary and is not able, he is not able and is not able to be a physician,üîΩbecause the reasoning is the same.

original: rigs mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: de nas rtsod pa 'dis ni dbang phyug la yang glags mi rnyed do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rtsod pa 'dis ni dbang phyug la yang glags mi rnyed do zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Thus, this argument does not find any opportunity in God.üîΩThis is the intended meaning.

original: nyes pa 'di ni med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med do zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'i'o //
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúThis fault does not exist.‚Äù

original: gang du sman pa'i dpyad med kyang nad med ba grub par byed pa'i las yod pa 'ga' zhig tu ni sman don med pa dang / gang du sman pa'i dpyad yod kyang nad med pa sgrub par byed pa'i las med pa 'ga' zhig la gang yin pa des ni nus pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du sman pa'i dpyad med kyang nad med ba grub par byed pa'i las yod pa 'ga' zhig tu ni sman don med pa dang / gang du sman pa'i dpyad yod kyang nad med pa sgrub par byed pa'i las med pa 'ga' zhig la gang yin pa des ni nus pa med pa yin no //
translated: In some cases, where the activity that produces health exists even without the physician‚Äôs treatment, the physician is purposeless. In some cases, where the physician‚Äôs treatment exists but the activity that produces health does not exist, the physician is not able.

original: gang zhig tu sman pa'i dpyad dang ldan cig pa nyid du gyur pa nad med pa sgrub par byed pa'i las yod pa der ni sman pa mi nus pa dang mi dgos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig tu sman pa'i dpyad dang ldan cig pa nyid du gyur pa nad med pa sgrub par byed pa'i las yod pa der ni sman pa mi nus pa dang mi dgos pa ma yin no //
translated: When a physician is present and the patient is healthy, the physician is not powerless or unnecessary with regard to the activity of maintaining health.

original: las kyi stobs ma des pas ni de'i sman dpyad thams cad du 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: las kyi stobs ma des pas ni de'i sman dpyad thams cad du 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The power of karma is the most important factor in the physician‚Äôs treatment being effective.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni sman pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni sman pa bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like‚Äù means like the physician.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'dod pa'i mi nus pa dang mi dgos pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu 'dod pa'i mi nus pa dang mi dgos pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat very‚Äù means that in some cases, the physician is powerless and unnecessary.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni sman pa bzhin du 'ga' zhig tu don med pa yin na dbang phyug tu 'dod pa de ci skad bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i dbang phyug ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni sman pa bzhin du 'ga' zhig tu don med pa yin na dbang phyug tu 'dod pa de ci skad bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i dbang phyug ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means that if the physician is sometimes unnecessary, then God, who is asserted to be powerful, is not powerful in the sense described.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbang phyug gis 'ga' zhig ni zhes pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis 'ga' zhig ni zhes pa gsungs so //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúGod does not create some beings.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang 'khor ba la mtha' dag bskul lo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khor ba la mtha' dag bskul lo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: However, it is thought that he impels all transmigrating beings.

original: de skad du yang skye bo pa 'di shes pa yod min la /
analyzed: de skad du yang skye bo pa 'di shes pa yod min la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe creator is not known to exist,

original: nga zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nga zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and the ‚ÄòI‚Äô and so on are not the creator.üîΩ‚Äù

original: 'khor ba ba'i sgras ni 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba ba'i sgras ni 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúcreator‚Äù is used in the following way:

original: thar pa lta zhog ste /
analyzed: thar pa lta zhog ste /
translated: ‚ÄúForget about liberation,

original: 'khor ba pa la yang thams cad ni mi bskul lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba pa la yang thams cad ni mi bskul lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: not even the creator of the world is the creator of all.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúBut‚Äù means that if it is not accepted that the creator is the cause of all, then the creator is the cause of some.

original: yang gi sgras ni 'dod pa 'ba' zhig gis ma yin pa des na gal te yang thams cad mi bskul ba de lta na yang 'di nyid ni dbang phyug yin no snyam na /
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni 'dod pa 'ba' zhig gis ma yin pa des na gal te yang thams cad mi bskul ba de lta na yang 'di nyid ni dbang phyug yin no snyam na /
translated: The word ‚Äúbut‚Äù indicates that the creator is not the cause of all.üîΩIf it is thought that ‚Äúeven if the creator is not the cause of all, he is still God,‚ÄùüîΩthe response is, ‚ÄúIf that is so. . . .

original: lan du de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúIf that were so, then . . . ‚Äù

original: skye ba po bsnyen pa yang bde 'gro thob la /
analyzed: skye ba po bsnyen pa yang bde 'gro thob la /
translated: The creator is the one who gives, and the one who gives is the one who is sought by those who desire a happy rebirth.

original: nye bar mkho ba yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: This is the connection.

original: des na bsko ba po yang dbang phyug du thal lo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na bsko ba po yang dbang phyug du thal lo snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who appoints the creator is also God.

original: skye ba po ni ster mkhan te ster mkhan yang lon gnas rnams bde bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: skye ba po ni ster mkhan te ster mkhan yang lon gnas rnams bde bar 'dod pas so //
translated: The creator is the one who gives, and the one who gives is the one who is sought by those who desire a happy rebirth.

original: nye bar longs spyod pa la sogs pa byin pas bde 'gro'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar longs spyod pa la sogs pa byin pas bde 'gro'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: By giving the enjoyment of the body, etc., one becomes the cause of good rebirth,

original: bde ba'i gnas skabs khyad par can nyid bde 'gro yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: bde ba'i gnas skabs khyad par can nyid bde 'gro yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because good rebirth is a special state of happiness.

original: @114a * // sngar bshad pa ha cang yang thal pa'i nyes pa sdud pa ni de ni zhes bya ba ste bsnyen pa'o //
analyzed: @114a * // sngar bshad pa ha cang yang thal pa'i nyes pa sdud pa ni de ni zhes bya ba ste bsnyen pa'o //
translated: The summary of the previously explained fault of absurdity is ‚Äúthat is not so.‚Äù

original: mu stegs byed thams cad ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mu stegs byed thams cad ces bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAll the tirthikas‚Äù is as before.

original: de nyid ces nges par bzung ba'i rnam par gcad pa brjod ba ni dbang phyug ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces nges par bzung ba'i rnam par gcad pa brjod ba ni dbang phyug ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The exclusion of the ascertainment ‚Äúthat itself‚Äù is expressed by ‚Äúnot.‚Äù

original: des na dbang phyug tu rtogs pas gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyams pa ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na dbang phyug tu rtogs pas gzhan du mi 'thad pa nyams pa ni ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the fault of the non-establishment of the other is not the case, because of the understanding of God.

original: des ni blo phyin ci log pa sred pas mngal la sogs pa'i yul du skye ba mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni blo phyin ci log pa sred pas mngal la sogs pa'i yul du skye ba mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because the non-contradiction of the birth of the inverted mind in the womb, etc., is due to craving.

original: gzhan du mi 'thad pas srog chags 'byung ba tsam las skye ba ni ma yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad pas srog chags 'byung ba tsam las skye ba ni ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: The fault of the non-establishment of the other is not the case, because the birth of living beings is not just from the elements.

original: gal te 'o na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: gal te 'o na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf, on the other hand, ‚Äù etc. is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med na ni srog chags kyi skye ba 'byung ba chen po tsam las yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med na ni srog chags kyi skye ba 'byung ba chen po tsam las yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: If there is no coming and going, then the birth of a living being is from the great elements alone.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni ma mthong na yang ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni ma mthong na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven so, ‚Äù etc. means ‚Äúeven if it is not seen. ‚Äù

original: dpe'i don dpe can gyi don la gsal bar sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: dpe'i don dpe can gyi don la gsal bar sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of the example to the meaning of the example is:

original: srid pa bar ma do'i lus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma do'i lus zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúthe body of the intermediate existence. ‚Äù

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar mdo'i lus so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar mdo'i lus so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that alone, ‚Äù etc. means ‚Äúby the body of the intermediate existence. ‚Äù

original: rmi lam gyi lus ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs ba bsu ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi lus ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs ba bsu ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe body in a dream, ‚Äù etc. is the anticipation of another‚Äôs doubt.

original: rmi lam gyi lus ni log pa yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi lus ni log pa yin te /
translated: The body in a dream is false.

original: des na de ni ma dmigs pas med pa ma yin gyi bar mdo'i lus ni yod pa'i phyir na de ni ma mthong bas med par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: des na de ni ma dmigs pas med pa ma yin gyi bar mdo'i lus ni yod pa'i phyir na de ni ma mthong bas med par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: Therefore, since it is not perceived, it is not nonexistent. But since the body of the intermediate existence exists, it would be nonexistent because it is not seen.

original: len du ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: len du ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo, ‚Äù etc. is the reply.

original: rmi lam gyi lus kyis lus kyi don bya ba bskal pa'i lus la rnam par 'gyur ba byed pa ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi lus kyis lus kyi don bya ba bskal pa'i lus la rnam par 'gyur ba byed pa ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The transformation of the body of the life-cycle by the dream body, which performs the function of the body, has already been explained.

original: des na snang bzhin pa dang / don bya ba byed pa mi bden par ci ltar brjod bar nus /
analyzed: des na snang bzhin pa dang / don bya ba byed pa mi bden par ci ltar brjod bar nus /
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that what appears and performs a function is not real?

original: thogs pa med ba nyid kyis ni lus 'di dang rigs mi mthun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thogs pa med ba nyid kyis ni lus 'di dang rigs mi mthun par 'gyur te /
translated: By being unobstructed, it is unlike this body.

original: srid pa bar ma yang de 'dra ba nyid ni yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma yang de 'dra ba nyid ni yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The intermediate state body is just like that.

original: gang gi phyir bar mdo'i lus med pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir lus can ma yin pa'i sems la lta bsam du yang ga la yod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bar mdo'i lus med pa yin pa de nyid kyi phyir lus can ma yin pa'i sems la lta bsam du yang ga la yod de /
translated: Since there is no body in the intermediate state, how can there be seeing and thinking in a disembodied mind?

original: lus can ma yin yang ngo //
analyzed: lus can ma yin yang ngo //
translated: Even though it is not embodied,

original: thogs pa ni rdugs pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa ni rdugs pa ste /
translated: Obstruction is resistance.

original: 'gro ba'i gegs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i gegs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is the impediment to going.

original: thogs med ni rdugs pa med pa can no //
analyzed: thogs med ni rdugs pa med pa can no //
translated: Being without obstruction is being without impediment.

original: spyir bshad pa'i don khyad par du ston pa ni chu bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyir bshad pa'i don khyad par du ston pa ni chu bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the general explanation is shown in particular by ‚Äúlike water.‚Äù

original: 'dir chu bzhin rnam gser la dngul chu bzhin zhes 'ang gi sgra sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir chu bzhin rnam gser la dngul chu bzhin zhes 'ang gi sgra sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúlike‚Äù should be supplied to connect the example of water with the example of silver.

original: srid pa bar mdo'i lus kyang thogs pa med par 'gyur ro snyam du zhe la gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa bar mdo'i lus kyang thogs pa med par 'gyur ro snyam du zhe la gzhag pa'o //
translated: The body of the intermediate being would also be unimpeded.

original: des na rnam pa de lta bu'i srid pa bar mdo'i lus ni ma mthong ba'i phyir na med pa ma yin no zhes nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: des na rnam pa de lta bu'i srid pa bar mdo'i lus ni ma mthong ba'i phyir na med pa ma yin no zhes nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since such a body of the intermediate being is not seen, it is not nonexistent. This is the summary.

original: des na srog @114b chags ni 'byung ba chen po tsam las skyes pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //üîΩbshad pa mdzad pas ni 'di bor nas ma mthong ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma do med pa yin yang nged la chad pa ci yang med do snyam du dgongs nas lugs gzhan bsdu ba'i don du yod pa nyid ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di dgag pa
analyzed: des na srog @114b chags ni 'byung ba chen po tsam las skyes pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o // bshad pa mdzad pas ni 'di bor nas ma mthong ba'i phyir srid pa bar ma do med pa yin yang nged la chad pa ci yang med do snyam du dgongs nas lugs gzhan bsdu ba'i don du yod pa nyid ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba 'di dgag pa
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that a living being is born from the mere great elements.üîΩThe author of the commentary thinks that even if the intermediate existence does not exist because it is not seen, we have no fault. Thinking this, he intends to include other systems, and he explains the negation of the statement ‚Äúexistence is not apprehended‚Äù as

original: la ma yin zhes bya bar ma mthong ba'i phyir med pa zhes bya ba sgrub pa nyid du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la ma yin zhes bya bar ma mthong ba'i phyir med pa zhes bya ba sgrub pa nyid du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: a proof that it does not exist because it is not seen.

original: de'i tshe ni ma dmigs pas med par smra ba'i lugs la brten kyang 'jig rten pha rol med pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs nas ma mthong ba'i phyir na med pa 'ang zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni ma dmigs pas med par smra ba'i lugs la brten kyang 'jig rten pha rol med pa ma yin no snyam du dgongs nas ma mthong ba'i phyir na med pa 'ang zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is not seen, it does not exist‚Äù is stated with this intention.

original: de zhes bya ba de nyid ltar 'jug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba de nyid ltar 'jug par bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that way‚Äù means that one should engage in that way.

original: yang na ma mthong ba'i phyir na bar ma do'i lus ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na ma mthong ba'i phyir na bar ma do'i lus ni med pa nyid do //
translated: Or, because it is not seen, the body of the intermediate state does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i yan lag gi nang du zhugs pa'i chu dang dngul chu bzhin du srid pa bar mdo'i lus ma mthong ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa la sogs pa'i yan lag gi nang du zhugs pa'i chu dang dngul chu bzhin du srid pa bar mdo'i lus ma mthong ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the case that the body of the intermediate state does not exist because it is not seen, like water or mercury that has entered the cracks in a pot, for example.

original: 'on kyang med pa kho na'o zhes 'ga' zhig 'dod pa des na de ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang med pa kho na'o zhes 'ga' zhig 'dod pa des na de ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: However, some assert that it does not exist at all.

original: med kyang 'jig rten pha rol mi 'grub pa ni ma yin no zhes 'grel par gsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: med kyang 'jig rten pha rol mi 'grub pa ni ma yin no zhes 'grel par gsal bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is clear in the Autocommentary that the world beyond is not established because it does not exist.

original: yang gi sgras 'phangs pa'i don brjod ba ni rmi lam gyi lus bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras 'phangs pa'i don brjod ba ni rmi lam gyi lus bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that way‚Äù indicates that the meaning of the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is expressed.

original: thogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma do'i lus so zhes bya ba bar skabs yin no //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni srid pa bar ma do'i lus so zhes bya ba bar skabs yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is unimpeded‚Äù refers to the body of the intermediate state of existence.

original: 'ga' zhig la lar zhes bya ba ni thams cad la ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la lar zhes bya ba ni thams cad la ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIn some places‚Äù means not in all places.

original: ci de ltar 'ga' zhig mthong ba yod dam snyam na /
analyzed: ci de ltar 'ga' zhig mthong ba yod dam snyam na /
translated: Do you think that such a thing is seen?

original: bum pa la sogs par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs par zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn a pot, etc.‚Äù

original: skabs su bab pa yang thogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar lta'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa yang thogs pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar lta'o //
translated: We also see that the unimpeded is relevant here.

original: lugs gzhan bsdu ba'i don du 'ang gi sgra ni rnam pa gzhan du 'chad pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lugs gzhan bsdu ba'i don du 'ang gi sgra ni rnam pa gzhan du 'chad pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is stated to include another interpretation.

original: chu bzhin zhes bya ba ni bum pa so btang ma thag la ltos nas so //
analyzed: chu bzhin zhes bya ba ni bum pa so btang ma thag la ltos nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúLike water‚Äù means in relation to a pot that has just been emptied.

original: 'dis kyang gi sgra sbrel bar bya ste //
analyzed: 'dis kyang gi sgra sbrel bar bya ste //
translated: This also connects with the word ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: des na yang na bar ma do'i lus ni med pa nyid do zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: des na yang na bar ma do'i lus ni med pa nyid do zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúalso‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúthe body of the intermediate state does not exist.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam du dogs na /
translated: Why?

original: so btang ma thag gi bum pa las chu bzhin nam gser la dngul chu bzhin du bar ma do'i lus yod bzhin du ma mthong ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: so btang ma thag gi bum pa las chu bzhin nam gser la dngul chu bzhin du bar ma do'i lus yod bzhin du ma mthong ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang med pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is not that the intermediate existence is not seen while it exists, like water in a full vase or mercury in gold, but rather it does not exist.

original: des nam mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: des nam mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not seen.

original: @115a * // ma dmigs pa'i phyir na med pa kho na'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: @115a * // ma dmigs pa'i phyir na med pa kho na'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be supplied: ‚ÄúIt is not seen, therefore it does not exist.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba 'dis ni khyad par brjod pa'i don du srid pa bar ma do'i rnam par gzhag par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba 'dis ni khyad par brjod pa'i don du srid pa bar ma do'i rnam par gzhag par ston pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù indicates that the intermediate existence is established as a separate stage.

original: chos mngon pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i bar du yongs su btags pa'i sgra bcug pa ni tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i bar du yongs su btags pa'i sgra bcug pa ni tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúintermediate‚Äù is not found in the Abhidharma verses, because there is no authority for it.

original: nges pa med pa ston pa lhur byed pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa med pa ston pa lhur byed pa'o //
translated: It is a mere assertion.

original: khyad par brjod pa ni 'dir ni zhes bya ba ste lugs gzhan la'o //
analyzed: khyad par brjod pa ni 'dir ni zhes bya ba ste lugs gzhan la'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúhere‚Äù indicates a different opinion.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas brjod pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni chos mngon pa'i tshig le'ur byas pas brjod pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù indicates the meaning expressed in the Abhidharma verses.

original: gang gis skye ba'i yul du yang de lta bu nyid yin par brtag par bya ba shes pa'i skye ba rnam par chad pa dang ma chad pa dag tu skye ba la lar mthong ngam ci snyam na /
analyzed: gang gis skye ba'i yul du yang de lta bu nyid yin par brtag par bya ba shes pa'i skye ba rnam par chad pa dang ma chad pa dag tu skye ba la lar mthong ngam ci snyam na /
translated: One should consider whether the object of the arising of consciousness is seen to arise in a place that is either obstructed or unobstructed.

original: yul dang dus zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yul dang dus zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúPlace and time‚Äù are mentioned.

original: chod pa yang zhes bya bar lta'o //
analyzed: chod pa yang zhes bya bar lta'o //
translated: ‚ÄúObstructed‚Äù should be supplied.

original: de la gnyid mthug por log pa la sogs par sems dus kyis chod pa skye ba dang / mchod pa yang yin pas rnam pa gnyis ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la gnyid mthug por log pa la sogs par sems dus kyis chod pa skye ba dang / mchod pa yang yin pas rnam pa gnyis ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The two types of arising of consciousness, where the time is obstructed, as in deep sleep, etc., and where the time is not obstructed, have already been explained.

original: yul gyis chod pa dang ma chod pa rnam pa gnyis ni brjod bas ni /
analyzed: yul gyis chod pa dang ma chod pa rnam pa gnyis ni brjod bas ni /
translated: The two types of arising of consciousness, where the place is obstructed and where the place is not obstructed, are mentioned in the following.

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as‚Äù is mentioned.

original: 'di rnam pa gnyi ga la rmi lam du yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnam pa gnyi ga la rmi lam du yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that both types of arising of consciousness are like dreams.

original: de lta na gnyi ga ltar yang shes pa skye ba'i yul du skye bar brtag par bya ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na gnyi ga ltar yang shes pa skye ba'i yul du skye bar brtag par bya ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, in both cases, one should consider whether the object of the arising of consciousness arises in a place that is either obstructed or unobstructed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin du zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de bzhin du zhes gsungs te /
translated: That is why ‚Äújust so‚Äù is mentioned.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pa yin no //üîΩkhyad par med do zhes bya ba ni rmi lam las skye ba yongs su len pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o ;
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i rnam pa yin no // khyad par med do zhes bya ba ni rmi lam las skye ba yongs su len pa zhes bya ba lhag ma'o ;
translated: There is no difference.

original: / gal te rmi lam dang chos mtshungs pa'i phyir bar ma do'i srid pa med kyang srid pa gzhan yod na de'i tshe rmi lam bzhin du mi bden par yang 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: / gal te rmi lam dang chos mtshungs pa'i phyir bar ma do'i srid pa med kyang srid pa gzhan yod na de'i tshe rmi lam bzhin du mi bden par yang 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If, although there is no intermediate existence because it is similar to a dream, there is another existence, then it would be false, like a dream.

original: rmi lam mi bden pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rmi lam mi bden pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Lord has said that a dream is false.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: thams cad kyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad kyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because all is false.

original: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba la gnas skabs gzhan ma dmigs kyang gnas gzhan du phyin par dmigs pa de tsam gyis mtshungs par bstan pa'i don du zhugs pa yin na de ni grub po //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba la gnas skabs gzhan ma dmigs kyang gnas gzhan du phyin par dmigs pa de tsam gyis mtshungs par bstan pa'i don du zhugs pa yin na de ni grub po //
translated: But if it is taught that the dream is false because, although the state of the object to be established is not perceived in another state, the object is perceived in another place, then that is established.

original: 'di dag ni bden pa dang mi bden pa dag kyang de kho na nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni bden pa dang mi bden pa dag kyang de kho na nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: These are not the truth and the falsity of reality,

original: snang ba dang don bya ba dag ni gnyi ga la thun mong yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: snang ba dang don bya ba dag ni gnyi ga la thun mong yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because appearance and the performance of function are common to both.

original: sngar ji skad brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar ji skad brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is just as was previously stated.

original: des na gnyi ga yang rigs mthun pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga yang rigs mthun pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, both are of the same type.

original: 'o na ci ltar bden pa dang mi bden pa dag gis tha dad par tha snyad 'dogs snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar bden pa dang mi bden pa dag gis tha dad par tha snyad 'dogs snyam na /
translated: But how can one conventionally designate them as being different, as true and false?

original: skye ba gzhan ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúAnother birth . . .‚Äù

original: bden par zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i tha snyad du'o //
analyzed: bden par zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i tha snyad du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn truth‚Äù means in terms of conventional truth.

original: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bag chags bstan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bag chags bstan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it does not exist‚Äù means because the teaching of the latent impressions does not exist.

original: de lta ma yin na rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dag khyad par @115b yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dag khyad par @115b yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du /
translated: Otherwise, there would be no difference between dreams and the non-dream state.

original: tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan de dang de dag dogs par byas nas sel ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan de dang de dag dogs par byas nas sel ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he raises the issue of the various reasons for the difference and then refutes them: ‚ÄúIf it is said . . .‚Äù

original: sad ba'i shes pa mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa gzhan rmi lam las dus phyis thob pas na'o //
analyzed: sad ba'i shes pa mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa gzhan rmi lam las dus phyis thob pas na'o //
translated: Because the consciousness of the waking state is later obtained in a different form from that of the dream state.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi shes pa snang ba gzhan gyi mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi shes pa snang ba gzhan gyi mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because the dream consciousness has the characteristic of the appearance of another.

original: skye ba gzhan pa yang zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan pa yang zhes bya ba ni sad pa'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother birth‚Äù is the characteristic of the consciousness of the waking state.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the explanation.

original: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni rdza mkhan la sogs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIts cause‚Äù is the cause of the potter, etc.

original: lan ni sad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni sad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúThe waking state,‚Äù etc.

original: sad pa la ni rgyu ba'i khyad par nyid tshogs pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: sad pa la ni rgyu ba'i khyad par nyid tshogs pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the difference in the cause is the collection of the conditions,

original: rmi lam du yang zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: rmi lam du yang zhes gsungs so ;
translated: then the verse says, ‚ÄúEven in a dream,‚Äù etc.

original: / sad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyed snga ma rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: / sad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyed snga ma rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: The first half of the verse explains ‚Äúthe waking state,‚Äù etc.

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis smras pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey‚Äù refers to the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de la rgyu'i khyad par ni zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i khyad par ni zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma gzhan yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe difference in the cause‚Äù is another position of the opponent.

original: de la rtsod pa dang po sel ba ni rmi lam na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la rtsod pa dang po sel ba ni rmi lam na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first objection is resolved by ‚ÄúEven in a dream,‚Äù etc.

original: des na rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dag khyad par med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dag khyad par med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between a dream and the waking state.

original: gzhan gyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir sngar yod pa zlog par byed pa yin no zhes sbrel ta //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir sngar yod pa zlog par byed pa yin no zhes sbrel ta //
translated: that is refuted, since it is not perceived by others.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni sad bas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni sad bas so //
translated: Others means the person who is awake.

original: sad pas dmigs pa'i ri la sogs pa la yang rmi lam mthong ba dag gis ma dmigs pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: sad pas dmigs pa'i ri la sogs pa la yang rmi lam mthong ba dag gis ma dmigs pa mtshungs so //
translated: And the mountain, etc. perceived by the person who is awake are not perceived by the person who is dreaming.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa 'di bshad nas tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma'i phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pas rtsod pa gnyis pa sel bar byed pa las ni /
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa 'di bshad nas tshig le'ur byas pa snga ma'i phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pas rtsod pa gnyis pa sel bar byed pa las ni /
translated: Having explained this verse, the second half of the earlier verse is commented upon, and the second objection is removed.

original: ci ltar rgyu ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar rgyu ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: As for the verse, it goes:

original: de dag ces bya ba ni ri la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni ri la sogs pa dag go //
translated: As for the words ‚Äúthose,‚Äù they refer to the mountain, etc.

original: rgyu ba'i tshogs pa'i dod po ni rmi lam yin no //
analyzed: rgyu ba'i tshogs pa'i dod po ni rmi lam yin no //
translated: The equivalent of the collection of moving things is the dream.

original: bum pa la sogs pa glo bur du dmigs pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa glo bur du dmigs pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: The pot, etc. are perceived adventitiously.

original: gzhan yang sad pa'i gnas skabs nyid tha dad par rtogs par mi nus pa des na sad pa gzhan gyis de dag dmigs pa'i phyir zhes ci ltar brjod ces bshad pa ni sad pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sad pa'i gnas skabs nyid tha dad par rtogs par mi nus pa des na sad pa gzhan gyis de dag dmigs pa'i phyir zhes ci ltar brjod ces bshad pa ni sad pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, since it is not possible to understand the state of waking to be different, how could it be said that ‚Äúthe objects are perceived by another, the waking state‚Äù?

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyi gnas skabs su mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gnyid kyi gnas skabs su mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to what is seen in the state of sleep.

original: de ltar thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni log pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar thal bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni log pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis consequence‚Äù means the consequence of falsity.

original: 'on te rmi lam du mthong ba nyid mi bden pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rmi lam du mthong ba nyid mi bden pa yin te /
translated: But if you think that what is seen in a dream is false,

original: sad pas ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: sad pas ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: because it is not perceived upon waking,

original: phan tshun zhes gsungs so //üîΩgnyi ga la @116a * //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes gsungs so // gnyi ga la @116a * //
translated: then the response is ‚Äúmutually.‚Äù

original: yang zhes bya ba ni sad pa dang gnyid log pa dag la'o //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni sad pa dang gnyid log pa dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù refers to the waking and sleeping states.

original: de mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi bden no zhes rtogs par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mtshungs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi bden no zhes rtogs par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are similar‚Äù means because the understanding that they are false is similar.

original: gal te 'di mi bden no snyam pa'i rtog pa med pa'i phyir sad par shes pa mi bden pa ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te 'di mi bden no snyam pa'i rtog pa med pa'i phyir sad par shes pa mi bden pa ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think that the consciousness of waking is not true because there is no thought that this is not true, then:

original: de ltar rtogs pa nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa nyid kyis ni //
translated: Because of that very understanding,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is not true.

original: de nyid ni bden pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni bden pa nyid do //
translated: That itself is truth.

original: de'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang zhes kyang gi sgra ni rigs pa'i stobs kyis srid pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang zhes kyang gi sgra ni rigs pa'i stobs kyis srid pa'i don to //
translated: The word also in the phrase ‚Äúby its very definition‚Äù means that it is possible by the power of reasoning.

original: de'i mtshan nyid kho nas yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid kho nas yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that it is by its very definition.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni yod dam med kyang bla'o /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni yod dam med kyang bla'o /
translated: It does not matter whether or not there is conceptual thought.

original: de lta ma yin na shing nyid du tha snyad ma byas pa'i shing sha pa shing ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na shing nyid du tha snyad ma byas pa'i shing sha pa shing ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree, which is not designated as a tree, would not be a tree.

original: des na shing sha pa nyid kyang de'i tha snyad mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na shing sha pa nyid kyang de'i tha snyad mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree itself would not be established as that designation.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa gzhan yin no //
translated: Moreover means another refutation.

original: yang na rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa 'ba' zhig gis yin par ni ma zad kyi //
analyzed: yang na rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa 'ba' zhig gis yin par ni ma zad kyi //
translated: Or, it is not only by a conceptual consciousness.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang de nyid du ste log pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang de nyid du ste log pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the characteristic of dream consciousness, it is just that, i.e., false.

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad du de'i mtshan nyid kyis de nyid du rnam par gzhag pa myos par thal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad du de'i mtshan nyid kyis de nyid du rnam par gzhag pa myos par thal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that everything is just that, i.e., real, because of its characteristic.

original: 'di yang 'di yang 'di gnyis so sor de nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin par khas blangs nas brjod pa yin gyi dngos po la ni de'i mtshan nyid kho nas de nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: 'di yang 'di yang 'di gnyis so sor de nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin par khas blangs nas brjod pa yin gyi dngos po la ni de'i mtshan nyid kho nas de nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i don du /
translated: This is said on the assumption that the two, i.e., the characteristic and the characterized, are posited as just that, i.e., as real, but in reality, it is taught that just because of its characteristic, it is just that, i.e., real.

original: gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Moreover,

original: bden las gzhan nam zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: bden las gzhan nam zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: the thought, ‚ÄúIs it not other than real?‚Äù is with regard to the position that it is not.

original: ci ste na bden mod ces bya ba ni med par dgag pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: ci ste na bden mod ces bya ba ni med par dgag pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is real‚Äù is with regard to the position that it is a nonimplicative negation.

original: dgag pa 'di gnyi ga yang shin tu 'thad par dka'i zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: dgag pa 'di gnyi ga yang shin tu 'thad par dka'i zhes 'brel to //
translated: Both of these negations are very difficult to maintain.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de'i rang bzhin dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its nature is perceived.

original: 'di'o zhes lhag par 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pa mngon sum du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'o zhes lhag par 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pa mngon sum du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the dream consciousness that possesses the apprehension of something as being something else is directly perceived.

original: rnam par 'grel pa ni de'i rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'grel pa ni de'i rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The commentary on the second part of the verse is as follows:

original: bden pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bden pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚Äúas having the nature of truth‚Äù

original: de las gzhan ni bden pa las gzhan no //
analyzed: de las gzhan ni bden pa las gzhan no //
translated: ‚Äúother than that‚Äù means other than the truth.

original: dmigs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig go //
translated: ‚Äújust that‚Äù means the reason.

original: phyogs gnyis pa rnam par 'grel pa ni //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa rnam par 'grel pa ni //
translated: The commentary on the second part of the verse is as follows:

original: de ma yin no zhes bya bar yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ma yin no zhes bya bar yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúnot that‚Äù means ‚Äúnot just that.‚Äù

original: phyogs dang po la 'thad pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la 'thad pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The justification for the first part of the verse is as follows:

original: de las gzhan pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúother than that‚Äù

original: yod pa las gzhan nyid ni'o //
analyzed: yod pa las gzhan nyid ni'o //
translated: ‚Äúother than existence‚Äù

original: de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni yod pa las gzhan ni rang @116b bzhin nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni yod pa las gzhan ni rang @116b bzhin nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚Äúby virtue of having a nature that is other than that‚Äù means ‚Äúby virtue of having a nature that is other than existence.‚Äù

original: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin ni //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were not so‚Äù means ‚Äúif it were not the case that the nature of that which is other than that is other than existence.‚Äù

original: de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyis ma yin na'o //
translated: not by any other nature.

original: de'i tshe bden pa de yang de las gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe bden pa de yang de las gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: And at that time, that truth would be different from that.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: des na rmi lam gyi shes pa ni bden pa las gzhan nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na rmi lam gyi shes pa ni bden pa las gzhan nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the intended meaning is that the consciousness in a dream is not different from truth.

original: 'di zhes bya bar dgongs pa nges par 'dzin pa las kyang bden pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dang 'gal ba mi ldan pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya bar dgongs pa nges par 'dzin pa las kyang bden pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de dang 'gal ba mi ldan pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: And in the S≈´tra Unraveling the Intention, it says that because it is true, how could it not possess the opposite of that?

original: mngon sum la ni tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa yang ma yin no zhes sngar rgya cher bshad zin to //
analyzed: mngon sum la ni tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa yang ma yin no zhes sngar rgya cher bshad zin to //
translated: And direct perception is not harmed by another valid knowledge. This was already explained extensively above.

original: gnyis pa la yang 'thad pa de nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa la yang 'thad pa de nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that very same reasoning in the second case is:

original: dmigs bzhin nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs bzhin nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúbecause of being just what is observed.‚Äù

original: thams cad de ltar thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad de ltar thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the consequence that everything would be like that‚Äù means

original: gang gis re zhig cung zad khas blangs pa de la chad pa'i gtso bo ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: gang gis re zhig cung zad khas blangs pa de la chad pa'i gtso bo ni 'di yin no //
translated: that this is the main point of nihilism for whoever accepts anything for even an instant.

original: thams cad la bsnyon 'debs pa yang gal te tshad ma can yin na de'i tshe 'di'i gnod pa'i tshad ma bzhin du mngon sum yang tshad ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: thams cad la bsnyon 'debs pa yang gal te tshad ma can yin na de'i tshe 'di'i gnod pa'i tshad ma bzhin du mngon sum yang tshad ma nyid yin te /
