translated: If it is a valid cognition, then, like the valid cognition that contradicts it, direct perception is also a valid cognition,

original: de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the characteristics of that.

original: yang na ni mtshan nyid gzhan brjod dgos so //
analyzed: yang na ni mtshan nyid gzhan brjod dgos so //
translated: Or else, you must state another characteristic.

original: mngon sum tshad ma ma yin na ni /
analyzed: mngon sum tshad ma ma yin na ni /
translated: If direct perception is not a valid cognition,üîΩthen the other valid cognitions would not be valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma gzhan tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang sngar bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yang sngar bsgrubs zin to //
translated: This has already been established earlier.

original: de ste tshad ma can ma yin na de'i tshe thams cad 'dod pa la rag las nas grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ste tshad ma can ma yin na de'i tshe thams cad 'dod pa la rag las nas grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not a valid cognition, then everything would be established in dependence on desire.

original: des na gal te kun rdzob tu yang gnod byed khas len na gnod byed ci lta ba de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa yang tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na gal te kun rdzob tu yang gnod byed khas len na gnod byed ci lta ba de bzhin du sgrub par byed pa yang tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, if you accept that there is a contradiction even conventionally, then, just as there is a contradiction, so too the proof is a valid cognition.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba rmi lam mi bden no snyam pa'i rtog pa 'di ni'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba rmi lam mi bden no snyam pa'i rtog pa 'di ni'o //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúThis thought that a dream is not true arises,‚Äù

original: skyes mod kyi zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: skyes mod kyi zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: the response is, ‚ÄúIt arises.‚Äù

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni mi bden no snyam pa'i rtog pa 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni mi bden no snyam pa'i rtog pa 'di la'o //
translated: Here refers to the thought this is not true.

original: don med pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: don med pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase it is meaningless

original: yul dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: yul dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: means that it is devoid of an object.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba mi bden no snyam pa'i rtog pa dmigs pa med pa las so //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba mi bden no snyam pa'i rtog pa dmigs pa med pa las so //
translated: Here refers to the thought this is not true.

original: des na de'i mtshan nyid kho nas de nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na de'i mtshan nyid kho nas de nyid du rnam par gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is just on the basis of its own characteristic that it is established as just that.

original: brtan pa ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Stable means unmoving.

original: mi slu ba can ni rmi lam du dmigs pa rnams sad par rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slu ba can ni rmi lam du dmigs pa rnams sad par rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nondeceptive means that the objects perceived in a dream do not continue after one awakens.

original: rmi lam mi bden no snyam pa'i rtog pa ci ltar don med pa yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam mi bden no snyam pa'i rtog pa ci ltar don med pa yin te /
translated: How can the thought a dream is not true be meaningless?

original: yul med pa nyid du ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha @117a * //
analyzed: yul med pa nyid du ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha @117a * //
translated: How can it be devoid of an object?

original: tshig go // de ltar ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshig go // de ltar ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase in this way indicates that this is the teaching.

original: mod la zhes bya bas ni khrus byas par snang ba rgyun gyis rjes su 'jug pa med par brjod do //
analyzed: mod la zhes bya bas ni khrus byas par snang ba rgyun gyis rjes su 'jug pa med par brjod do //
translated: The word immediately indicates that the appearance of washing is not continued in a series.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni khrus ma byas par snang ba'i rjes thogs su'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni khrus ma byas par snang ba'i rjes thogs su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means immediately after the appearance of not washing.

original: de lta nyid du mi slu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khrus ma byas snang ba rgyun du 'jug pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de lta nyid du mi slu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khrus ma byas snang ba rgyun du 'jug pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is not deceptive in that way‚Äù means because the appearance of not washing continues.

original: / des ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: / des ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not so‚Äù is the philosophical position.

original: don ni 'di yang sad pa la mtshungs so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: don ni 'di yang sad pa la mtshungs so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning is that it is the same in the waking state.

original: sad pa na mthong ba'i 'dod pa la nye bar spyod pa ni rmi lam mthong ba na mod la ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: sad pa na mthong ba'i 'dod pa la nye bar spyod pa ni rmi lam mthong ba na mod la ldog pa yin no //
translated: The enjoyment of the desired object seen in the waking state is immediately reversed in the dream state.

original: ldog pa de la ni slu ba yang med do //
analyzed: ldog pa de la ni slu ba yang med do //
translated: That reversal is not deceptive.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //üîΩsngar yang ste dus phyis rgyun gyis rmi lam du ldog pa de yang bzlog pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid de ni mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na // sngar yang ste dus phyis rgyun gyis rmi lam du ldog pa de yang bzlog pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid de ni mthong phyir ro //
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause the reversal in the dream state is also of the nature of the waking consciousness, since it is seen later on in the continuum.

original: de rigs kyi phyir ro des na sad pa na mthong ba'i chags pa'i gnas skabs kyang phyin ci log du 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de rigs kyi phyir ro des na sad pa na mthong ba'i chags pa'i gnas skabs kyang phyin ci log du 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Because of that, the state of attachment seen in the waking state is also mistaken. That is the idea.

original: gal te de lta na yang 'di ni sad pa'i gnas skabs yin la /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang 'di ni sad pa'i gnas skabs yin la /
translated: But even if that is so, this is the state of being awake,

original: de ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and that is the state of dreaming.

original: khyad par shin tu che'o snyam na /
analyzed: khyad par shin tu che'o snyam na /
translated: Therefore, there is a great difference.

original: rmi lam cig shos zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rmi lam cig shos zhes gsungs so //
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúThe other dream.‚Äù

original: ci ltar grub pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ltar grub pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: How is it that there is no establishment?

original: gang gi phyir slu ba las ni rmi lam du rnam par gzhag pa grub pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir slu ba las ni rmi lam du rnam par gzhag pa grub pa yin no snyam na /
translated: Because the establishment of a dream is from a deception.

original: slu ba de nyid khyed kyis rmi lam yin pa nyid las bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: slu ba de nyid khyed kyis rmi lam yin pa nyid las bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it that you establish a dream from that very deception?

original: rmi lam yang slu ba las yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam yang slu ba las yin te /
translated: A dream is from deception.

original: de lta yin dang / rmi lam gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin dang / rmi lam gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then because a dream is to be established,

original: slu ba las rmi lam nyid du grub na /
analyzed: slu ba las rmi lam nyid du grub na /
translated: if a dream is established from deception,

original: phan tshun brten pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa yin no //
translated: then they are mutually dependent.

original: des na grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no establishment.

original: zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes 'brel to //
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúThe other dream.‚Äù

original: rmi lam gyi slu ba de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu yongs su gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi slu ba de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu yongs su gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can /
translated: The deception of a dream is a transformation that is not characterized by a cause that is in accordance with it.

original: de la ltos pa med par grub ba ci 'dra ba /
analyzed: de la ltos pa med par grub ba ci 'dra ba /
translated: What is it like to be established without depending on that?üîΩIt is just like the waking state when one has awakened from a dream.

original: de 'dra ba ni rmi lam thob par gyur pa na sad bar mthong ba la yang yod do zhes ni de ma thag kho nar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni rmi lam thob par gyur pa na sad bar mthong ba la yang yod do zhes ni de ma thag kho nar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what has been taught immediately above.

original: des na rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa gnyis khyad par med do //
analyzed: des na rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa gnyis khyad par med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between a dream and a non-dream.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Another mode of expression is ‚Äúfurthermore.‚Äù

original: 'di ni med ces bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa las shes pa gzhan gyis ni rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dag rtogs par 'gyur pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni med ces bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa las shes pa gzhan gyis ni rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa dag rtogs par 'gyur pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The cognition that understands dreams and non-dreams is not by a cognition that is different from the conception ‚Äúthis does not exist.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis yin no 'di ni mngon sum gyi byed pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis yin no 'di ni mngon sum gyi byed pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa yang ma yin te //
translated: Rather, it is by conception itself. It is also not the case that it follows the activity of perception.

original: mngon sum ni mdun na gsal ba'i yod pa'i rang bzhin du gsal bar byed kyi med pa'i rang bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni mdun na gsal ba'i yod pa'i rang bzhin du gsal bar byed kyi med pa'i rang bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: For perception manifests the nature of existence that is present and clear, but not the nature of nonexistence.

original: des na med pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni yid @117b brten pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: des na med pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni yid @117b brten pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a conceptual cognition that has a nonexistent nature as its object is not a reliable cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te rtags kyi stobs kyis skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang ma yin te rtags kyi stobs kyis skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it inference, because it is produced by the power of a sign.

original: rtags kyi khyad par 'ga' yang med pa de dang 'brel ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di gnyis las gzhan dngos po med pa can nam /
analyzed: rtags kyi khyad par 'ga' yang med pa de dang 'brel ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro // 'di gnyis las gzhan dngos po med pa can nam /
translated: There is no difference in the sign, because the connection is not established.

original: the tshom gyi dngos po can gyi rnam par rtog pa yang don gyi de kho na rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom gyi dngos po can gyi rnam par rtog pa yang don gyi de kho na rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Apart from these two, a conceptual cognition that has a nonexistent object or a doubtful object is also not a cause for positing the reality of an object.

original: des na rjes su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir na rang gi rgyud 'di ni rtogs pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir na rang gi rgyud 'di ni rtogs pa tsam yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it does not grasp, this is merely a conceptual cognition.

original: 'dis bsgrub pa'am bkag pa'i don la ni gus pa yang med de /
analyzed: 'dis bsgrub pa'am bkag pa'i don la ni gus pa yang med de /
translated: It has no respect for the object to be established or refuted.

original: des na dngos po la gnod par byed pa brjod zin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: des na dngos po la gnod par byed pa brjod zin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, because it is a fault in regard to the object,

original: yul med pa nyid du gnas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni rtogs pa tsam du zad de don yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul med pa nyid du gnas pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni rtogs pa tsam du zad de don yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The statement it abides as the absence of an object is merely a realization, but it is not an existent object.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thun mong pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thun mong pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is a common characteristic.

original: gzhan dang thun mong ba'i rang bzhin rig par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dang thun mong ba'i rang bzhin rig par byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not a revealer of a nature that is common to others, means that it is not a revealer of a nature that is common to others.

original: de la 'di snyam du /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du /
translated: In that regard, one might think,

original: ci rtogs pa 'di gcig pu de ltar 'gyur ba yin nam /
analyzed: ci rtogs pa 'di gcig pu de ltar 'gyur ba yin nam /
translated: Is this realization the only one that is like that?

original: yul med pa srid par yang ci ltar 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yul med pa srid par yang ci ltar 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: Or is it possible that there is no object?

original: rtogs pa 'di dag ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rtogs pa 'di dag ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, These realizations...

original: brtan pa dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtan pa dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means the conceptual thoughts of a self, permanence, and so on, and the conceptual thoughts of a creator, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on.

original: yul med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: yul med pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because there is no object,

original: sngon gal te sngon gyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yang ma yin na ni de'i tshe mi 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gal te sngon gyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yang ma yin na ni de'i tshe mi 'gyur ba kho na'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: if it does not follow after previous compositional activity, then at that time it would be unchanging, he thinks.

original: khyad par gang gis she na zhes bya ba'i 'dri ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gang gis she na zhes bya ba'i 'dri ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: What is the meaning of the question, ‚ÄúBy what distinction?‚Äù

original: yul med pa dang bag chags nye ba ni thams cad la thun mong ba yin no //
analyzed: yul med pa dang bag chags nye ba ni thams cad la thun mong ba yin no //
translated: The absence of an object and the proximity of the latent impressions are common to all.

original: des na 'di ni med do snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhi nges pa can dang / res 'ga' bar ni ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ni med do snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhi nges pa can dang / res 'ga' bar ni ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the question is, ‚ÄúHow is it that sometimes there is a conceptual thought with a definite basis, thinking ‚ÄòThis is not,‚Äô and sometimes there is not?‚Äù

original: len du de la sems gtad pas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: len du de la sems gtad pas zhes bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBy directing the mind to that‚Äù means

original: rmi lam du mthong ba'i don bden pa dang mi bden pa nyid du sems gtad pa'i rtogs pa po'o //
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba'i don bden pa dang mi bden pa nyid du sems gtad pa'i rtogs pa po'o //
translated: the one who directs the mind to the truth or falsity of the object seen in a dream.

original: 'dis ni gang gi gang la sems ma gtad pa de'i tshe de la bsgrub pa'i dang dgag pa'i rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang gi gang la sems ma gtad pa de'i tshe de la bsgrub pa'i dang dgag pa'i rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that when one does not direct the mind to something, then at that time there will be no conceptual thought of establishing or negating it.

original: bdag nyid gnyid kyis nyams par bsam pas ni rmi lam du mthong ba ma dmigs kyang med par nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir khyad par du byed pa ni rtogs pa pos sad pa'i bdag nyid du mngon par rlom pa can gyis rmi lam du mthong ba gangüîΩyin pa dmigs pa de med pa'i khyad par gyis nges pa'i dus dang rnam pa can gyi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnyid kyis nyams par bsam pas ni rmi lam du mthong ba ma dmigs kyang med par nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir khyad par du byed pa ni rtogs pa pos sad pa'i bdag nyid du mngon par rlom pa can gyis rmi lam du mthong ba gang yin pa dmigs pa de med pa'i khyad par gyis nges pa'i dus dang rnam pa can gyi rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The point of mentioning ‚Äúone whose mind is impaired by sleep‚Äù is that, although one does not perceive the object seen in a dream, one is not certain that it does not exist.

original: nyams pa'i lus ni rmi lam du skyes pa'i lus so //
analyzed: nyams pa'i lus ni rmi lam du skyes pa'i lus so //
translated: The ‚Äúimpaired body‚Äù is the body that arises in a dream.

original: de dor bas sad par mngon par rlom pa yin no //üîΩde yang ci ltar sad par mngon par rlom pa nyid yin gyi sad pa nyid @118a * //
analyzed: de dor bas sad par mngon par rlom pa yin no // de yang ci ltar sad par mngon par rlom pa nyid yin gyi sad pa nyid @118a * //
translated: By abandoning that, one is certain that one has awakened.

original: ma yin snyam na //
analyzed: ma yin snyam na //
translated: But how can one be certain that one has awakened, but not that one has actually awakened?

original: 'di yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: In response to this, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúThis is also the case with the thought ‚ÄòI am awake.‚Äô

original: bdag sad do snyam du shes pa yang do //
analyzed: bdag sad do snyam du shes pa yang do //
translated: The thought ‚ÄòI am awake‚Äô is also abandoned,

original: de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a thought.

original: blun po nyid de zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: blun po nyid de zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFoolishness‚Äù is the absence of wisdom.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du gnas pa des so //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du gnas pa des so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the one who is situated in the dream.

original: de dag rnams zhes bya ba ni sad pa na dmigs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag rnams zhes bya ba ni sad pa na dmigs pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the objects perceived in the dream.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩsad pa na dmigs pa de la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / sad pa na dmigs pa de la /
translated: Why is that?

original: rmi lam na gnas pa de dag dang 'brel ba'i 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gegs ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam na gnas pa de dag dang 'brel ba'i 'gro ba la sogs pa'i gegs ma yin pa ste /
translated: Because, when one awakens, the objects perceived in the dream are not obstructed by the one who is situated in the dream.

original: bar chod ma yin par grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bar chod ma yin par grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no obstruction.

original: sad pa na dmigs pa'i ra ba la sogs pa'i gegs yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med pa'i sgrub par byed pa gzhan gyis ci bya snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sad pa na dmigs pa'i ra ba la sogs pa'i gegs yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir med pa'i sgrub par byed pa gzhan gyis ci bya snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that since there is no obstruction of the objects perceived in the dream by the walls, etc., what need is there for any other proof of their non-existence?

original: 'gro ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni phyed phyi ma'i rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni phyed phyi ma'i rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúObstruction by going, etc.‚Äù is the commentary on the second half of the verse.

original: bya ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni phyed snga ma rnam par 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni phyed snga ma rnam par 'grel pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the point of view of action‚Äù is the commentary on the first half of the verse.

original: rtogs pas bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rtogs pas bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúEstablished by understanding‚Äù means established by unreality.

original: mi bden pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin reality‚Äù is a specification.

original: bden pa nyid du yang ngo //
analyzed: bden pa nyid du yang ngo //
translated: [The phrase] ‚Äúin reality‚Äù is also [a specification].

original: de ltar rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas rmi lam la mi bden pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas rmi lam la mi bden pa nyid yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that unreality does not exist in a dream by way of another aspect,

original: rang gis brjod pa'i rnam pas mi bden pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gis brjod pa'i rnam pas mi bden pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he concludes that it is unreal by way of the aspect that he himself stated, [saying] ‚Äúfor that reason.

original: mod la 'jig pa ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs nyid du ste /
analyzed: mod la 'jig pa ni rmi lam gyi gnas skabs nyid du ste /
translated: ‚Äù [The phrase] ‚Äúimmediately destroyed‚Äù refers to the very state of dreaming,

original: bag chags brtan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags brtan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no stable latent impression.

original: des na sad pa'i gnas skabs nyid du rjes su 'brel pa med pas don byas zin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sad pa'i gnas skabs nyid du rjes su 'brel pa med pas don byas zin pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not connected in the state of waking, it does not perform a function.

original: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa'i tha snyad med par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa'i tha snyad med par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: If it were otherwise, he thinks that the convention of difference would not exist.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa tsam gyis so //
translated: [The phrase] ‚Äúby that alone‚Äù refers to destruction alone.

original: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i dus su yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i dus su yang ngo //
translated: [The phrase] ‚Äúat that time‚Äù refers to the time of appearance.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rmi lam mi bden pa nyid du ma yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rmi lam mi bden pa nyid du ma yin pa de'i phyir zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because a dream is not false in that way, therefore, is to be supplied.

original: yang na ni zhes bya ba ni bar mdo'i srid pa med pa la ltos nas mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ni zhes bya ba ni bar mdo'i srid pa med pa la ltos nas mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Or else, the word ‚Äúor‚Äù is a conclusion based on the nonexistence of intermediate state existence.

original: des na shes pa ni 'byung ba chen po tsam las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don to //
analyzed: des na shes pa ni 'byung ba chen po tsam las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don to //
translated: Therefore, consciousness does not arise from the mere great elements is the point of the passage.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas kyang /
translated: In another way,

original: lus dang sems tha mi dad pa sun dbyung pa'i don du /
analyzed: lus dang sems tha mi dad pa sun dbyung pa'i don du /
translated: in order to refute the nondifference of body and mind,

original: gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, moreover.

original: rdul phra rab so sor rig par thal lo zhes bya ba ni gcig la rdul phra rab kyi grangs tsam gyi sems yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab so sor rig par thal lo zhes bya ba ni gcig la rdul phra rab kyi grangs tsam gyi sems yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It follows that the subtle atoms are cognized individually, because the mind would be as numerous as the number of subtle atoms in one.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i rang bzhin du'o //üîΩdmigs pa yin na zhes bya ba ni gtan @118b tshigs kyi tshig ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba'i rig pa'i rang bzhin du'o // dmigs pa yin na zhes bya ba ni gtan @118b tshigs kyi tshig ste /
translated: In that way, means in the nature of cognition.üîΩIf it is an object, means a reason.

original: gang gi phyir dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dmigs pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is an object, is the meaning.

original: rdul phra rab rnams ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pas na //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pas na //
translated: But the atoms are not perceived.

original: de dag ni rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not the nature of cognition.

original: snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de lta na yang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: Even so, the atoms are perceived. This is the connection.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de rdul phra rab dag la gnas pa'i phyir te 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rdul phra rab dag la gnas pa'i phyir te 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are based on the atoms, because they are assembled.

original: de lta na yang de dag de ltar ci ste thal snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang de dag de ltar ci ste thal snyam na /
translated: Even so, why is it not accepted that they are like that?

original: rdul phra rab la reg las te //
analyzed: rdul phra rab la reg las te //
translated: From the contact of the atoms.

original: rgyu'i dngos po nyid du brten pas te de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos po nyid du brten pas te de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are based on the atoms as the cause, for that reason.

original: gtan tshigs 'di gnyis kyis ni rdul phra rab rnams 'du ba can gyi rgyur brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di gnyis kyis ni rdul phra rab rnams 'du ba can gyi rgyur brjod pa yin no //
translated: By these two reasons, it is said that the atoms are the cause of the assembled.

original: des na de dag rig par byed pa ma yin na //
analyzed: des na de dag rig par byed pa ma yin na //
translated: Therefore, they are not the nature of cognition.

original: yan lag can de rig pa yin par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: yan lag can de rig pa yin par ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could that which has parts be cognition?

original: 'du ba can gyi rgyu'i yon tan ni 'bras bu'i rdzas kyi yon tan rtsom par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du ba can gyi rgyu'i yon tan ni 'bras bu'i rdzas kyi yon tan rtsom par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The quality of the cause of the composite is the beginning of the quality of the substance of the effect.

original: skud pa dkar po la 'dus pa'i snam bu ni dmar por rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skud pa dkar po la 'dus pa'i snam bu ni dmar por rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that a red cloth should be the composite of white threads.

original: des na yan lag can khas blangs kyang thal bar 'gyur ba ni bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: des na yan lag can khas blangs kyang thal bar 'gyur ba ni bzlog par dka'o //
translated: Therefore, even if one accepts the whole, it is difficult to avoid the absurd consequence.

original: gnas pa'i 'du ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i 'du ba'o //
translated: The composite of the enduring.

original: 'dis ni rdul phra rab rnams rgyu ba tsam yin gyi //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdul phra rab rnams rgyu ba tsam yin gyi //
translated: This is a mere movement of the atoms.

original: 'du ba can gyi rgyu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du ba can gyi rgyu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is not the cause of the composite.

original: 'bras bu rgyu tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the effect merely follow the cause,

original: thags mkhan dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: thags mkhan dang snam bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a weaver and cloth, etc.

original: des na ji skad brjod pa'i thal ba med de /
analyzed: des na ji skad brjod pa'i thal ba med de /
translated: Therefore, the stated absurd consequence does not arise.

original: 'on 'du ba can gyi rgyu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on 'du ba can gyi rgyu gang yin zhe na /
translated: But what is the cause of the composite?

original: gdon mi za bar gzhan gyi lugs kyi rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar gzhan gyi lugs kyi rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: One should not necessarily follow the system of others.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: If that is so,

original: gal te 'di 'dra ba rgyu 'jug na de'i tshe rdul phra rab rnams las yan lag can gyi rdzas skyes so zhes ci ltar rtogs te //
analyzed: gal te 'di 'dra ba rgyu 'jug na de'i tshe rdul phra rab rnams las yan lag can gyi rdzas skyes so zhes ci ltar rtogs te //
translated: If such a cause were to operate, then how could one understand that a whole substance arises from subtle particles?

original: de dag ni shes pa ma yin pa nyid kyi rang las yan lag can skyes par rtogs mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni shes pa ma yin pa nyid kyi rang las yan lag can skyes par rtogs mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not consciousnesses, they cannot understand that a whole arises from themselves.

original: yan lag can gyi rang bzhin gyi rig pa gzhan du gyur pas rig par 'gyur na /
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rang bzhin gyi rig pa gzhan du gyur pas rig par 'gyur na /
translated: If a whole were to be known by the transformation of a knowing nature,

original: de yang ma yin no zhes rang rig pa ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩshes pa nyid kyi rang rig pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang ma yin no zhes rang rig pa ni zhes bya ba'o // shes pa nyid kyi rang rig pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would not be so, as it is said, ‚Äúself-knowing.‚ÄùüîΩBecause it does not go beyond being consciousness itself, self-knowing.

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pa las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because it does not go beyond self-awareness.

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pa'i dbang @119a * //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pa'i dbang @119a * //
translated: By the power of self-awareness,

original: gis rang gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi ni gtam yang rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gis rang gsal bar rtogs par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi ni gtam yang rig pa ma yin no //
translated: one realizes self-illumination, but the other does not even know the story.

original: des na yan lag can rig pa'i rang bzhin yin yang rang nyid rdul phra rab dag las skye bar rig par ji ltar shes /
analyzed: des na yan lag can rig pa'i rang bzhin yin yang rang nyid rdul phra rab dag las skye bar rig par ji ltar shes /
translated: Therefore, even though the whole has the nature of being known, how can one know that it itself arises from subtle particles?

original: 'di mi bzod pas gzhan 'on te //
analyzed: 'di mi bzod pas gzhan 'on te //
translated: But this is not acceptable, so he says, Or else, how is it known?

original: zhes smras so// des na rang rig gi rig pa'i phyogs la brjod pa ni nyes pa med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes smras so// des na rang rig gi rig pa'i phyogs la brjod pa ni nyes pa med do snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that there is no fault in stating the position of reflexive awareness.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni de lta na yang yan lag can gyis rang nyid rdul phra rab rnams las skyes par shes par nus zhes bya ba'i sun 'byin pa gzhag nas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni de lta na yang yan lag can gyis rang nyid rdul phra rab rnams las skyes par shes par nus zhes bya ba'i sun 'byin pa gzhag nas /
translated: However, the conclusion is that, having presented the refutation, In that case, the whole is able to know itself as arisen from the atoms,

original: tshul chung ngus rang rig pa nyid do zhes bya bas bsgrubs pa ni /
analyzed: tshul chung ngus rang rig pa nyid do zhes bya bas bsgrubs pa ni /
translated: the opponent proves with the statement, It is reflexive awareness itself.

original: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Then, Well, how is it known?

original: sngon po myong ba las sngon po ltar /
analyzed: sngon po myong ba las sngon po ltar /
translated: Just as blue is known from the experience of blue,

original: bde ba yang bde ba nyams su myong ba las logs su gzhan dang thun mong du gyur ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba yang bde ba nyams su myong ba las logs su gzhan dang thun mong du gyur ba ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, pleasure is not at all something different and common to the experience of pleasure.

original: kho bo cag gi bde ba ni 'di nyid de /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi bde ba ni 'di nyid de /
translated: The thought is, Our pleasure is precisely this,

original: sim par rig pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sim par rig pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: what is called the awareness of comfort.

original: gzhan 'dod pa tsam smra ba ni gzhan du gyur ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'dod pa tsam smra ba ni gzhan du gyur ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The statement, It is merely the assertion of others, is the response.

original: bde ba de ltar te /üîΩrig pa can rnams kyi ltar na ni bdag gi yon tan yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: bde ba de ltar te / rig pa can rnams kyi ltar na ni bdag gi yon tan yin pa'i phyir na /

analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba can gyi rnam par rig pa yin no //

original: thun mong du sun 'byin pa brjod pa ni /

original: des na de nyid rig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rig par mthong ngo //
analyzed: des na de nyid rig pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rig par mthong ngo //
translated: then it is not the case that the self is not perceived.üîΩThe opponent‚Äôs position

original: gal te gang la byed pa po'i chos /
analyzed: gal te gang la byed pa po'i chos /
translated: If the self is not aware of itself,üîΩthen it is not the case that the self is aware of objects.üîΩThe refutation of the opponent‚Äôs positionüîΩIf the self is aware of itself,üîΩthen it is not the case

original: rig pa'i byed pa rnam par gnas pa rig par byed pa ni rig bzhin pa de gnyis las gzhan kho na ma yin nam snyam du dogs pa la /
analyzed: rig pa'i byed pa rnam par gnas pa rig par byed pa ni rig bzhin pa de gnyis las gzhan kho na ma yin nam snyam du dogs pa la /
translated: The activity of awareness is the awareness-qua-experiencing. Is it not the case that it is something other than those two?

original: gzhan du gyur ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIt is a transformation.

original: nges par brtags bzhin pa'i rig par byed pa la ltos nas gzhan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nges par brtags bzhin pa'i rig par byed pa la ltos nas gzhan du gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù It is a transformation in dependence upon the awareness-qua-experiencing that is being investigated.

original: rig pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is awareness‚Äù means because it is manifest.

original: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: @119b gal te de dag gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: @119b gal te de dag gsal ba yin na /
translated: If they are manifest,

original: de tsam gyis rig par byed pa'i tha snyad rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de tsam gyis rig par byed pa'i tha snyad rdzogs pa'i phyir /
translated: then the convention of awareness-qua-experiencing is complete just with that.

original: rig par byed pa gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: rig par byed pa gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: What is the use of another awareness-qua-experiencing?

original: rdza ma la rdza mkhan bzhin du /
analyzed: rdza ma la rdza mkhan bzhin du /
translated: Just as the potter is the maker of the pot,

original: rig par byed pa tha dad pa'i byed pa yang tshad mas grub pa ni med do //
analyzed: rig par byed pa tha dad pa'i byed pa yang tshad mas grub pa ni med do //
translated: there is no proof by means of a valid cognition of a different activity of awareness.

original: de 'dra ba rtogs na ni rtog pa mthar thug par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba rtogs na ni rtog pa mthar thug par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one understands it in that way, then the investigation would not come to an end.

original: lus nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: lus nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the body itself,üîΩthen what is the use of another awareness-qua-experiencing?

original: zhes bya ba tshu rol mdzes pa pa'i dogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba tshu rol mdzes pa pa'i dogs pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the objection of the LokƒÅyatas is this:

original: rdza ma la rdza mkhan ltar /
analyzed: rdza ma la rdza mkhan ltar /
translated: Just as a potter is seen to engage in making a pot,

original: rig pa la yang lus nyid byed par 'jug par dmigs so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa la yang lus nyid byed par 'jug par dmigs so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: so too awareness is seen to engage in making the body.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dgag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the reply.

original: bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa ma gtogs pa ni lus zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa ma gtogs pa ni lus zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Apart from pleasure, blue, etc., there is no such thing as a body.

original: bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa de ni dmigs par bya ba nyid du nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba dang sngon po la sogs pa de ni dmigs par bya ba nyid du nges pa'i phyir /
translated: And since pleasure, blue, etc. are ascertained to be objects of awareness,

original: dmigs byed nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs byed nyid ma yin no //
translated: they are not awareness itself.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir zhes 'brel to //
translated: Since that is so, it follows that

original: de lta nyid ces bya ba ni dmigs par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta nyid ces bya ba ni dmigs par byed pa nyid do //
translated: ‚Äújust that‚Äù is the object of awareness.

original: dbang po ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The sense faculty is not the object of awareness, he thinks.

original: bong ba zhes bya ba ni len no //
analyzed: bong ba zhes bya ba ni len no //
translated: ‚ÄúA clod‚Äù means to pick up.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni dmigs byed nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni dmigs byed nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means that it is the object of awareness.

original: shin tu bskal pa nyid kyis na 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa ltar med par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu bskal pa nyid kyis na 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa ltar med par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is utterly nonexistent, like the other world, etc.

original: de nus dngos na zhes bya ba ni dbang po'o //
analyzed: de nus dngos na zhes bya ba ni dbang po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat capacity‚Äù refers to the sense-faculties.

original: ma rtogs par de ma shes par nus pa de ci ltar na /
analyzed: ma rtogs par de ma shes par nus pa de ci ltar na /
translated: How can that capacity be known if it is not perceived?

original: de ltar zhes bya bar yod par 'gyur pa de ma thag pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya bar yod par 'gyur pa de ma thag pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa rnam par 'grel pa ni mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The commentary on the immediately preceding verse is ‚Äúthe eye, etc.‚Äù

original: dngos po kun gyi nus pa ni //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi nus pa ni //
translated: The capacity of all things

original: 'bras bu'i don gyis go ba'i yul //üîΩzhes bya ba'i bsam pas smra ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i don gyis go ba'i yul // zhes bya ba'i bsam pas smra ba ni /
translated: is known by the fact of their effects.üîΩThe idea is that the capacity of the sense-faculties is known by the fact of their effects.

original: 'bras bu'i sgo nas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sgo nas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúeffects‚Äù refers to the fact that the sense-faculties are the causes of the effects.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa las khyad par yod pa bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa las khyad par yod pa bsams pa'o //
translated: The idea is that the sense-faculties are distinguished from the other world, etc.

original: lan ni de dag gi 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni de dag gi 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚Äútheir effects.‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa de dag gi'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa de dag gi'o //
translated: The effects of the eye, etc.

original: gzhan gyis bde ba la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bde ba la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa'i zhes smras so //
translated: The other party has said that the objects of pleasure, etc. and form, etc. are perceived.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //üîΩdmigs pa ni shes pa yin la de yang khyod kyi lta bas nus @120a * //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni lan no // dmigs pa ni shes pa yin la de yang khyod kyi lta bas nus @120a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the reply.

original: pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin no //
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin no //
translated: The object is consciousness, and that is only the nature of the capacity according to your theory.

original: des na ma dmigs pa de las mig la sogs pa ci ltar 'grub /
analyzed: des na ma dmigs pa de las mig la sogs pa ci ltar 'grub /
translated: Therefore, how can the eye, etc. be established from that non-apprehension?

original: gang gi phyir de ltar mig la sogs pa dang / dmigs pa'i nus pa yang dmigs pa ma yin pa des na lhag mar gyur bas gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar mig la sogs pa dang / dmigs pa'i nus pa yang dmigs pa ma yin pa des na lhag mar gyur bas gzugs la sogs pa dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the eye, etc. and the capacity of the object are not apprehended in this way, therefore, since they remain, form, etc. are the objects.

original: de dag nyid las rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis nus pa nges par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de dag nyid las rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis nus pa nges par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that the capacity is ascertained by the characteristic of consciousness from those very objects,

original: de dag ni zhes bya ba gsungs so //üîΩgang gis dbang po nyid bde ba la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa dag las logs zhig tu rig par byed pa nyid yin par brtags pa rnam par shes pa'i nus pa gang las dbang po nges par 'gyur ba de dag ni rnam par shes pa'i 'bras
analyzed: de dag ni zhes bya ba gsungs so // gang gis dbang po nyid bde ba la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa dag las logs zhig tu rig par byed pa nyid yin par brtags pa rnam par shes pa'i nus pa gang las dbang po nges par 'gyur ba de dag ni rnam par shes pa'i 'bras
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThose are not the effect of consciousness.‚Äù

original: bu ma yin no //
analyzed: bu ma yin no //
translated: Since the eye, etc. are imagined to be the capacity that is known separately from pleasure, etc. and form, etc., from what capacity of consciousness would the eye, etc. be ascertained? Those are not the effect of consciousness.

original: 'o na ni gang las dngos su mig la sogs pa nges par 'gyur ba gzugs la sogs pa nyid ni mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro snyam nas mig la sogs pa'i zhes gsungs so //üîΩsnga na ni mig la sogs pa'i byed pa las so //
analyzed: 'o na ni gang las dngos su mig la sogs pa nges par 'gyur ba gzugs la sogs pa nyid ni mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro snyam nas mig la sogs pa'i zhes gsungs so // snga na ni mig la sogs pa'i byed pa las so //
translated: But if the eye and so on are not the effect of form and so on, then form and so on would be the effect of the eye and so on, since they are directly determined from the eye and so on.üîΩThe eye and so on are the cause of form and so on, since form and so on arise from the eye and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams las med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams las med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But it follows that form and so on would not exist if the eye and so on did not exist.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu la yang thal pa 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu la yang thal pa 'di nyid yin no //
translated: The same reductio applies to consciousness being the effect of form and so on.

original: de ltar ni 'dod pa ma yin no //üîΩgang gis sngar med par thal bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'dod pa ma yin no // gang gis sngar med par thal bar 'gyur ba /
translated: But that is unacceptable.üîΩIf it were unacceptable that the eye and so on would not exist if form and so on did not exist,

original: gzugs la sogs pa nyid ni rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nyid ni rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu ma yin gyi /
translated: then form and so on would not be the effect of consciousness.üîΩBut rather, a specific state is the effect of consciousness.

original: 'on kyang gnas skabs kyi khyad par yang yin no zhes bya ba dpyod pa la sogs pa dang thun mong pa'i lan /
analyzed: 'on kyang gnas skabs kyi khyad par yang yin no zhes bya ba dpyod pa la sogs pa dang thun mong pa'i lan /
translated: This is the response that is shared with the Vaise~ika and so on.

original: rig pa gzhan gang yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnod par byed pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: rig pa gzhan gang yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnod par byed pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The objection that this is unacceptable is anticipated with But what other awareness could there be?

original: dmigs pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe occasion of the object‚Äù is the occasion of the object of perception.

original: lan ni rdul phra rab so sor zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rdul phra rab so sor zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe individual atoms‚Äù are the atoms of the object.

original: phyis don la gnas pa la ni /
analyzed: phyis don la gnas pa la ni /
translated: Later, when the object is present,

original: yan lag can gzhan mi 'thad pa rdul phra rab rnams nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: yan lag can gzhan mi 'thad pa rdul phra rab rnams nyid yod pa yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: the existence of the atoms is not tenable, because the existence of the parts is not tenable.

original: mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i gnas skabs ni rdul phra rab dag las tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i gnas skabs ni rdul phra rab dag las tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The occasion of the perception of the effect, such as the eye, is not different from the atoms.

original: rdul phra rab mtha' dag gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab mtha' dag gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all the atoms would be perceived.

original: des na rang rig gi rang bzhin du rdul phra rab so sor dmigs par thal lo //
analyzed: des na rang rig gi rang bzhin du rdul phra rab so sor dmigs par thal lo //
translated: Therefore, it follows that the individual atoms would be perceived as the nature of self-awareness.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir na rig par byed pa'i tha dad pa'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i gnas skabs ni yod pa ma yin no @120b snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na rig par byed pa'i tha dad pa'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i gnas skabs ni yod pa ma yin no @120b snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the occasion of the perception of the effect, which is different from the awareness, does not exist.üîΩThis is the intended meaning.

original: 'di'i phyir yang 'bras bu ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang 'bras bu ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The following is also stated to show that the effect does not exist:

original: khyad par med pa'o ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'o ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout distinction‚Äù means without difference.

original: snga ma kho na bzhin du gnas pa'i yul la ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma kho na bzhin du gnas pa'i yul la ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But in the case of an object that remains just as it was before, there is no such thing as a difference in state.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa la ni khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa la ni khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is the system that without arising and destruction, there is no difference.

original: khyad par srid par ni khas blang bar byar yang mi rigs so zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par srid par ni khas blang bar byar yang mi rigs so zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: And it is not right to accept that there could be a difference.

original: khyad par yod na ni rang nyid rig par thal lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par yod na ni rang nyid rig par thal lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For if there were, it would follow, absurdly, that it would be reflexive awareness.

original: sngar gyi bems po'i rang bzhin spangs pa'i phyir gsal bar skyes pa yul yin pas na rang rig par skyes pa yin no shes bya ba nyid brjod par gyur la /
analyzed: sngar gyi bems po'i rang bzhin spangs pa'i phyir gsal bar skyes pa yul yin pas na rang rig par skyes pa yin no shes bya ba nyid brjod par gyur la /
translated: Since it has abandoned the previous nature of being inanimate, it is clear that it has arisen as an object, and so it is said that it has arisen as reflexive awareness.

original: de lta na yang de nyid shes pa yin gyi de las shes pa gzhan rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang de nyid shes pa yin gyi de las shes pa gzhan rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But even so, it is just that which is the consciousness, and it is not the case that another consciousness is inferred from it.

original: de ltar khyad par gzhan ma yin pa'i phyogs la nyes pa brjod nas tha dad pa'i phyogs la nyes pa brjod pa'i don du gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar byed pa ni nus pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar khyad par gzhan ma yin pa'i phyogs la nyes pa brjod nas tha dad pa'i phyogs la nyes pa brjod pa'i don du gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar byed pa ni nus pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having thus stated the faults in the position that there is no other difference, in order to state the faults in the position that there is a difference, he anticipates an objection:

original: rnam par shes pa'i nus pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i nus pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf the object is different from consciousness, it is not tenable that it is the cause of consciousness.‚Äù

original: tshu rol mdzes pa po'i ltar na ni nus pa'i sgra gtso bor yin la /
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa po'i ltar na ni nus pa'i sgra gtso bor yin la /
translated: According to the LokƒÅyatas, the word ‚Äúpotential‚Äù is primary,

original: lugs gzhan gyi ltar na ni shes pa dang lhan cig pa la rtogs par bya ba'o ;
analyzed: lugs gzhan gyi ltar na ni shes pa dang lhan cig pa la rtogs par bya ba'o ;
translated: but according to other systems, it should be understood as ‚Äúarisen together with consciousness.‚Äù

original: / shes pa dang yul da ltar skyes pa shes bya ba nyid khyad par yin no //
analyzed: / shes pa dang yul da ltar skyes pa shes bya ba nyid khyad par yin no //
translated: The object that is arisen together with consciousness is the difference.

original: des na yul rang rig par thal ba ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na yul rang rig par thal ba ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is not the case that consciousness is necessarily reflexive awareness.

original: de lta na ni 'o na shes pa skye ba dang lhan cig pa'i yul gyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par tha dad pa shes pa grub pa'i sgrub byed yin na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na shes pa skye ba dang lhan cig pa'i yul gyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par tha dad pa shes pa grub pa'i sgrub byed yin na /
translated: If that is so, then the difference in the state of the object that is arisen together with the arising of consciousness is the proof of the establishment of consciousness.

original: shes pa ma grub par ni shes pa skye ba dang bcas par 'grub pa ma yin no snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: shes pa ma grub par ni shes pa skye ba dang bcas par 'grub pa ma yin no snyam du bsams nas /
translated: He thinks that consciousness is not established as having arising, since consciousness is not established.

original: de ni mi rigs te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat is not reasonable.‚Äù

original: der zhes bya ba ni lan cig pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni lan cig pa nyid du'o //
translated: ‚Äú There‚Äù means ‚Äúat one time.‚Äù

original: ma grub pa zhes bya ba nus pa dang lhan cig pa nyid ma grub na'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa zhes bya ba nus pa dang lhan cig pa nyid ma grub na'o //
translated: ‚Äú Not established‚Äù means ‚Äúnot established as having the capacity.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù is a conclusion.

original: rang rig pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang rig pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang rig pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Self-awareness‚Äù means ‚Äúnot self-awareness.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid brtan par byed pa smras pa ni rnam par shes pa bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brtan par byed pa smras pa ni rnam par shes pa bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He states this very point in a firm way: ‚ÄúConsciousness is pleasure, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te shes pa 'di 'du ba'i sgrub par byed pa can nam /üîΩrang gis byas pa yin grang de la rang gis byas pa yin na ni thun mong ma yin @121a * //
analyzed: gal te shes pa 'di 'du ba'i sgrub par byed pa can nam / rang gis byas pa yin grang de la rang gis byas pa yin na ni thun mong ma yin @121a * //
translated: If this consciousness is a proof of collection,

original: pa nyid kyis tha dad pa med pa'i sgrub byed ma yin no //
analyzed: pa nyid kyis tha dad pa med pa'i sgrub byed ma yin no //
translated: or if it is self-made, then it is not a proof of non-difference, since it is not shared.

original: 'jig rten ni bde ba zhe'am sdug bsngal gyi gzugs kyi sgra'i shes ba zhes rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni bde ba zhe'am sdug bsngal gyi gzugs kyi sgra'i shes ba zhes rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The world understands that the form of pleasure or pain is the consciousness of sound.

original: yang na rtogs pa 'dir 'gyur mod /
analyzed: yang na rtogs pa 'dir 'gyur mod /
translated: Or else, this realization is just so.

original: de lta na yang skyes bu dbyug pa zhes bya ba bzhin du tha dad pa la yang 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang skyes bu dbyug pa zhes bya ba bzhin du tha dad pa la yang 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: Even if that is so, it is still different, like a person with a stick.

original: 'di la bshad pa ni gzhi mthun pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa ni gzhi mthun pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation here is ‚Äúcommon basis.‚Äù

original: gtso bo ma yin pa bkag pa na ci nas kyang gzhi mthun pa gtso bo nyid du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo ma yin pa bkag pa na ci nas kyang gzhi mthun pa gtso bo nyid du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When the non-primary is negated, in order to make the common basis become primary in every way.

original: gtso bo dang btags pa'i dbye ba las gzhan med ces bshad do //
analyzed: gtso bo dang btags pa'i dbye ba las gzhan med ces bshad do //
translated: It is explained that there is nothing other than the distinction of primary and secondary.

original: dper brjod pa gnyis ni ci rigs par yin no //
analyzed: dper brjod pa gnyis ni ci rigs par yin no //
translated: The two examples are appropriate as they are.

original: de la gtso bo ma yin pa 'gog pa ni /
analyzed: de la gtso bo ma yin pa 'gog pa ni /
translated: Regarding that, the negation of the non-primary is:

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is said.

original: de ni zhes bya ba gtso bo ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba gtso bo ma yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is if it is not primary.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba bde ba shes par bya ba 'dir ni ci'i phyir ma grub snyam na /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba bde ba shes par bya ba 'dir ni ci'i phyir ma grub snyam na /
translated: Here, if one wonders why it is not established in this understanding of pleasure,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said ‚Äúfrom the nature of form and so on.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni gal te yang 'jig rten phal cher gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad mi byed pa de lta na yang rnam par dpyod pa dang ldan pa'i tha snyad yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dis ni gal te yang 'jig rten phal cher gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad mi byed pa de lta na yang rnam par dpyod pa dang ldan pa'i tha snyad yod pa nyid de /
translated: This shows that even though the world in general does not make the conventional designation of a common locus, there is a conventional designation of a common locus for those who are endowed with analysis.

original: rnam par dpyod ba dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten la 'du ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rtogs pa 'di ni yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod ba dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten la 'du ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rtogs pa 'di ni yod pa ma yin pa kho na ste //
translated: For those who are endowed with analysis, this cognition of a common locus is simply non-existent,

original: rang gi gzhung lugs tsam du zad pa'i phyir rtsod pa dang po yang thag bsring ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi gzhung lugs tsam du zad pa'i phyir rtsod pa dang po yang thag bsring ba yin no //
translated: because it is merely their own system. The first objection is also refuted.

original: gzhan gyi dpe 'di nyid kyis zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dpe 'di nyid kyis zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBy this very example of the other . . .‚Äù

original: khre'u 'bod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: khre'u 'bod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the example of the blue lotus.

original: gang gzhi mthun pa de ni tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gang gzhi mthun pa de ni tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid de /
translated: That which is a common locus is characterized by a different cause.

original: dper na skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like ‚Äúperson.‚Äù

original: autpala sngon po zhes bya ba la yang 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa'i yod pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: autpala sngon po zhes bya ba la yang 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa'i yod pa yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is also thought that the existence of a different cause of application is in the case of ‚Äúblue lotus.‚Äù

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the refutation.

original: rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thun mong gis ma nges pa nyid kyis na'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thun mong gis ma nges pa nyid kyis na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no inference‚Äù means that the reason is not established.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni grangs can pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni grangs can pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The same point is expressed by the words ‚Äúthe SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say. . . .‚Äù

original: lugs 'di ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: lugs 'di ni mi rigs te /
translated: This system is unreasonable.

original: sems pa dang ldan pas sems pa can du rigs ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sems pa dang ldan pas sems pa can du rigs ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is reasonable to say that a sentient being is so-called because it possesses mind.

original: re zhig 'di 'dra ba'i dag gis tha snyad la tha dad pa la mi ltos pa'i gzhi mthun pa ni mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba nyid du skabs su bab pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di 'dra ba'i dag gis tha snyad la tha dad pa la mi ltos pa'i gzhi mthun pa ni mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba nyid du skabs su bab pa yin no //
translated: First, it is appropriate to say that a common locus is seen that is qualified by such things as ‚Äúbeing a knowable object‚Äù without relying on a distinction.

original: 'on te 'thad pa'i @121b khyad par can gzhi mthun pa'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: 'on te 'thad pa'i @121b khyad par can gzhi mthun pa'i rgyu yin na /
translated: But if the reason is a common locus that is qualified by a valid cognition,

original: 'o na ni ci srid tha dad pa'i shes pa ma grub pa de srid du 'thad pa nyid ma yin la //
analyzed: 'o na ni ci srid tha dad pa'i shes pa ma grub pa de srid du 'thad pa nyid ma yin la //
translated: then as long as the cognition of the distinction is not established, the reason is not established.

original: ci srid 'thad pa nyid ma yin pa de srid du yang tha dad pa'i shes pa ma grub pa'i phyir phan tshun brten pas na gtan tshigs khyad par ma grub par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ci srid 'thad pa nyid ma yin pa de srid du yang tha dad pa'i shes pa ma grub pa'i phyir phan tshun brten pas na gtan tshigs khyad par ma grub par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: As long as it is not tenable, then also the difference of cognition is not established, and so, because of mutual dependence, the reason is not established as a property of the subject.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar rigs pa ni de ltar khas blang bar rung ba nyid kyis khyad par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar rigs pa ni de ltar khas blang bar rung ba nyid kyis khyad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù and so on express the difference by the mere suitability of the assertion.

original: dper na zla ba sngon po nyid du rig pa'i sngon po'i bzhin no zhes dpe ni zla ba kho na'o //
analyzed: dper na zla ba sngon po nyid du rig pa'i sngon po'i bzhin no zhes dpe ni zla ba kho na'o //
translated: The example is the moon itself, as in the case of the cognition of the moon as blue.

original: phyogs kyi chos nye bar sdud pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nye bar sdud pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement of the inclusion of the property of the position is

original: goms las zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde ltar gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni gsal bzhin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid la rig pa gnas par shes par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: goms las zhes bya ba'o // de ltar gyur pa'i gzugs la sogs pas zhes bya ba ni gsal bzhin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid la rig pa gnas par shes par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: ‚Äúfrom habituation.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement of the example is ‚Äújust as, for example, in the case of the cognition of the moon as blue.‚ÄùüîΩThe statement of the application is ‚Äúin the same way, the cognition of form and so on.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa la ni rang gi ngo bor gyur pa nyid rig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la ni rang gi ngo bor gyur pa nyid rig pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement of the conclusion is ‚Äútherefore, the cognition of form and so on is not established as a property of the subject.‚Äù

original: des na gzugs la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bor gyur pa nyid rig par khas blang bar bya'o zhes tshad ma'i 'bras bu dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: des na gzugs la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bor gyur pa nyid rig par khas blang bar bya'o zhes tshad ma'i 'bras bu dpag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the result of valid knowledge should be inferred as follows: ‚ÄúForm and so on are asserted to be the nature of reflexive awareness.‚Äù

original: gal te yongs su mthong bzhin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: gal te yongs su mthong bzhin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: If form and so on that are being fully seen are the nature of reflexive awareness,

original: 'o na ni de'i gzhan de ltar mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de'i gzhan de ltar mi rigs te /
translated: then it is not reasonable for them to be other than that.

original: rig pa de'i rang bzhin yin pas na der zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa de'i rang bzhin yin pas na der zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the nature of that awareness, they are included in that.

original: rnam pa med pa'i sems gzhan nyid yin na ni ma long ba bzhin du khyad par thams cad la reg par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i sems gzhan nyid yin na ni ma long ba bzhin du khyad par thams cad la reg par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If the mind that lacks aspects is different, then like one who is not blind, it would contact all differences.

original: gzugs sogs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzugs sogs zhes gsungs so //
translated: Form and so on are said to be the nature of consciousness.

original: 'pho ba ni 'dre ba ste /
analyzed: 'pho ba ni 'dre ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTransference‚Äù means mixing.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means ‚Äúengaging in the nature of that.‚Äù

original: 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las she na /
translated: Why is that?

original: goms pa las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: goms pa las zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is due to habituation.

original: yongs su mthong bzhin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rang rig pa yang sngon gyi bag chags kyi stobs nyid las yin pas gzhan la yang de 'gyur ba gang gis zlog par byed pa rnam pa med pa gzhan gyis yod kyang dngos po la ci zhig byung na /
analyzed: yongs su mthong bzhin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i rang rig pa yang sngon gyi bag chags kyi stobs nyid las yin pas gzhan la yang de 'gyur ba gang gis zlog par byed pa rnam pa med pa gzhan gyis yod kyang dngos po la ci zhig byung na /
translated: What would stop it from occurring in others? Even though the nonexistence of aspects exists, what would happen to the thing?

original: gang gis de gsal bar 'gyur dper na dngos po med pa yod kyang dngos po la ci yang ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gis de gsal bar 'gyur dper na dngos po med pa yod kyang dngos po la ci yang ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even though the nonexistence of a thing is not a thing, what would happen to the thing?üîΩThis is also analyzed in the following lines:

original: 'di yang / gal te sdo sogs gsal ba ni //
analyzed: 'di yang / gal te sdo sogs gsal ba ni //
translated: If the clarity of blue and so on

original: khyed la rnams gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: khyed la rnams gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: is due to something else for you,

original: 'on te sdo sogs mi gsal na /
analyzed: 'on te sdo sogs mi gsal na /
translated: then if blue and so on are not clear,

original: khyed la rnams gzhan gyis ci bya //üîΩzhes dpyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyed la rnams gzhan gyis ci bya // zhes dpyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: what would something else do for you?

original: 'o na phyi'i don la gnas nas dpyod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir na /üîΩci ltar goms pa las @122a * //
analyzed: 'o na phyi'i don la gnas nas dpyod pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir na / ci ltar goms pa las @122a * //
translated: Well then, since this is the context of analyzing external objects,

original: zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: zhes brjod ce na /
translated: why do you say, ‚Äúdue to habituation‚Äù?

original: bag chags kyi nus pa ni rnam pa tsam la yin te /
analyzed: bag chags kyi nus pa ni rnam pa tsam la yin te /
translated: The potency of latent propensities is merely an aspect.

original: don med pa'i shes pa la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa'i shes pa la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is also seen in cognitions that have no object.

original: gang du don yong par lhag par mos pa der ni tshogs pa khongs su gtogs pa'i don yang skyed byed dang / rang gi rnam par gtod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du don yong par lhag par mos pa der ni tshogs pa khongs su gtogs pa'i don yang skyed byed dang / rang gi rnam par gtod par byed pa yin no //
translated: Where there is a predominance of the belief in the existence of an object, the object is produced by the collection of causes and conditions and is also the transmitter of its own form.

original: zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This is the theory.

original: bag chags kyis nus pa ni de nyid kyi phyir shes pa la /
analyzed: bag chags kyis nus pa ni de nyid kyi phyir shes pa la /
translated: The capacity of the latent impressions is in the consciousness itself.

original: rigs kyi dbye ba tshad ma dang / cig shos kyis byas zhes bya ba ni mngon pa'i da rgyal gyis byas pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye ba tshad ma dang / cig shos kyis byas zhes bya ba ni mngon pa'i da rgyal gyis byas pa yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The division of the lineages of consciousness is made by the valid cognition of the Abhidharma.

original: de'i phyir de kho nar ni sna tshogs kyi rnam par ni goms pa kho na las yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho nar ni sna tshogs kyi rnam par ni goms pa kho na las yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, the variety of consciousnesses is due only to the impressions.üîΩWhen those impressions are perfected, they produce the result of omniscience.

original: goms pa de nyid rab tu son pa na skabs kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'bras bu'i mthar thug pa sgrub par byed do zhes ston pa ni rnam par shes pa dmigs pa ma gtogs par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: goms pa de nyid rab tu son pa na skabs kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i 'bras bu'i mthar thug pa sgrub par byed do zhes ston pa ni rnam par shes pa dmigs pa ma gtogs par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúApart from the object of consciousness,‚Äù etc.

original: dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi mi 'thad pas na rnam pa'i ming can rang gi cha nyid yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi mi 'thad pas na rnam pa'i ming can rang gi cha nyid yin te /
translated: Since the object is not tenable as other, it is one‚Äôs own part that has the name of aspect.

original: gang la yul gyi tha snyad du byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang la yul gyi tha snyad du byed pa'o //
translated: It is that which is conventionally designated as the object.

original: de ma gtogs par ni de dor nas so //
analyzed: de ma gtogs par ni de dor nas so //
translated: Except for that, having eliminated that,

original: gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med pa brtag pa /
analyzed: gzhan dang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med pa brtag pa /
translated: the other is the imagined absence of aspect.

original: tha dad pa dang ngo 'dre bar 'gyur ba ni de'i bdag nyid kyis 'du ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang ngo 'dre bar 'gyur ba ni de'i bdag nyid kyis 'du ba ste /
translated: The difference and the resemblance are the combination by way of its own nature.

original: de ltar na ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not like that.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gang gis shes pa zhes byis pa yan chad la grags pa'i dngos po de ni yongs su gsal bzhin pa rnam pa'i tshogs las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis shes pa zhes byis pa yan chad la grags pa'i dngos po de ni yongs su gsal bzhin pa rnam pa'i tshogs las tha dad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That thing which is known by everyone from children on up is not different from the collection of aspects that are completely manifest.

original: de ltar spyi'i tshul brjod nas khyad par la sbyor ba ni des na bde ba la dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar spyi'i tshul brjod nas khyad par la sbyor ba ni des na bde ba la dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having stated the general method in that way, the application to the distinctions is ‚ÄúTherefore, when there is pleasure,‚Äù and so on.

original: nang du yongs su gsal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nang du yongs su gsal ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is completely manifest internally,

original: thog mar brjod do //
analyzed: thog mar brjod do //
translated: it is stated first.

original: goms pa las bde ba la sogs pas rang bzhin du gyur ba'i shes pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: goms pa las bde ba la sogs pas rang bzhin du gyur ba'i shes pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Through cultivation, the consciousness that has become the nature of pleasure, etc. becomes the nature of form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dres par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni goms pa de nyid las gzugs la sogs pa thams cad kyi bdag tu gyur pa yang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang 'dres par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni goms pa de nyid las gzugs la sogs pa thams cad kyi bdag tu gyur pa yang /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit becomes mixed with form, etc.‚Äù means that through that very cultivation, all forms, etc. become the self of the self,

original: gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: and the self becomes the nature of the pleasure, etc. of others.

original: rnam pa ci zhig ltar de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i @122b don to //
analyzed: rnam pa ci zhig ltar de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i @122b don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúit becomes like that‚Äù is that it becomes like the form, etc.

original: 'di ltar phra dang rigs pa dag gis rags pa rim gyis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phra dang rigs pa dag gis rags pa rim gyis brjod pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the gross is gradually explained by the subtle.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar 'gyur snyam na /üîΩgoms pa las zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar 'gyur snyam na / goms pa las zhes bya ba nas /
translated: When does this occur?üîΩThe text says ‚Äúthrough cultivation,‚Äù etc.

original: rtogs pa nas zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa brjod do //
analyzed: rtogs pa nas zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa brjod do //
translated: up to ‚Äúthrough realization.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa mtha' dag rtogs pa ni cha 'ga' zhig gis de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa mtha' dag rtogs pa ni cha 'ga' zhig gis de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su byed par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The realization of all aspects of the happiness of others and so on should be understood as the realization of their nature by some part.

original: 'dir yang de ma yin pa las ldog pas brtags pa'i shes pa cig nyid nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: 'dir yang de ma yin pa las ldog pas brtags pa'i shes pa cig nyid nye bar bzung nas /
translated: Here, too, it is the same cognition that is imagined to be distinguished by the exclusion of what is not it.

original: shes pa de nyid 'di lta 'di ltar skyes so zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de nyid 'di lta 'di ltar skyes so zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: It is that very cognition which is said to arise in this way and in that way.

original: dper na zan de nyid tshad du zos na 'tsho bar byad la /
analyzed: dper na zan de nyid tshad du zos na 'tsho bar byad la /
