translated: For example, it is the same food that, when eaten in moderation, promotes health,

original: tshad las 'das par zos na 'chi bar byed do zhes brjod pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshad las 'das par zos na 'chi bar byed do zhes brjod pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: but when eaten excessively, causes death.

original: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs la sogs pa shes pa'i rang bzhin yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs la sogs pa shes pa'i rang bzhin yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How then? means if the nature of the cognition of form and so on is that very cognition.

original: bdag nyid kyi shes pa ni nang du yongs su gsal ba yin pas na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi shes pa ni nang du yongs su gsal ba yin pas na /
translated: Since one's own cognition is completely clear internally,

original: ci ltar phyi rol na gnas pa bzhin du min snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar phyi rol na gnas pa bzhin du min snyam na /
translated: it is not as if it were abiding externally.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is not so, he says.

original: logs shig tu gnas pa dang / gzhan 'di ni'o //
analyzed: logs shig tu gnas pa dang / gzhan 'di ni'o //
translated: It is not separate from the self, but it is not the same as the self.

original: rten la ltos pa ni lus la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: rten la ltos pa ni lus la ltos pa'o //
translated: It is dependent on the body.

original: gal te gzhan rigs pa med par ji ltar grub na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan rigs pa med par ji ltar grub na /
translated: If it is not established as separate from the self, how is it established?

original: gang gis rang gi ngo bor rig pa la logs shig tu gnas pa'i dang mi gnas pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod snyam na /
analyzed: gang gis rang gi ngo bor rig pa la logs shig tu gnas pa'i dang mi gnas pa yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is not possible that the self and the self‚Äôs pleasure exist separately, since the self is known by its own nature,

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pa las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pa las zhes gsungs so //
translated: we reply: Pleasure is not known by the self by its own nature.

original: gzhan gyis rig na ni de las phyi rol du gyur pa logs su gnas pa bzhin du rig par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rig na ni de las phyi rol du gyur pa logs su gnas pa bzhin du rig par 'gyur na /
translated: If it were known by another, it would be known as separate from the self, just as something else is.

original: de ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de /
translated: But that is not tenable.

original: gang gi phyir rang gi ngo bor gyur ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de las ma gtogs par bde ba la sogs pa rig pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni zhes bshad ma thag pa yin la 'chad par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi ngo bor gyur ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de las ma gtogs par bde ba la sogs pa rig pa'i rnam pa gzhan ni zhes bshad ma thag pa yin la 'chad par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Because, as was just explained and will be explained, the aspect of pleasure is not different from the aspect that is the self‚Äôs own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pa des na ci ltar logs shig na gnas pa med pa de bzhin du de la ltos pa logs shig tu gnas pa ma yin pa yang cung zad yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pa des na ci ltar logs shig na gnas pa med pa de bzhin du de la ltos pa logs shig tu gnas pa ma yin pa yang cung zad yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since its own nature is awareness, it does not exist separately. In the same way, that which depends on it does not exist separately.

original: rnam par dbye ba 'di mthong ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba 'di mthong ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt this distinction seen?

original: de ci ltar de skad brjod snyam na /
analyzed: de ci ltar de skad brjod snyam na /
translated: How can it be said in that way?

original: lus kyi rten la ltos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lus kyi rten la ltos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚Äúin dependence on the support of the body,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i shes pa'i char gyur pa lus nyid rten yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i shes pa'i char gyur pa lus nyid rten yin no //
translated: Thus, the body itself, which is a part of the desired consciousness, is the support.

original: rnam par ma dpyad pa gzhan dag lus kyi rten la ltos nas zhes bya ba 'di mi bzod pa ste /üîΩsmra ba la ni gal te @123a * //
analyzed: rnam par ma dpyad pa gzhan dag lus kyi rten la ltos nas zhes bya ba 'di mi bzod pa ste / smra ba la ni gal te @123a * //
translated: Without analysis, others cannot tolerate the statement, ‚Äúin dependence on the support of the body.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In speech, it is said, ‚Äúif . . .‚Äù

original: de'i rang bzhin ni ltos par 'dod pa gzugs dang / bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni ltos par 'dod pa gzugs dang / bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Its nature is the nature of form, pleasure, and so on, which are asserted to be dependent.

original: rig pa ni chos kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rig pa ni chos kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Awareness is the characteristic of phenomena.

original: de med pa ni phan tshun ltos pa zhes bya ba'i chos yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de med pa ni phan tshun ltos pa zhes bya ba'i chos yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If that does not exist, the phenomenon called ‚Äúmutual dependence‚Äù does not exist.

original: gang gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por 'gyur ;
analyzed: gang gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por 'gyur ;
translated: What is the nature of that which is the object of the act of apprehending?

original: de'i rang bzhin ni rig pa nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni rig pa nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: The nature of that is the existence of awareness itself.

original: snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: ci ltar ltos pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar ltos pa med ce na /
translated: How is it that it is not dependent?

original: de'i rang bzhin rig pa las zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin rig pa las zhes smras so //
translated: It is said that its nature is awareness.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnag gi ngo bo rig pa las logs shig tu gyur pa'i ltos pa ni shes pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rnag gi ngo bo rig pa las logs shig tu gyur pa'i ltos pa ni shes pa med do //
translated: Because the nature of form, etc., is not a different object of awareness than the nature of awareness itself, there is no awareness that is dependent.

original: snang bzhin pa nyid kyis rang dbang du gyur pa gnyis la 'ga' zhig ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: snang bzhin pa nyid kyis rang dbang du gyur pa gnyis la 'ga' zhig ltos pa yin la /
translated: That which is dependent is either that which is independent due to appearing as it is or that which is made dependent.

original: 'ga' zhig ni ltos par byas pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par dbye bar ni mi nus so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni ltos par byas pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par dbye bar ni mi nus so //
translated: But it is not possible to make a distinction that says, ‚ÄúThis is one of those and that is the other.‚Äù

original: des na lus kyi rnam pa ni ltos par bya ba dang / gzhan logs na gnas pa ni ltos par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na lus kyi rnam pa ni ltos par bya ba dang / gzhan logs na gnas pa ni ltos par byed pa yin no zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that the form of the body is that which is dependent and that something else that exists separately is that which is dependent on that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir logs su gnas pa dang mi gnas pa nyid kyis rnam par dbye ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir logs su gnas pa dang mi gnas pa nyid kyis rnam par dbye ba mi 'thad do //
translated: For that very reason, it is not tenable to make a distinction between that which exists separately and that which does not.

original: 'dis ni ltos ba 'bras bu nyid la brjod do zhes bya ba yang spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni ltos ba 'bras bu nyid la brjod do zhes bya ba yang spangs pa yin no //
translated: This also rejects the assertion that the relation is expressed in terms of the effect.

original: dus mtshungs par snang ba 'di gnyis la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus mtshungs par snang ba 'di gnyis la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: These two, which appear to be simultaneous, do not have the relation of cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu yin yang dus tha dad pas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni ma yin no zhes phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu yin yang dus tha dad pas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni ma yin no zhes phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Although they are cause and effect, they are not the relation of object apprehended and apprehender, because they are different in time. This will be explained later.

original: des na de ltar ltos par byed ba'i dngos por bstan pas ci bya /
analyzed: des na de ltar ltos par byed ba'i dngos por bstan pas ci bya /
translated: So what is the point of teaching that they are related in the sense of being dependent?

original: de'i phyir gang gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba ltos pa zhes bya ba'i chos ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba ltos pa zhes bya ba'i chos ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the point is that the phenomenon called ‚Äúrelation,‚Äù by virtue of which there would be the relation of object apprehended and apprehender, does not exist.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i sun 'byin pa yin no snyam du dgongs nas khas len pa mdzad pa ni de bden zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i sun 'byin pa yin no snyam du dgongs nas khas len pa mdzad pa ni de bden zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thinking that this is a proper refutation, the opponent accepts it, saying ‚ÄúThat is true.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de ltos par bya ba dang ltos par byed pa'i dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltos par bya ba dang ltos par byed pa'i dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because the relation of the object of dependence and the basis of dependence does not exist,

original: dbye ba 'di zhes bya ba ni ltos par bya ba dang / ltos par byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang / logs shig na gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dbye ba 'di zhes bya ba ni ltos par bya ba dang / ltos par byed pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang / logs shig na gnas pa dang mi gnas pa'i rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: This division is called the division of the object of dependence and the agent of dependence, and the division of that which exists separately and that which does not exist separately.

original: skabs nyid la sbyor bar byed pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs nyid la sbyor bar byed pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The application to the present topic is for that reason.

original: 'pho ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'pho ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the term ‚Äútransmigration,‚Äù

original: ri dang shing dang sa la @123b sogs pa rnams la /
analyzed: ri dang shing dang sa la @123b sogs pa rnams la /
translated: mountains, trees, earth, and so onüîΩare not transmigrators.

original: rnam pa med pa'i sems 'pho ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i sems 'pho ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bzlog pa'i don du /
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt that the mind without form transmigrates,

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says ‚Äúby its own nature.‚Äù

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.üîΩFor example, a consciousness that is by nature pleasure gradually arises in the nature of another‚Äôs body and so on, and it is ascertained to be that very consciousness by virtue of having the same cause.

original: dper na shes pa bde ba'i rang bzhin rim gyis gzhan gyi lus la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du skye ba dang / rgyu gcig pa nyid kyis de nyid do zhes nges par 'dzin pa yang yin pa de bzhin du shi ba'i rjes thogs su /
analyzed: dper na shes pa bde ba'i rang bzhin rim gyis gzhan gyi lus la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du skye ba dang / rgyu gcig pa nyid kyis de nyid do zhes nges par 'dzin pa yang yin pa de bzhin du shi ba'i rjes thogs su /
translated: In the same way, immediately after death,

original: srid pa bar ma 'di rim gyis sam /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma 'di rim gyis sam /
translated: this intermediate existence gradually arises in the nature of the body of the next existence.

original: yang na mod kho na la pha ma'i khu ba la sogs pas skyes pa'i lus kyi rang bzhin du yang skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang na mod kho na la pha ma'i khu ba la sogs pas skyes pa'i lus kyi rang bzhin du yang skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Or else, it would arise in the nature of a body produced by the father‚Äôs semen and so on, at the very moment of conception.

original: de nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i gdags pa la ltos par yang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i gdags pa la ltos par yang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And it would be dependent on the imputation ‚ÄúIt is that very one.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis nus pa gzhan mad pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis nus pa gzhan mad pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in that way, the nature of consciousness has no other power.

original: gang la bya ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni dmigs par byed pa nyid yin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang la bya ba dang bcas par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni dmigs par byed pa nyid yin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which would have activity‚Äù means that which would be the very act of objectification.

original: lus kyi rten can rnam par shes pa'i nus pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi rten can rnam par shes pa'i nus pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The power of consciousness that has a body as its basis is called ‚Äúthe power of consciousness that has a body as its basis.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul du 'dod pa'i rnam par snang ba des rang bzhin gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul du 'dod pa'i rnam par snang ba des rang bzhin gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The appearance that is the object of form and so on is not a different nature from that.

original: 'on kyang de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba dang / lus dang gzhan gyi rang bzhin du yongs su gyur pa ni rang rig pa nyid kyis shes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba dang / lus dang gzhan gyi rang bzhin du yongs su gyur pa ni rang rig pa nyid kyis shes pa yin te /
translated: However, that which has become like that and has become the nature of the body and other things is known by reflexive awareness.

original: gzhan gyis rig pa nyid ni yang nas yang du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rig pa nyid ni yang nas yang du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition of others has been repeatedly refuted.

original: 'o na ci ltar ka ba la sogs pa mi g-yo zhes sbrel to //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar ka ba la sogs pa mi g-yo zhes sbrel to //
translated: But how is it that a pillar, etc. is not moving?

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni ka ba'i rnam par yongs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni ka ba'i rnam par yongs su 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy its very nature, it is moving‚Äù means that it is transformed into the form of a pillar.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni ka ba la sogs pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni ka ba la sogs pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat also‚Äù means that a pillar, etc.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is not so‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du skyes pa tsam gang yin pa de tsam 'ba' zhig gis ni g-yo ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du skyes pa tsam gang yin pa de tsam 'ba' zhig gis ni g-yo ba ma yin no //
translated: That mere arising in the nature of consciousness is not moving.

original: 'o na ci ltar g-yo bar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar g-yo bar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But how is it moving?

original: reg pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: reg pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that it is the form of the tactile consciousness.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention is this:

original: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa tsam gyis ni g-yo ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa tsam gyis ni g-yo ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not moving by the mere fact of being in the nature of consciousness.

original: 'on kyang gang gis lus nyid g-yo bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gis lus nyid g-yo bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: But rather, it is that by which the body itself moves,

original: ka ba la sogs pa ni ma yin pa /
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa ni ma yin pa /
translated: not a pillar, etc.

original: 'bad rtsol gyi rang bzhin /
analyzed: 'bad rtsol gyi rang bzhin /
translated: It is the nature of effort.

original: reg pa'i rnam par shes ba nyid la de 'dra ba'i nus pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: reg pa'i rnam par shes ba nyid la de 'dra ba'i nus pa yod pa yin no //
translated: The capacity for that exists in the consciousness of touch itself.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang gi rgyu las nges pa'i rang bzhin la ni brgal zhing brtag pa yang 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang gi rgyu las nges pa'i rang bzhin la ni brgal zhing brtag pa yang 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not proper to dispute or investigate the nature of things as determined by their own causes.

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa kho na ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe body, etc.‚Äù refers to the body, etc.

original: ka ba la sogs pa ni ma yin te /üîΩreg pa'i rnam par shes pa ni nus pa @124a * //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa ni ma yin te / reg pa'i rnam par shes pa ni nus pa @124a * //
translated: It does not refer to pillars, etc.,

original: de 'dra ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the consciousness of touch has that kind of capacity.

original: gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i rnam par shes pa med par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni reg pa'i rnam par shes pa med par ro //
translated: It does not occur in any other way, i.e., without the consciousness of touch.

original: 'di yang kun du tha snyad pa'i phyogs la brten nas lan btab pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang kun du tha snyad pa'i phyogs la brten nas lan btab pa yin te /
translated: This is the reply based on the standpoint of conventional practice.

original: dngos po la ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba dag med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po la ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba dag med pa'i phyir te /
translated: In reality, there is no movement or nonmovement,

original: de dag ni gcig tu sgro btags pas byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni gcig tu sgro btags pas byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because these are created by a single superimposition.

original: 'di ltar dper na bag chags kyi mthu las yul gzhan dang gzhan tu skyes pa gzhan dang gzhan nyid yin na yang de nyid du sgro btags nas g-yo ba brjod pa de bzhin du gnas der skyes pa'i skad cig la yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na bag chags kyi mthu las yul gzhan dang gzhan tu skyes pa gzhan dang gzhan nyid yin na yang de nyid du sgro btags nas g-yo ba brjod pa de bzhin du gnas der skyes pa'i skad cig la yang /
translated: In the same way, in the case of a moment born in that place,

original: de nyid du sgro btags nas mi g-yo bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid du sgro btags nas mi g-yo bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: he is described as not moving, having been imputed as the same.

original: des na bag chags kyi mthu las de ltar skyed pa dag la /
analyzed: des na bag chags kyi mthu las de ltar skyed pa dag la /
translated: Therefore, in the case of those born in that way due to the power of latent impressions,

original: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba ni tha snyad pa nyid dang / 'bad rtsol gyi nus pa yod pa dang med pa dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yang yin no //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba ni tha snyad pa nyid dang / 'bad rtsol gyi nus pa yod pa dang med pa dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yang yin no //
translated: movement and non-movement are mere conventions, and are established by the presence or absence of the power of effort.

original: rnam pa rnams gcig nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: rnam pa rnams gcig nyid yin na ni /
translated: If the aspects are one,

original: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo bdag srid pa thag ring ba nyid do zhes phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo bdag srid pa thag ring ba nyid do zhes phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is far-fetched to say that there is movement and non-movement. This will be shown later.

original: gang gi phyir rig pa ni rang gi rang bzhin la 'jug pa yin ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig pa ni rang gi rang bzhin la 'jug pa yin ba'i phyir /
translated: Because cognition engages its own nature,

original: bdag nyid rdul phra rab las skyes par mi rtogs la /
analyzed: bdag nyid rdul phra rab las skyes par mi rtogs la /
translated: it does not cognize itself as born from subtle particles.

original: de ltar rig par byed pa gzhan yang med pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rig par byed pa gzhan yang med pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other way to understand this, this is the reason.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid de /
translated: The nature of form, etc. is the nature of external form, etc.

original: der 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are included in that.üîΩEven so, the absurd consequence previously explained still applies.

original: de lta na yang sngar bshad pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhes mjug sdud pa'i sgo nas ston pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang sngar bshad pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhes mjug sdud pa'i sgo nas ston pa ni /
translated: This is shown by way of a summary:

original: des na rdul phra rab rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na rdul phra rab rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the atoms, etc.

original: gzhan gyis khyed la yang zhes dris ta /
analyzed: gzhan gyis khyed la yang zhes dris ta /
translated: The opponent asks: But what about you?

original: sangs rgyas pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la yang ngo //
translated: The Buddhist.

original: lan du de'i rnam pa can gyi zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lan du de'i rnam pa can gyi zhes gsungs te /
translated: In response, he says: Having the aspect of that.

original: rags pa'i rnam pa po ma yor gcig tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rags pa'i rnam pa po ma yor gcig tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The aspect of the gross, the appearance of a single whole.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni phyi rol las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni phyi rol las gzhan pa'o //
translated: Other means different from external objects.

original: dogs pa pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dogs pa pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The doubt is this:

original: phyi rol ni rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: phyi rol ni rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: External objects are by nature atoms.

original: de snang na rdul phra rab snang bar thal bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de snang na rdul phra rab snang bar thal bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If they appear, it follows that atoms appear.

original: gang gi tshe rang gi rnam pa myong ba nyid lhag par zhen pa las phyi rol rig pa yin pa dang / de bzhin 'di bdag nyid ci lta bde bzhin du rig pa yin pa de'i che /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi rnam pa myong ba nyid lhag par zhen pa las phyi rol rig pa yin pa dang / de bzhin 'di bdag nyid ci lta bde bzhin du rig pa yin pa de'i che /
translated: When one is attached to the experience of one‚Äôs own form, one thinks that there is an external object of knowledge, and that it is just like one‚Äôs own self.

original: phyi rol gyi rjes su mthun pa la blos reg pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rjes su mthun pa la blos reg pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the mind does not touch the external object that is similar to it.

original: 'o na ci ltar 'dra ba las dmigs par rnam par gzhag ca na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar 'dra ba las dmigs par rnam par gzhag ca na /
translated: If that is so, then how can one posit the object of knowledge as similar to the cognition?

original: rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin la ni rnam pa thams cad du so so'i skye bos rjes su mi 'jug pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin la ni rnam pa thams cad du so so'i skye bos rjes su mi 'jug pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because the nature of the atom is never experienced by ordinary people,

original: kha dog dang dbyibs nyid kyis byas pa 'dra ba yin @124b te ;
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs nyid kyis byas pa 'dra ba yin @124b te ;
translated: the similarity is made by means of color and shape.

original: de tsam thob pa nyid kyis 'jig rten gyi don grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam thob pa nyid kyis 'jig rten gyi don grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the purpose of the world is accomplished by the mere attainment of that.

original: dbyibs kyang yul ci 'dra ba mngon par khyab bar skyes pa de 'dra ba thob pa nyid las rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs kyang yul ci 'dra ba mngon par khyab bar skyes pa de 'dra ba thob pa nyid las rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
translated: The shape is posited as that which arises in the form of the object that is manifested.

original: gzhan gyis kho bo cag gi yang zhes smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis kho bo cag gi yang zhes smras so //
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúWe also say that the object is similar to the cognition.‚Äù

original: des na rdul phra rab so sor rig par thal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rdul phra rab so sor rig par thal ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it follows that the individual atoms are cognized.

original: snyam du bsams pa'o//
analyzed: snyam du bsams pa'o//
translated: This is the idea.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni shes pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni shes pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: Its nature is the nature of consciousness.

original: rdul phra rab rnams shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de brtsams pa yan lag can gyi rdzas rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du ga la 'gyur zhes sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa de brtsams pa yan lag can gyi rdzas rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin du ga la 'gyur zhes sngar brjod zin to //
translated: Since the atoms are not the nature of consciousness, how could the composite substance, which is composed of them, be the nature of consciousness? This has already been explained.

original: thams cad du snga ma rjes su brjod pa ni khyad par gyi don yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du snga ma rjes su brjod pa ni khyad par gyi don yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the repetition of the preceding statement in every case is for the sake of emphasis.

original: de ltar yang rdul phra rab dag ni tha dad par 'gyur ba nyid do zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: de ltar yang rdul phra rab dag ni tha dad par 'gyur ba nyid do zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Thus, it is suspected that the atoms would be different.

original: 'o na ni zhes lan brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes lan brjod pa yin no //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúWell then‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is, ‚ÄúIn that case‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rdul phra rab rnams sems pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa ni yan lag can gyi lus kyi ngo bo nyid du zhes bya ba la sems pa tsam dang / dkar sham la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams sems pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gnas pa ni yan lag can gyi lus kyi ngo bo nyid du zhes bya ba la sems pa tsam dang / dkar sham la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa yin no //
translated: The atoms, which are the nature of mind, are the essence of the body which is composed of parts.

original: de lta ma yin na yan lag can des brtsams pa zhes bya ba nyid mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yan lag can des brtsams pa zhes bya ba nyid mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be the case that the body which is composed of parts is composed of them.

original: gang gi phyir yan lag can gyi lus kyang rdul phra rab rnams kyi ngo bo nyid sems pa can la sogs pa nyid du zhes bya ba des rnam par gnas te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yan lag can gyi lus kyang rdul phra rab rnams kyi ngo bo nyid sems pa can la sogs pa nyid du zhes bya ba des rnam par gnas te /
translated: Since the body which is composed of parts is the nature of the atoms, which are the nature of mind, etc.,

original: skye ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: it is born.

original: rdul phra rab rnams sems pa can la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams sems pa can la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the atoms are ascertained to be the nature of mind, etc.

original: des na rdul phra rab so sor dmigs par thal lo /
analyzed: des na rdul phra rab so sor dmigs par thal lo /
translated: Consequently, it follows that the atoms are perceived individually.

original: gzung bar bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi rdul phra rab mtha' dag sems pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi rdul phra rab mtha' dag sems pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that all the atoms which are the nature of the object of perception are mind.

original: nyes pa 'di spangs ba'i don du gzhan gyis rdul phra rab dag ni tha dad par gyur pa nyid do zhes brjod pa yin par ston pa ni /
analyzed: nyes pa 'di spangs ba'i don du gzhan gyis rdul phra rab dag ni tha dad par gyur pa nyid do zhes brjod pa yin par ston pa ni /
translated: In order to avoid this fault, others say that the atoms are separate.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if they are separate,

original: go rims 'dir rtsod pa 'di'i lan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: go rims 'dir rtsod pa 'di'i lan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: this is the reply to the argument in this order.

original: 'di la lan du de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la lan du de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply to that is, ‚ÄúIf that is so,

original: lus kyi rang bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes sems pa can yan lag can gyi rang bzhin ma yin ba ste /
analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes sems pa can yan lag can gyi rang bzhin ma yin ba ste /
translated: the body would not be the nature of the parts, because the nature of the possessor of parts is not the nature of the body.

original: lus kyi sems pa can gyi yan lag can gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi sems pa can gyi yan lag can gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is the nature of the possessor of parts, which is the nature of the parts.

original: gal te de lta na yang de dag med par dam ci ltar 'cha' zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang de dag med par dam ci ltar 'cha' zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, how can you make a promise that they do not exist?

original: rig par bya ba nyid ma yin pas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rig par bya ba nyid ma yin pas zhes gsungs te /
translated: Because they are not objects of knowledge.

original: @125a * // rdul phra rab so sor rig par thal bas de ltar khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @125a * // rdul phra rab so sor rig par thal bas de ltar khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We do not accept that atoms are objects of knowledge, because it follows that they are individually cognizable.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the nature of the apprehended object and apprehending subject does not exist in this way.

original: de'i phyir rdul phra rab gzhan dag ni med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab gzhan dag ni med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, other subtle atoms do not exist.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la ma gtogs pa'i phung po gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la ma gtogs pa'i phung po gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for there to be a separate aggregate of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de'i phyir yan lag can 'ba' zhig go zhes khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yan lag can 'ba' zhig go zhes khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, you accept that there is only the possessor of parts.

original: de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: That is not so is the refutation.

original: de ni rdul phra rab yod pa la yang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rdul phra rab yod pa la yang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: That is the same for those who assert the existence of subtle atoms.

original: ci ltar thams cad g-yo bar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ci ltar thams cad g-yo bar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How could everything move?

original: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid 'ga' ba can ni gcig pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid 'ga' ba can ni gcig pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that something that has the characteristic of movement and immobility is the same.

original: gal te g-yo ba nyid las yin gyi mi g-yo ba ni rang gi rang bzhin du gnas btsam yin gyi las ni ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te g-yo ba nyid las yin gyi mi g-yo ba ni rang gi rang bzhin du gnas btsam yin gyi las ni ma yin na /
translated: If it is due to movement, but immobility is merely abiding in its own nature and not due to karma,

original: de'i phyir ci ltar las ni gcig la zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ltar las ni gcig la zhes brjod ce na /
translated: then why is it said that karma is in one?

original: bden te las kyi sgras ni /
analyzed: bden te las kyi sgras ni /
translated: True, but the word ‚Äúaction‚Äù

original: chos tsam nye bar mtshon par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos tsam nye bar mtshon par bya ba yin no //
translated: is meant to indicate a mere phenomenon.

original: des na 'ga' ba'i chos dag gcig la mi rung ngo zhes bya pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'ga' ba'i chos dag gcig la mi rung ngo zhes bya pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that it is not possible for two mutually exclusive phenomena to belong to a single entity.üîΩ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that if one

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te gcig tu mngon par 'dod pa la yang 'gal ba can gyi chos gnyis yod na /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te gcig tu mngon par 'dod pa la yang 'gal ba can gyi chos gnyis yod na /
translated: asserts that there is a single entity, and it has two mutually exclusive phenomena,

original: de'i tshe so sor grub par thal te /
analyzed: de'i tshe so sor grub par thal te /
translated: then it follows that they are established separately,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like permanence and impermanence.

original: gcig pa nyid ni mngon par rlob pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid ni mngon par rlob pa tsam yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that singularity is mere assertion.

original: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid ni bya ba can /
analyzed: rdzas kyi mtshan nyid ni bya ba can /
translated: The definition of substance is ‚Äúthat which has action,

original: yon tan can /üîΩ'du ba can gyi rgyu zhes bya ba tsam yin pa la /
analyzed: yon tan can / 'du ba can gyi rgyu zhes bya ba tsam yin pa la /
translated: has qualities,üîΩand is the cause of inherence.‚ÄùüîΩWhen it is said that it is the cause of inherence and so on, it is said in

original: bar du ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhes brjod pa ni ji ltar 'du ba can gyi rgyu yin zhes shes par 'dod pa la ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bar du ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhes brjod pa ni ji ltar 'du ba can gyi rgyu yin zhes shes par 'dod pa la ltos nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: relation to the desire to know how it is the cause of inherence.

original: ldan pa las de'i rgyur gyur pa na 'du ba can gyi gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ldan pa las de'i rgyur gyur pa na 'du ba can gyi gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and when it is the cause of that, it is the cause of the collection.

original: de la sogs pa'i sgras ni yon tan gyi tshogs bzung nas las lnga yang 'dzin to //
analyzed: de la sogs pa'i sgras ni yon tan gyi tshogs bzung nas las lnga yang 'dzin to //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include the collection of qualities and the five actions.

original: yang na spyi dang / nam mkha' chen po nyid la sogs pa'i 'du ba can rtag pa'i tshogs rnam par gcod pas ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na spyi dang / nam mkha' chen po nyid la sogs pa'i 'du ba can rtag pa'i tshogs rnam par gcod pas ldan pa la sogs pa'i rgyu zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Or else, the words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refer to the cause of inherence, in order to exclude the collection of universals, space, the great one, and so on, which are eternal.

original: de la 'di ni bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa'i nyes pa brjod pa'i don du bris pa yin la /
analyzed: de la 'di ni bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa'i nyes pa brjod pa'i don du bris pa yin la /
translated: This is written in order to point out the faults of the obscured and the unobscured.

original: bya ba dang yon tan ni g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / tshon gyis bsgyur ba dang / ma bsgyur ba'i nyes pa brjod pa'i don du yin zhing 'du ba can gyi rgyu ni thams cad kyi thun mong ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang yon tan ni g-yo ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / tshon gyis bsgyur ba dang / ma bsgyur ba'i nyes pa brjod pa'i don du yin zhing 'du ba can gyi rgyu ni thams cad kyi thun mong ba yin no //
translated: The faults of action and quality are pointed out in order to show the faults of movement and nonmovement, and the faults of coloring and not coloring. The cause of the collection is common to all.

original: de la re zhig bya ba la sbyor ba de la gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig bya ba la sbyor ba de la gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, in regard to the application to action, it is said, ‚ÄúIf that . . . ‚Äù

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to action.

original: don 'di yin te rdzas @125b la nye ba tsam ni spyi ma yin la /
analyzed: don 'di yin te rdzas @125b la nye ba tsam ni spyi ma yin la /
translated: The meaning is this: mere proximity to the substance is not the universal.

original: 'di la bya ba des zin pa'i yul las rang bzhin gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la bya ba des zin pa'i yul las rang bzhin gzhan yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no other nature of the object that is the locus of that action.

original: des na gnas de bzhin du thams cad g-yo bar thal lo //
analyzed: des na gnas de bzhin du thams cad g-yo bar thal lo //
translated: Therefore, it follows that everything would be moving in the same way.

original: rnam pa ci zhig ltar gzhan gyi lan dogs par byed pa ni //üîΩyan lag can ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ci zhig ltar gzhan gyi lan dogs par byed pa ni // yan lag can ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In what way is it suspected that there is another reply?

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i lan brjod pa ni lhas byin dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i lan brjod pa ni lhas byin dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply that is consistent with that is ‚ÄúDevadatta.‚Äù

original: gcig tu lhag par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gcig tu lhag par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be said that it is because there is no single thing to which one is attached.

original: lhag par zhen pa tsam la ni dngos po la nges pa yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa tsam la ni dngos po la nges pa yin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that mere attachment is ascertainment of a thing.

original: 'dir lhag par zhen pa tsam ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir lhag par zhen pa tsam ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, it is not mere attachment,

original: de ltar rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni mngon sum nyid yin no snyam pa'i bsam pas 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni mngon sum nyid yin no snyam pa'i bsam pas 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but rather the thought that the establishment is by direct perception itself. Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIf that is so.‚Äù

original: lha sbyin la sogs pa la ni mngon sum gyi rjes las byung bas gcig nyid do zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lha sbyin la sogs pa la ni mngon sum gyi rjes las byung bas gcig nyid do zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But in the case of Devadatta, etc., the idea of oneness is not a conceptual construction, but is derived from the perception.

original: lag pa la sogs pa g-yo ba'i dus na ni lus gcig yin no snyam du mngon sum gyi de ma thag kho na nges par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa g-yo ba'i dus na ni lus gcig yin no snyam du mngon sum gyi de ma thag kho na nges par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that at the time of the movement of the hand, etc., the body is definitely perceived as one.

original: sun 'byin pa ni gcig ces bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni gcig ces bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation is: What is this oneness?

original: gcig nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed pa de gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed pa de gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: What is it that posits oneness?

original: dngos po rnams lag pa gyen du bsgrengs nas bdag nyid gcig gam du ma yin no zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams lag pa gyen du bsgrengs nas bdag nyid gcig gam du ma yin no zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: We do not say that things are one or many by raising up the hand.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gal te zhes rnam par 'jig byed kyi dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gal te zhes rnam par 'jig byed kyi dogs pa bsu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúif you say‚Äù is a hypothetical objection.

original: snang ba tha mi dad pa gcig nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: snang ba tha mi dad pa gcig nyid rnam par 'jog par byed pa yin na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is: ‚ÄúIf you posit oneness on the basis of the non-differentiation of the appearance, that is not so.‚Äù

original: de ni med do zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de ni med do zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: The refutation is: ‚ÄúThat is not so.‚Äù

original: snang ba tha dad pa ni med de /
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa ni med de /
translated: There is no difference in appearance,

original: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba snang ba dag ni tha dad pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba snang ba dag ni tha dad pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the appearance of the moving and unmoving is different.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚Äú But‚Äù is another opinion.

original: gang la chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig yod pa de'i ngo bo ni 'bras bu gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang la chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig yod pa de'i ngo bo ni 'bras bu gcig pa nyid do //
translated: That which has a single effect, such as the apprehension of water, etc., is a single effect.

original: gcig tu rnam par 'jog par byed pa de yin na /
analyzed: gcig tu rnam par 'jog par byed pa de yin na /
translated: That which is established as a single thingüîΩis not ascertained.

original: de yang ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de yang ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To show this, he says,

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means:üîΩ

original: sa bon dang chu sa la sogs pa lta ba du mas kyang ni 'bras bu gcig byed pa ma thong ba'i phyir dang / skor choms kyi phyir yang gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon dang chu sa la sogs pa lta ba du mas kyang ni 'bras bu gcig byed pa ma thong ba'i phyir dang / skor choms kyi phyir yang gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because many things such as seeds, water, earth, etc., are seen to produce a single effect, and because the order is not fixed, the effect is not clear.

original: lhag ma ni gsal ba'i phyir rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gsal ba'i phyir rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The rest is clear.

original: gnyis pa sun 'byin pa ni yan lag can bsgribs pa na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa sun 'byin pa ni yan lag can bsgribs pa na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second refutation is ‚ÄúIf the possessor is obscured, etc.‚Äù

original: ldan pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ldan pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚Äú Because there is no difference in the possessor‚Äù means

original: gang gi tshe gos la sogs pas yan lag can gyi cha bsgribs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gos la sogs pas yan lag can gyi cha bsgribs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the parts of the whole, such as cloth, are covered by other things, such as dust,

original: yan lag thams cad la ldan pa 'dus par 'gyur ba yin te /üîΩ@126a * // snga ma bzhin du 'du ba can ma yin pa'i cha med pa'i phyir na /üîΩthams cad bsgribs pa bzlog tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad la ldan pa 'dus par 'gyur ba yin te / @126a * // snga ma bzhin du 'du ba can ma yin pa'i cha med pa'i phyir na / thams cad bsgribs pa bzlog tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the whole is covered, because the parts are covered.üîΩBut if the whole is not covered, then the parts are not covered, because the whole is not covered.üîΩAnd if the parts are not covered, then the whole is not covered, because the parts are not covered.

original: 'on ta yan lag bsgribs kyi yan lag can ni ma yin na snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: 'on ta yan lag bsgribs kyi yan lag can ni ma yin na snyam du dogs na /
translated: If you think that the parts are covered, but the whole is not,

original: yan lag bsgribs pa yin na zhes smos so //
analyzed: yan lag bsgribs pa yin na zhes smos so //
translated: then the text says, ‚ÄúIf the parts are covered. . . .‚Äù

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni yan lag can gyi gzugs ma god par ro //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni yan lag can gyi gzugs ma god par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù means the whole, the form, is not destroyed.

original: 'on te yan lag gi sgo nas yan lag can gyi rang bzhin cung zad bsgribs pa des na thams cad mthong ba ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te yan lag gi sgo nas yan lag can gyi rang bzhin cung zad bsgribs pa des na thams cad mthong ba ma yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that because the whole is partially covered by the parts, the whole is not seen,

original: yan lag gi sgo nas zhes smos so //
analyzed: yan lag gi sgo nas zhes smos so //
translated: then the text says, ‚ÄúIf the whole is covered by the parts. . . .‚Äù

original: bsgribs pa'i yan lag 'dus pa'i yan lag can yang bsgribs pa na yan lag can gyi rang bzhin cung zad kyang mi mthong ba'am /
analyzed: bsgribs pa'i yan lag 'dus pa'i yan lag can yang bsgribs pa na yan lag can gyi rang bzhin cung zad kyang mi mthong ba'am /
translated: If the whole is covered by the parts, then the whole is not seen at all, because the whole is covered by the parts.

original: de'i sgo nas bsgribs pa las 'das te /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas bsgribs pa las 'das te /
translated: And by that means, having passed beyond the obstruction,

original: mthong na ni ri la mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: mthong na ni ri la mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: if one sees it, then one sees the mountain.

original: de ltar 'dis ni 'gal ba'i chos dang mthun pa'i phyir yan lag can gcig ni gang du yang grub ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dis ni 'gal ba'i chos dang mthun pa'i phyir yan lag can gcig ni gang du yang grub ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he says that because of being in conformity with contradictory properties, the possessor of parts is not established anywhere.

original: 'di nyid nye bar sdud pa ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid nye bar sdud pa ni //
translated: This is the summary:

original: de phyir tshogs pa gcig yod min //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de phyir tshogs pa gcig yod min // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the collection does not exist.

original: tshogs pa ni yan lag can no //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni yan lag can no //
translated: The collection is the possessor of parts.

original: du ma nyid na'ang snga ma bzhin //
analyzed: du ma nyid na'ang snga ma bzhin //
translated: Even if it is many, it is just as before.

original: zhes bya ba nyid bshad pa byed pa'i 'dod pas sun 'byin pa'i ngag yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid bshad pa byed pa'i 'dod pas sun 'byin pa'i ngag yin no //
translated: This is the refutation by the desire of the author.

original: rdul phra rab kyi tshogs tsam yin na snga ma bzhin du rdul phra rab so sor rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi tshogs tsam yin na snga ma bzhin du rdul phra rab so sor rig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is just a collection of subtle atoms, then it follows that each subtle atom is individually cognized, just as before.

original: thal ba 'di la gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni khyad par med phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thal ba 'di la gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni khyad par med phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The anticipation of the opponent‚Äôs qualm about this reductio is ‚Äúbecause there is no difference.‚Äù

original: rtogs min zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab so sor dmigs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs min zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab so sor dmigs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Not cognized‚Äù means that each subtle atom is not observed.

original: lan ni khyad par med par ma grub ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni khyad par med par ma grub ces bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúBecause the difference is not established.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: khyad par can rnams ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par can rnams ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the special ones . . .‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir rdul phra ba khyad par can rnams dbang yul te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdul phra ba khyad par can rnams dbang yul te /
translated: Because the special atoms are the objects of the sense faculties, they are the objects of perception.

original: dmigs par bya ba yin pa de'i khyad par ma grub po //üîΩrdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin las 'das pa ma yin yang dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i rdul phra rab dag las /
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba yin pa de'i khyad par ma grub po // rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin las 'das pa ma yin yang dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i rdul phra rab dag las /
translated: The difference among them is not established.

original: dmigs par bya ba'i rdul phra rab rnams khyad par med par rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i rdul phra rab rnams khyad par med par rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though they are not beyond being the nature of atoms, it is not reasonable that the atoms that are objects of perception are not different from the atoms that are not objects of perception.

original: rdul phra rab kyi tshogs las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol gzhan yang dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi tshogs las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol gzhan yang dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from the collection of atoms, there is no external object that is perceived.

original: 'dis ni khyad par med phyir dang // zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni khyad par med phyir dang // zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub par brjod pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the reason ‚Äúbecause there is no difference‚Äù is not established.

original: phra rab phyir zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod pa ni de phyir phra rab min zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phra rab phyir zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod pa ni de phyir phra rab min zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause of being subtle‚Äù is also stated as ‚Äúbecause of not being subtle.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni @126b dbang po'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni @126b dbang po'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because it is the object of the sense faculties.

original: rdul phra rab ni gang zhig dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa de nyid la brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni gang zhig dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin pa de nyid la brjod pa yin no //
translated: That which is not the domain of the sense faculties is precisely what is called subtle particle.

original: gang gi tshe 'di dbang po'i yul yin //üîΩde'i tshe rdul phra rab nyid du yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di dbang po'i yul yin // de'i tshe rdul phra rab nyid du yod kyang med pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: When it is the object of the sense faculties,

original: de ni rdul phra rab ma yin pa kho na'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rdul phra rab ma yin pa kho na'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: then, even though it exists as a subtle particle, it is not a subtle particle because it is no different from what does not exist.üîΩThis is what he intends.

original: des na rdul phra rab so sor dmigs par thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: des na rdul phra rab so sor dmigs par thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to avoid the consequence that the subtle particle is perceived individually.

original: gsal ba'i phyir na mjug bsdu ba ni rnam par bkrol to //
analyzed: gsal ba'i phyir na mjug bsdu ba ni rnam par bkrol to //
translated: The conclusion is stated because of the clarity.

original: lhag ma rnam par 'grel pa ni gal te lus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnam par 'grel pa ni gal te lus zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The rest is explained: If it is the body,

original: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes khong nas phyung la /
translated: then at that time,

original: du ma yin na yang sde ba po //
analyzed: du ma yin na yang sde ba po //
translated: even if it is multiple, it is the collection.

original: gal te rig pa'i gnas skabs nyid dmigs pa ma yin nam ;
analyzed: gal te rig pa'i gnas skabs nyid dmigs pa ma yin nam ;
translated: If the state of cognition is not the object of perception,

original: rig pa'i gnas skabs na dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas skabs na dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of perception in the state of cognition.

original: zhes tha dad par ci ltar ston zhe na /
analyzed: zhes tha dad par ci ltar ston zhe na /
translated: How does it show them to be different?

original: shes pa skye ba'i gnas skabs na dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa skye ba'i gnas skabs na dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: It is the object at the time when consciousness arises,üîΩbut not at other times.

original: gzhan gyi tshe na ma yin no zhes bya ba dgongs pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe na ma yin no zhes bya ba dgongs pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
translated: Since this is the intended meaning, there is no fault.

original: des na shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pas sngar gyi gnas skabs las khyad par yod pa'i phyir dmigs par bya ba nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: des na shes pa bskyed pa'i nus pas sngar gyi gnas skabs las khyad par yod pa'i phyir dmigs par bya ba nyid du rigs so //
translated: Therefore, since there is a difference from the previous state due to the potential to generate consciousness, it is reasonable that it is the object.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni des na mi dmigs pa las khyad par med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni des na mi dmigs pa las khyad par med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said: Therefore, it is not the case that there is no difference from non-apprehension.üîΩIn dependence on non-apprehension,

original: mi dmigs pa la ltos nas zhes bya ba las kyi lnga par byas nas /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la ltos nas zhes bya ba las kyi lnga par byas nas /
translated: the suffix -tvƒÅ is used to indicate the past tense.

original: sgrub par byed pa la byed pas zhes bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa la byed pas zhes bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is used to indicate the reason.

original: phra rab phyir zhes bya ba de la brjod pa ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phra rab phyir zhes bya ba de la brjod pa ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúsubtle‚Äù is used to indicate the reason.

original: dmigs par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object.

original: rang nyid rig pa'i gnas skabs na //
analyzed: rang nyid rig pa'i gnas skabs na //
translated: At the time of self-awareness,

original: zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de rig pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de rig pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: This is the nature of the atoms themselves, which is perceived in the state of awareness.

original: rdul phra rab nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdul phra rab nyid kyang zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa nyid do //
translated: The atoms themselves are co-emergent.

original: gegs byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'o //üîΩyod kyang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab nyid do //
analyzed: gegs byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'o // yod kyang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab nyid do //
translated: They are not obstructed, which is the object.

original: rdul phran ma yin pa ni mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phran ma yin pa ni mngon sum gyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they exist, they are not atoms, because they are realized by direct perception.

original: gal te lus rdul phra rab kyi tshogs tsam du gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te lus rdul phra rab kyi tshogs tsam du gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: If the body is merely a collection of atoms,

original: de rtogs kyang rdul phra rab so sor dmigs par thal thal na /
analyzed: de rtogs kyang rdul phra rab so sor dmigs par thal thal na /
translated: then even though it is realized, it follows that the individual atoms are perceived.

original: de'i tshe thal ba 'di ni khyed cag la yang 'gyur ro zhes smras pa na /
analyzed: de'i tshe thal ba 'di ni khyed cag la yang 'gyur ro zhes smras pa na /
translated: At that time, this consequence applies to you as well.

original: khyed cag gi yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyed cag gi yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúeven for you.‚Äù

original: khyed kyi ltar na yang yul thams cad ni rdul phra rab kyi tshogs tsam yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyi ltar na yang yul thams cad ni rdul phra rab kyi tshogs tsam yin te /
translated: According to you, all objects are merely a collection of atoms.

original: des na rdul phra rab so sor dmigs par thal bar ci ltar bzlog par bya ste /
analyzed: des na rdul phra rab so sor dmigs par thal bar ci ltar bzlog par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, how can one avoid the consequence that the individual atoms are perceived?

original: rang gi rang bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin du snang bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that their own nature would appear.

original: rang rig pa'i zhes bya ba ni lan 'debs pa'o//
analyzed: rang rig pa'i zhes bya ba ni lan 'debs pa'o//
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby the awareness of itself‚Äù is the answer.

original: @127a * // rdul phra rab so so'i rang bzhin dmigs par byed pa nyid kyis yul dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @127a * // rdul phra rab so so'i rang bzhin dmigs par byed pa nyid kyis yul dmigs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object is not perceived by the perception of the individual natures of the atoms.

original: 'o na ci ltar snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar snyam na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it?

original: 'on kyang zhes smras so //üîΩde'i rnam pa can nyid ni kha dog dang / de tsam gyis yul khyab pa'i rjes su 'jug pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes smras so // de'i rnam pa can nyid ni kha dog dang / de tsam gyis yul khyab pa'i rjes su 'jug pas so //
translated: The answer is ‚Äúbut.‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning is that the form of the object is the form of the atoms, because the object is pervaded by the atoms and is the same size as them.

original: ci ltar rdul phra rab kyi zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa yang rdul phra rab de 'dra ba dag gis bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ltar rdul phra rab kyi zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa yang rdul phra rab de 'dra ba dag gis bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust as the form of the atom‚Äù means that the form of the object is generated by atoms of the same form.

original: de las rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid bzlog dka'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las rdul phra rab kyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa nyid bzlog dka'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is difficult to avoid the conclusion that the form of the object is the same as the form of the atom.

original: 'di ni 'og tu zhes bya ba ni ci ltar skra dang / sbrang ma sha la sogs pa yul bar dang bcas par gnas pa yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og tu zhes bya ba ni ci ltar skra dang / sbrang ma sha la sogs pa yul bar dang bcas par gnas pa yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su'o //
translated: This is what is said below, in the passage beginning, ‚ÄúEven though the hairs, flies, etc. are situated in separate places in the visual field. . . . ‚Äù

original: de la rdul phra rab ci snyed skyed byed yin pa de snyed kyis rdul phra rab kyi shes pa skye ba ni ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rdul phra rab ci snyed skyed byed yin pa de snyed kyis rdul phra rab kyi shes pa skye ba ni ma yin no zhes ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not the case that as many atoms as there are that produce a cognition, that many atoms produce a cognition of an atom.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lan du 'dis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lan du 'dis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If, in response to this, it is said that,

original: rdul phra rab khyad par can du bsgrubs pas so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab khyad par can du bsgrubs pas so //
translated: because the atoms are established as having a special nature,

original: rnam 'grel lhag ma bzhis ni sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam 'grel lhag ma bzhis ni sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa yin no //
translated: the remaining four lines of the root text state another refutation.

original: rdul phra rab rnams 'byar pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams 'byar pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: The explanation is that the atoms do not touch.

original: de med pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag can med pas so //
analyzed: de med pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag can med pas so //
translated: The absence of that, i.e., the absence of the whole,

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: where?

original: rdul phra rab rnams la'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la'o //
translated: In the atoms.

original: der mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i chos kyi sgrib par ro ;
analyzed: der mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i chos kyi sgrib par ro ;
translated: It is not possible there, i.e., it is not possible for the agent to be obstructed by the object.

original: / gang gis rdul phra rab rnams sgrib byed du mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / gang gis rdul phra rab rnams sgrib byed du mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the atoms do not obstruct each other.

original: de bzhin du rdugs par byed pa'i bya ba thags pa yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdugs par byed pa'i bya ba thags pa yang /
translated: In the same way, the action of obstructing, which is the cause of obstruction,

original: yan lag can 'brel ba 'gar yang dmigs pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: yan lag can 'brel ba 'gar yang dmigs pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: is not perceived anywhere in the possessor of parts.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi tshogs gseng dang bcas pa yin pas na /

analyzed: 'chad pa ni phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: phan tshun nang du 'jug pa ni gseb tu 'gro ba gang yin pa ste /

analyzed: de la gegs med pa gang yin pa dag go //

original: de la ltos nas 'di dang / 'di la ltos nas kyang de nang du 'du ba srid pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la ltos nas 'di dang / 'di la ltos nas kyang de nang du 'du ba srid pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams ni reg go zhes bya ba lugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the system that atoms make contact.

analyzed: lan ni 'dir bshad pa zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: gal te reg pa rnams 'dzin pa la sogs pa byed mi nus na yan lag can nyid ci ltar skyed ces bya ba'i @127b don to //

analyzed: reg go zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu nas reg pa yang zhes smos so //

original: ca'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ca'i phyir zhe na /

original: de med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: phyogs gcig med pa'i phyir ro // ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //

analyzed: bar dang bcas pa rnams ldan pa skyed pas yan lag can skyed do zhes 'brel to //

original: bar mtshams med pa nyid las skyabs la sogs par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bar mtshams med pa nyid las skyabs la sogs par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni bskyed bya la don med par sun 'byin pas 'jigs pas na bar dang bcas pa nyid khas las len pa'o //
translated: If, fearing the refutation that the produced is pointless, you accept that it is interrupted,

original: lan du de ltar yin na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lan du de ltar yin na zhes bya ste /
translated: in response, it is like that.

original: des na bar gyi sha lhag dang 'dra ba ldan pa la sogs pa brtags pas ci zhig bya zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na bar gyi sha lhag dang 'dra ba ldan pa la sogs pa brtags pas ci zhig bya zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, what is the point of investigating whether it is endowed with an intermediate portion of flesh and so on?

original: gal te yang lag can med cing rdul phra rab rnams kyang reg pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te yang lag can med cing rdul phra rab rnams kyang reg pa ma yin na /
translated: If the possessor of limbs does not exist and the subtle particles do not contact each other,

original: de'i tshe rdul gyi phung po bzhin du brdegs na /
analyzed: de'i tshe rdul gyi phung po bzhin du brdegs na /
translated: then when a pile of particles is struck,

analyzed: so sor ci ste mid dgyes shing bar du bcas pas sgrib pa la sogs pa skyed pa dang / gseng dang bcas par chu la sogs pa 'dzin par yang ci ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: why do they not disintegrate? Why do they generate obstruction and so on through being interrupted? How could they hold water and so on in the spaces between them?

original: gang la zhes bya ba smos te tshogs pa gang la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba smos te tshogs pa gang la'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúIn any collection.‚Äù

original: so sor dgyes par 'gyur ba ni sil bur 'thor ba'o //
analyzed: so sor dgyes par 'gyur ba ni sil bur 'thor ba'o //
translated: The individual is delighted is scattered.

original: de zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis brtsad pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni khyod kyis brtsad pa'o //
translated: That is your dispute.

original: rdul rnams mchog tu tshogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang / ma mthong ba dang / ma mthong mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rdul rnams mchog tu tshogs pa yin zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang / ma mthong ba dang / ma mthong mthong ba yin no //
translated: The supreme collection of atoms is the seen, the unseen, and the seeing of the unseen.

analyzed: yang na pa ra'i sgra ni 'ba' zhig gi don yin par rdul rnams tshogs pa 'ba' zhig yin zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Or, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù means that the collection of atoms is only,

original: yan lag can gyi rdzas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rdzas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
