original: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni dper na sgra dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni dper na sgra dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second statement is like ‚Äúsound,‚Äù etc.

original: 'bras bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Another result is obscuration, etc.

original: der zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: There is the other.

original: sgra la sogs pa bar dang bcas pa nyid la rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ni yul der phyin pa las gnod byed skyes pas 'jog pa yin gyi skabs la ni de ltar gnod byed yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa bar dang bcas pa nyid la rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ni yul der phyin pa las gnod byed skyes pas 'jog pa yin gyi skabs la ni de ltar gnod byed yod pa ma yin no snyam du bsams
translated: The cognition of a single aspect in a sound, etc., that is interrupted is due to the fact that the cognition is established on the basis of the object that has been reached, and then is destroyed by the arising of an obstruction. But in the case of the cognition of a single aspect in a sound, etc., that is uninterrupted, there is no such obstruction.

original: pa'o // lan du 'di la yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te zhes ma nges pa'i don gyis gnod pa'am /
analyzed: pa'o // lan du 'di la yang zhes bya ba'o // gal te zhes ma nges pa'i don gyis gnod pa'am /
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúIn this case, too, . . . ‚ÄùüîΩIf the word ‚Äúif‚Äù is taken in the sense of ‚Äúwithout doubt,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúestablishes‚Äù is superfluous.

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di snga na med pa yin no zhe na /üîΩbden te 'dis ni srid par @128a * //
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di snga na med pa yin no zhe na / bden te 'dis ni srid par @128a * //
translated: Or, if the word ‚Äúif‚Äù is taken in the sense of ‚Äúdoubt,‚Äù then the word ‚Äúestablishes‚Äù is superfluous.

original: bstan pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa zhes smos so //
translated: This is true, but the word ‚Äúestablishes‚Äù is used in order to indicate the possibility.

original: rgyu mthong yang ma mthong bar gyur pa gang yin pa 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa ni rgyu las gzhan ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthong yang ma mthong bar gyur pa gang yin pa 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa ni rgyu las gzhan ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The capacity to produce an effect is nothing other than the cause itself, even though the cause is seen and not seen.

original: 'di ni de ltar mthong yang rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin nges pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar mthong yang rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin nges pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Even though it is seen in this way, it is not ascertained in the same way as the essential nature of the cause.

original: 'on kyang de yod na 'bras bu dmigs pa kho na las so //
analyzed: 'on kyang de yod na 'bras bu dmigs pa kho na las so //
translated: However, when it exists, it is ascertained only from the perception of the effect.

original: des na 'bras bu sgrub par byed ba'i nus pa'i rgyu'i dngos po nyid yin yang 'bras bu ma dmigs na rgyu rtogs su zin kyang rtogs pa po'i rgyur rtogs par mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang 'bras bu mthong ba kho nas yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu sgrub par byed ba'i nus pa'i rgyu'i dngos po nyid yin yang 'bras bu ma dmigs na rgyu rtogs su zin kyang rtogs pa po'i rgyur rtogs par mi 'gyur gyi 'on kyang 'bras bu mthong ba kho nas yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though the cause is the entity that has the power to produce the effect, if the effect is not observed, even though the cause is ascertained, the ascertainer is not ascertained as the cause. However, it is only by seeing the effect that the cause is ascertained.

original: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin yin yang mtha'i skad cig mthong ba nyid na rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin yin yang mtha'i skad cig mthong ba nyid na rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, even though impermanence is the intrinsic reality of things, it is ascertained only when the final moment is seen.

original: des na mi rtag pa nyid de rtogs pa ma rtogs kyang don gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa kho nar rigs so //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa nyid de rtogs pa ma rtogs kyang don gyi rang bzhin du gyur pa kho nar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, even though impermanence is not ascertained, it is logical that it is the intrinsic reality of the object.

original: de ltar ma yin te gal te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa yin par ma gyur na de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid las tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te gal te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa yin par ma gyur na de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid las tha dad pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, if things were not impermanent, then impermanence would be something completely different.

original: rgyu mtshan gang rtsa bar gyur pas dngos po 'di de'i ngo bo ma yin par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan de ston te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gang rtsa bar gyur pas dngos po 'di de'i ngo bo ma yin par 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan de ston te /
translated: The reason why things are not impermanent is shown by the reason why they are not its nature.

original: gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin nam zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par smra ba'i 'dod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin nam zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa rgyu dang ldan par smra ba'i 'dod pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOr is it caused by another?‚Äù refers to the assertion that destruction is caused.

original: rgyu mtshan med pa can nyid yin yang rung ste zhes bya bas ni 'jig pa 'byung ba po nyid du dmigs te rgyu med par 'dod pa nyid la yin gyi dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa can nyid yin yang rung ste zhes bya bas ni 'jig pa 'byung ba po nyid du dmigs te rgyu med par 'dod pa nyid la yin gyi dngos po ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it is causeless,‚Äù refers to the observation that destruction is the agent of origination, and the assertion that it is without a cause.

original: dngos po ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba 'di la ni ba rgal ba 'di med ba kho na'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba 'di la ni ba rgal ba 'di med ba kho na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not a thing‚Äù means that this objection does not apply to the assertion that ‚Äúno thing exists at all.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa dang dngos po gzhan du gyur pa ma yin mod /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang dngos po gzhan du gyur pa ma yin mod /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not a non-thing or a transformation of a thing.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang de ni dngos po'i nges pa nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni dngos po'i nges pa nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: However, it is shown that it is the very nature of a thing.

original: dngos po ni khyad par nyid kyi sgo nas bstan par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ni khyad par nyid kyi sgo nas bstan par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: A thing is shown to be a particular.

original: dper na de yod pa nyid kyis ba glang ngo snyam du rtogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin pa lang nyid la sogs pas bstan ba de bzhin du phan tshun med pa'i bdag nyid kyis nges pa yang gcig la gcig med pas bsnyad pa yin
analyzed: dper na de yod pa nyid kyis ba glang ngo snyam du rtogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin pa lang nyid la sogs pas bstan ba de bzhin du phan tshun med pa'i bdag nyid kyis nges pa yang gcig la gcig med pas bsnyad pa yin
translated: In the same way, the ascertainment of mutual exclusion is indicated by the mutual absence of one thing from another.

original: la dus nges pa ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa yin te /
analyzed: la dus nges pa ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa yin te /
translated: Ascertainment of time is the nonexistence of something before it arises and the nonexistence of something after it has ceased.

original: des na don gzhan nyid yin mod /
analyzed: des na don gzhan nyid yin mod /
translated: Therefore, it is certainly a different object.

original: ci 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'gal zhe na /
translated: What is the contradiction?

original: de lta na ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù is stated.

original: mi rtag pa nyid gzhan yin na dngos po de dang ldan par te mi rtag par mi @128b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid gzhan yin na dngos po de dang ldan par te mi rtag par mi @128b 'gyur ro //
translated: If impermanence is different, then that thing would not possess it and would not be impermanent.

original: ci'i phyir zhen mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because it is not necessary.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa yod pa'i phyir don de nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po med pa yod pa'i phyir don de nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the thing called ‚Äúascertainment‚Äù exists without impermanence, then that object would not be ascertained.

original: dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kyi nges pa khyad pa yin yang //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kyi nges pa khyad pa yin yang //
translated: Even though the nature of nonexistence is ascertainment,

original: de'i dngos po gzhan dang 'brel ba'am /
analyzed: de'i dngos po gzhan dang 'brel ba'am /
translated: it is related to another thing.

original: dus gzhan khyab pa'i rang bzhin de ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan khyab pa'i rang bzhin de ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the other, which is all-pervasive, does not change into something else.

original: de dang ldan pa nyid kyis nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa nyid kyis nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is ascertained by the mere possession of that,

original: bshad zin to //
analyzed: bshad zin to //
translated: we have already explained that.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni gzhan yod kyang de lta ma yin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin ni gzhan yod kyang de lta ma yin par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of that sort does not change into something else even when the other exists.

original: 'o na te dngos po gzhan la sogs pa dang ma 'brel ba 'di'i rang bzhin nyid yin na dngos po med pa gzhan gyis ci yang byar med do //
analyzed: 'o na te dngos po gzhan la sogs pa dang ma 'brel ba 'di'i rang bzhin nyid yin na dngos po med pa gzhan gyis ci yang byar med do //
translated: But if the nature of this is not connected with the other, etc., then the non-existence of the other cannot do anything at all.

original: 'di'i de la nye bar sbyor ba na ni 'di kho na ste /
analyzed: 'di'i de la nye bar sbyor ba na ni 'di kho na ste /
translated: If you say that when it is connected with that, it is just that,

original: de yod na dngos po nges pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de yod na dngos po nges pa nyid gang yin pa'o zhe na /
translated: and that the existence of that is the very ascertainment of the thing,

original: de lta na yang de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yod na de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis ni dngos po med pa dngos po med pa la nye bar sbyor ba ma yin gyi ;
analyzed: de lta na yang de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid yod na de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis ni dngos po med pa dngos po med pa la nye bar sbyor ba ma yin gyi ;
translated: even so, because it would be that way if the nature of that existed, by its very nature the non-existence of the thing is not connected with the non-existence of the thing.

original: 'on kyang nus pa nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang nus pa nyid kyis yin no //
translated: But it is by its capacity.

original: des na de'i rgyu nyid de lta bu sgrub par nus par brtags te khyad par gzhan dor ba kho nar rigs so //
analyzed: des na de'i rgyu nyid de lta bu sgrub par nus par brtags te khyad par gzhan dor ba kho nar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is only reasonable to determine that the cause of that is capable of producing it, and to reject any other distinction.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained:

original: 'on te dgos na ni dngos po de'i nges pa'i mtshan nyid la 'di phan 'dogs na ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis nges pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid 'di'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa yin pas mi rtag pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'on te dgos na ni dngos po de'i nges pa'i mtshan nyid la 'di phan 'dogs na ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis nges pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid 'di'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa yin pas mi rtag pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: But if there is a need, if that thing‚Äôs definitive characteristic is assisted by this, then it is definite by its own nature, so that itself becomes its nature. Since it is impermanent, what is the use of another impermanence?

original: zhig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gzhan dang ldan pas dngos po nges pa 'dir grub pa gang yin pa 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: zhig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gzhan dang ldan pas dngos po nges pa 'dir grub pa gang yin pa 'di ni rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that this definite thing has a different meaning with the characteristic of destruction.

original: khyad par nyid kyis de de lta bur 'grub pa la nye bar mkho na dus mtshungs pa'i don la brten nas nye bar sbyor bar brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par nyid kyis de de lta bur 'grub pa la nye bar mkho na dus mtshungs pa'i don la brten nas nye bar sbyor bar brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: If it is necessary for that to be established in that way by a distinction, it should be stated that it is applied in dependence on a simultaneous object.

original: des na 'dir rang gi rgyu las de lta bu'i dngos por ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na 'dir rang gi rgyu las de lta bu'i dngos por ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, here it is not established as such a thing from its own cause.

original: des na rang yod pa'i dus bzhin du dus gzhan dang 'brel par rung ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bos 'jig ba'i dang can ma yin pa'i phyir na rang bzhin gyis mi g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rang yod pa'i dus bzhin du dus gzhan dang 'brel par rung ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bos 'jig ba'i dang can ma yin pa'i phyir na rang bzhin gyis mi g-yo ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is suitable to be related to another time in the same way that it exists at one time, it does not inherently have the characteristic of ceasing. Therefore, it is not naturally motionless.

original: de lta yin dang don gzhan dang lnga yang g-yo ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang don gzhan dang lnga yang g-yo ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were so, it would not be tenable that another object is moving.

original: des na de ltar don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin na chos 'gal ba gnas pas gzhan nyid du bsgrubs te /üîΩrgyud don tha dad pa @129a * //
analyzed: des na de ltar don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin na chos 'gal ba gnas pas gzhan nyid du bsgrubs te / rgyud don tha dad pa @129a * //
translated: Thus, if it is the reason for another object, it is established as different because of the contradiction of the two objects remaining.

original: dag la 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: dag la 'dus pa yin no //
translated: The continuum is a collection of different objects.

original: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù is a refutation.

original: rdul phra rab la dbang po'i 'od zer dang phrad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang po'i ldan pa yod pas so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab la dbang po'i 'od zer dang phrad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dbang po'i ldan pa yod pas so //
translated: Because the subtle particle has the sense faculty‚Äôs contact with the sense faculty‚Äôs light ray.

original: ldan pa thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni mig gi 'od zer rnams ni thag ring po na gnas pa'i rdzas phra mo rnams ldan pa med pa ni thag ring po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa thams cad kyang zhes bya ba ni mig gi 'od zer rnams ni thag ring po na gnas pa'i rdzas phra mo rnams ldan pa med pa ni thag ring po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAll those that are possessed‚Äù refers to the light rays of the eye sense faculty, which are not possessed by subtle substances that are located far away, because they are far away.

original: rags pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: rags pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCoarse‚Äù is a criticism.

original: dbang pos yul de srid 'gro mi nus na ni yul de na gnas pa'i rdzas rags pa yang ci ltar 'dzin ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang pos yul de srid 'gro mi nus na ni yul de na gnas pa'i rdzas rags pa yang ci ltar 'dzin ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the sense faculty is not able to reach that object, then how could it apprehend a coarse substance that is located in that object?

original: de ltar 'byor pa dang / 'dus pa gzhung ma btsugs pa dang rdo tshan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: de ltar 'byor pa dang / 'dus pa gzhung ma btsugs pa dang rdo tshan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Thus, the characteristics of the nonestablished possession and the nonestablished conjunction are refuted.

original: rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi ldan pa nyid phrad pa yin par bshad pa sun 'byin pa sel ba'i sgo nas mdun du byed pa ni /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi ldan pa nyid phrad pa yin par bshad pa sun 'byin pa sel ba'i sgo nas mdun du byed pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the explanation that the possession of the subtle particles and the possession of the sense faculties are contact is presented.

original: 'o na te ldan pa las skyes pa'i ldan pa yang zhes smra te /
analyzed: 'o na te ldan pa las skyes pa'i ldan pa yang zhes smra te /
translated: ‚ÄúBut if you say that possession arises from possession,‚Äù

original: rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu tsam du mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu tsam du mi 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: then the mere reason would not be a reason.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: No, is the refutation.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lugs la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lugs la'o //
translated: In that, refers to the other‚Äôs system.

original: gang gi phyir 'du ba ni 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo'i rgyu yin ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'du ba ni 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo'i rgyu yin ba de'i phyir /
translated: Since the cause of the cognition ‚Äúthis is an aggregation‚Äù is an aggregation,

original: 'du ba yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du ba yang yod pa yin no //
translated: an aggregation exists.

original: gal te 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo'i rgyu 'du ba yin mod /
analyzed: gal te 'di la'o snyam pa'i blo'i rgyu 'du ba yin mod /
translated: Granted that an aggregation is the cause of the cognition ‚Äúthis is an aggregation,‚Äù

original: de lta na yang skabs su bab pa la cir 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang skabs su bab pa la cir 'gyur snyam na /
translated: but what does that have to do with the present case?

original: ldan pa yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ldan pa yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúPossession also.‚Äù

original: rdo tshan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rdul phra rab rnams kyi ldan pa rtogs na /
analyzed: rdo tshan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rdul phra rab rnams kyi ldan pa rtogs na /
translated: When the possession of atoms, which have the characteristics of being hard, etc., is perceived,

original: 'di ni dmigs pa'i 'od zer dang ldan pa yin no snyam du rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs pa'i 'od zer dang ldan pa yin no snyam du rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the cognition ‚Äúthis possesses light rays‚Äù occurs.

original: 'o na te der ldan pa mthong ba yang dbang po ma mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na te der ldan pa mthong ba yang dbang po ma mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: But if possession is perceived there, then since the sense faculty is not perceived,

original: dbang po dang rdul gyi ldan pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir gang la ltos nas rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa gzhi nyid du ston ce na de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang rdul gyi ldan pa mi 'gal ba'i phyir gang la ltos nas rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa gzhi nyid du ston ce na de lta ma yin te /
translated: because there is no contradiction in the possession of sense faculties and atoms.

original: 'thad pas nges pa la yang ma brten pa'i blo mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'thad pas nges pa la yang ma brten pa'i blo mi 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because it is not contradictory that cognition does not depend on ascertainment by reasoning.

original: de bas na ldan pa 'du ba can gyi rgyur thar bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na ldan pa 'du ba can gyi rgyur thar bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since possession is the cause of the collection of things, it is liberated.

original: yon tan gyi mtshan nyid nyams pa son 'dug go snyam du dogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi mtshan nyid nyams pa son 'dug go snyam du dogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of a quality is impaired.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa'i don du yang ldan par myur bar 'dus pa yang gleng slong ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan brjod pa'i don du yang ldan par myur bar 'dus pa yang gleng slong ba ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to state another refutation, he raises the question: Furthermore, if the possession of the effect is not dependent on the possession of the cause,

original: 'bras bu'i rdzas yan lag can gyi ldan pa ltos par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rdzas yan lag can gyi ldan pa ltos par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: the substance of the effect would not be dependent on the possession of the whole.

original: de med kyang 'dzin par khas blangs pa'i phyir snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de med kyang 'dzin par khas blangs pa'i phyir snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thinking that even without that, grasping is accepted,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The opponent says, If...

original: lan du rdul phra rab kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du rdul phra rab kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In response, he says, The possession of atoms...

original: bum ba la sogs @129b pas zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab tsam 'dus pa tsam gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bum ba la sogs @129b pas zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab tsam 'dus pa tsam gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the pot, etc.‚Äù means by the nature of the mere aggregation of atoms.

original: 'di ltar phra rab mi mthong ba yin na ni mthong ba'i don gzhan brtag par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar phra rab mi mthong ba yin na ni mthong ba'i don gzhan brtag par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: If one does not see the atoms, one should imagine that the object of vision is something else.

original: rdul phra rab rnams la rtogs pa'i rgyu dbang po'i ldan pa yod na don gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la rtogs pa'i rgyu dbang po'i ldan pa yod na don gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: If the cause of the cognition of the atoms is the sense-faculty, what use is there in postulating something else?

original: brjod ma thag par ni yan lag can la dbang po'i ldan pa la ltos nas ci bya zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod ma thag par ni yan lag can la dbang po'i ldan pa la ltos nas ci bya zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: We have just said that, in the case of the whole, what use is it to suppose that the sense-faculty is in contact with it?

original: nyes pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i rdzas kyi ldan pa don med do zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i rdzas kyi ldan pa don med do zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The same fault applies to the argument that the contact of the substance with the effect is useless.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if you say‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs view.

original: gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yan lag can yod pa nyid du ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yan lag can yod pa nyid du ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not in another‚Äù means that the whole does not exist.

original: lan du 'di ni zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: lan du 'di ni zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúThis is not so.‚Äù

original: rdul phra rab rnams la dbang po'i ldan pa med na yan lag can rtogs pa yin no zhes ci ste mi brjod yan lag can gyi ldan pa yod na ni gdon mi za bar rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa yod dgos so zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la dbang po'i ldan pa med na yan lag can rtogs pa yin no zhes ci ste mi brjod yan lag can gyi ldan pa yod na ni gdon mi za bar rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa yod dgos so zhes ston pa ni /
translated: If the possessor of parts possesses, then the atoms must certainly possess.

original: yan lag can ldan na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag can ldan na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif the possessor possesses‚Äù shows this.

original: yul mtshungs pa nyid kyang yan lag can rdul phra rab kyi yul na yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul mtshungs pa nyid kyang yan lag can rdul phra rab kyi yul na yod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the object is the same, because the object of the possessor of parts is the object of the atoms.

original: des na gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa yod mod /üîΩyan lag can gyi ldan ba'am /
analyzed: des na gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ba rdul phra rab kyi ldan pa yod mod / yan lag can gyi ldan ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the atoms must certainly possess, and it is not to be denied that the atoms possess.

original: yan lag can gyis ci bya /
analyzed: yan lag can gyis ci bya /
translated: What is the use of the possessor of parts?

original: sngar ni ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i rgyur thal ba'i sgo nas gtsug lag la ltos pa nyes pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar ni ldan pa dang mi ldan pa'i rgyur thal ba'i sgo nas gtsug lag la ltos pa nyes pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: Previously, the fault of relying on scripture was stated by way of the consequence that possession and non-possession would be the cause.

original: de las gzhan pa'i gtsug lag gi nyes pa yang brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gtsug lag gi nyes pa yang brjod pa ni yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, the fault of other scriptures is stated.

original: yan lag can la yang rtogs pa'i dbang po kho nas /
analyzed: yan lag can la yang rtogs pa'i dbang po kho nas /
translated: The possessor of parts is also perceived only by the sense faculties.

original: dbang po'i ldan pa brtags pa yin la //
analyzed: dbang po'i ldan pa brtags pa yin la //
translated: This is the examination of the possession of faculties.

original: de ni rdo tshan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ldan pa la yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni rdo tshan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ldan pa la yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that is present in the possession of the characteristics of a hot stone, etc.,

original: ci ltar dbang po'i ldan pa med /
analyzed: ci ltar dbang po'i ldan pa med /
translated: how can there be no possession of faculties?

original: des na rdzas gnyis kho na la ldan pa yod do zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na rdzas gnyis kho na la ldan pa yod do zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the presentation that only two substances have possession is not tenable.

original: rten mthong med par ga la rtogs //
analyzed: rten mthong med par ga la rtogs //
translated: How can one conceive of the support without seeing it?

original: zhes bya ba bshad nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bshad nas /
translated: Having explained this,

original: ro gzugs la sogs pa ldan pa 'gal zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ro gzugs la sogs pa ldan pa 'gal zhes bya ba bshad pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to explain the contradiction of the possession of form, taste, etc.,

original: gzhan yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes smos so //
translated: he says, moreover.

original: mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi ldan pa'o //
translated: With regard to seeing, it is possession in the context.

original: btung ba la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: btung ba la sogs pa'am /
translated: With regard to drinking, etc.,

original: rdo tshan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ldan pa mthong ba la /
analyzed: rdo tshan la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ldan pa mthong ba la /
translated: or the possession of the characteristics of a hot stone, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: form, etc., are not possessed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yon tan la zhes smos so //
analyzed: yon tan la zhes smos so //
translated: He says, with regard to the qualities.

original: yon tan ni rdzas kho na'i yin gyi /
analyzed: yon tan ni rdzas kho na'i yin gyi /
translated: The qualities belong to substances alone.

original: yon tan la ni yod tan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan la ni yod tan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The qualities do not exist with regard to the qualities.

original: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa de dag ni yan lag gi yin gyi //
analyzed: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa de dag ni yan lag gi yin gyi //
translated: But if you think that form and so on are the parts of the drink,

original: btung ba la sogs pa'i ni ma yin no snyam na de la zhes smos te /üîΩbtung ba'o // yan lag @130a * //
analyzed: btung ba la sogs pa'i ni ma yin no snyam na de la zhes smos te / btung ba'o // yan lag @130a * //
translated: but not the parts of the sugar and so on, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna addresses this point:üîΩThe drink is the parts of the sugar and so on.

original: rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni bur ma la sog pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni bur ma la sog pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The parts are the parts of the sugar and so on.

original: mngon sum la de las bzlog par snang ba'i phyir ro snyam du zhe la bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la de las bzlog par snang ba'i phyir ro snyam du zhe la bzhag pa'o //
translated: Because it appears to direct perception in a way that is opposite to that.

original: nye bar brtags pa las zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa las zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs response is ‚ÄúIt is imputed in dependence on the parts.‚Äù

original: sun 'byin pa ni blo tha dad par thal lo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni blo tha dad par thal lo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIt follows that there would be different cognitions.‚Äù

original: don 'di yin te btung ba'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid nye bar 'dogs pa yin no zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te btung ba'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid nye bar 'dogs pa yin no zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: The point is this: It is not tenable to impute the form and so on that exist in the state of the drink.

original: de ni dngos su nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos su nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is directly experienced.

original: 'jig rten btung ba la bu ram la sogs pa rdzas du ma'i rang bzhin du tha snyad 'dogs pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten btung ba la bu ram la sogs pa rdzas du ma'i rang bzhin du tha snyad 'dogs pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: The world does not impute the drink as the nature of many substances such as sugar.

original: 'on kyang de'i gnas skabs na yod pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i gnas skabs na yod pa nyid du'o //
translated: but it is in the state of being drunk.

original: de lta bu'i tha snyad yod du chug pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tha snyad yod du chug pa de ltar na yang /
translated: Even though such a convention is possible,

original: btung ba la blo tha dad pa yod par thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btung ba la blo tha dad pa yod par thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it would follow that there would be a different cognition for each of the components of the drink.

original: btung ba'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i blor mi 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: btung ba'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa snang ba'i blor mi 'gyur gyi //
translated: The cognition that appears in the state of being drunk would not be a cognition of form, etc.

original: 'o na kyang bur ma la sogs pa yan lag rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na kyang bur ma la sogs pa yan lag rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But, on the other hand, it would be a cognition of the form, etc. of the components, sugar, etc.

original: don gcig la 'du bas nye bar btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gcig la 'du bas nye bar btags pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are designated as being in a composite that has a single referent.

original: zho la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: zho la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCurds, etc.‚Äù is explained below.

original: gang la btung ba zhes bya ba'i ldan pa 'du ba de nyid la /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang la btung ba zhes bya ba'i ldan pa 'du ba de nyid la / gzugs la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: In that very composite that is called ‚Äúdrink,‚ÄùüîΩthere is a single referent because of the existence of form, etc.

original: don gcig la 'du ba yin gyi btung ba'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i ro dang gzugs gzhan dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba yin gyi btung ba'i gnas skabs na yod pa'i ro dang gzugs gzhan dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: There is a composite of a single referent, but the taste and form that exist in the state of being drunk are not perceived as being different.

original: gal te nye bar gtugs pa'i mthu kho nas gzugs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te nye bar gtugs pa'i mthu kho nas gzugs la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If form, etc. were to become something by the power of mere designation,üîΩthen, if it were not so, the learned would argue about where the designation is made.

original: de lta ma yin na gang du nye bar 'dogs pa zhes pa rgyal mi mkhas pa dag rtsod pa smra 'gyur bas de la bshad pa ni ldan pa can gyi gzugs gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gang du nye bar 'dogs pa zhes pa rgyal mi mkhas pa dag rtsod pa smra 'gyur bas de la bshad pa ni ldan pa can gyi gzugs gang yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚Äúwhatever form is possessed.‚Äù

original: nye bar btags phyir zhes bya ba 'dir bcad do //
analyzed: nye bar btags phyir zhes bya ba 'dir bcad do //
translated: Here, the phrase ‚Äúbecause of designation‚Äù is supplied.

original: gal te 'dir nye bar btags pa'i mthu yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir nye bar btags pa'i mthu yin na /
translated: If it is the power of designation here,

original: de'i tshe nye bar btags bzhin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid 'dir mthong bar 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: de'i tshe nye bar btags bzhin pa'i gzugs la sogs pa nyid 'dir mthong bar 'gyur gyi //
translated: then form, etc. as designated would be seen here.

original: gang du nye bar gdags zhes brjod pa de la ldan pa nyid nye bar btags pa'i gzhir 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gang du nye bar gdags zhes brjod pa de la ldan pa nyid nye bar btags pa'i gzhir 'gyur mod /
translated: In that case, the basis of designation would be possession itself, not where the designation is made.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni ldan pa'i yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni ldan pa'i yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of that is ‚Äúof the possessor.‚Äù

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o /
translated: ‚ÄúIf, on the other hand‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: gang gis nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba 'di rnam pa thams cad du gzugs gzhan kho na snang ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gis nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ba 'di rnam pa thams cad du gzugs gzhan kho na snang ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: This fault does not arise, because the other form does not appear in any way.

original: 'o na kyang gzugs dang ro de dag nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'o na kyang gzugs dang ro de dag nyid yin te /
translated: But the form and taste of the drink are the same as those of the ingredients.

original: bur ma la sogs pa yan lag la 'dus pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩde ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba ni btung ba'i gnas @130b skabs na /
analyzed: bur ma la sogs pa yan lag la 'dus pa gang yin pa'o // de ltar ma yin te zhes bya ba ni btung ba'i gnas @130b skabs na /
translated: The drink is a composite of sugar, etc.üîΩIf that were not so,üîΩthe drink would have a different nature from that of the ingredients.

original: snga na med pa'i rang bzhin can du'o //üîΩgcig tu zhes bya ba ni de dag gzhan nyid du'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i rang bzhin can du'o // gcig tu zhes bya ba ni de dag gzhan nyid du'o //
translated: If it were different,

original: gcig gis smras ba zhes ba ba la sogs ba ltar gcig gi sgra ni gzhan gyi don brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gis smras ba zhes ba ba la sogs ba ltar gcig gi sgra ni gzhan gyi don brjod pa'o //
translated: the word ‚Äúone‚Äù in the statement ‚Äúone says‚Äù would refer to something else.üîΩOr, if the drink is a composite of the ingredients, sugar, etc.,

original: yang na gal te bur ma la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams 'dras pa yin yang nor bu mdog sna tshogs pa 'dres pa ltar tha dad par rtogs par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: yang na gal te bur ma la sogs pa'i yan lag rnams 'dras pa yin yang nor bu mdog sna tshogs pa 'dres pa ltar tha dad par rtogs par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: why is it not understood to be different, as a variegated gem is?

original: de ji ltar na btung ba'i gnas skabs na gzugs dang ro gzhan dmigs she na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na btung ba'i gnas skabs na gzugs dang ro gzhan dmigs she na /
translated: How is it that the form and taste of the drink are perceived to be different from those of the ingredients?

original: de dag shin du 'dres bzhi zhes smos so //
analyzed: de dag shin du 'dres bzhi zhes smos so //
translated: The text says that the ingredients are ‚Äúthoroughly mixed.‚Äù

original: nor bu'i phud bo ci lta 'dres pa de 'dra bar ni btung ba'i gnas skabs na bu ram la sogs pa'i yan lag 'dres pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nor bu'i phud bo ci lta 'dres pa de 'dra bar ni btung ba'i gnas skabs na bu ram la sogs pa'i yan lag 'dres pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Just as a mixture of jewels is not a mixture of the parts of sugar, etc.

original: 'on kyang de dang mi 'dra ba shin du 'dres pa yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir shin du 'dres pa'i bu ram la sogs pa'i yan lag gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dang mi 'dra ba shin du 'dres pa yin no // gang gi phyir shin du 'dres pa'i bu ram la sogs pa'i yan lag gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: when they are drunk, but rather is a mixture of something else, so too is a mixture of sugar, etc.üîΩBecause it is the cause for the perception of the parts of sugar, etc.

original: ldan pa can gyi gzugs dang ro nyid gzugs dang ro gzhan mngon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ldan pa can gyi gzugs dang ro nyid gzugs dang ro gzhan mngon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: as a single entity, the form and taste of the mixture are different from the form and taste of the parts.üîΩThis is the meaning.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: If that were so,

original: gal te de dag nyid yin na ci ltar gzhan du rtog zhes bya ba'i sun 'byin pa yal bar dor nas gzhan brjod pa /üîΩci ltar gzugs dang ro de dag nyid gzhan du mngon pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab nyid rags pa'i rang bzhin du mngon pa'am /
analyzed: gal te de dag nyid yin na ci ltar gzhan du rtog zhes bya ba'i sun 'byin pa yal bar dor nas gzhan brjod pa / ci ltar gzugs dang ro de dag nyid gzhan du mngon pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab nyid rags pa'i rang bzhin du mngon pa'am /
translated: if the parts were the whole, then why imagine that the whole is something other than the parts?

original: de lta bu'i tha snyad dang ldan par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tha snyad dang ldan par 'gyur mod /
translated: If the form and taste of the parts were manifest as something other, then the subtle particles themselves would be manifest as the nature of the coarse, or they would be associated with such a convention.

original: yan lag can gyis ci bya /
analyzed: yan lag can gyis ci bya /
translated: What is the use of a whole?

original: rnam pa gzhan du snang bar thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du snang bar thal lo zhe na /
translated: It follows that it would appear in a different aspect.

original: tha snyad la 'tshol bar bya ste /
analyzed: tha snyad la 'tshol bar bya ste /
translated: We will investigate the conventional.

original: ci skad du /
analyzed: ci skad du /
translated: As it will be explained:

original: de yi gzugs dang bral na yang //
analyzed: de yi gzugs dang bral na yang //
translated: Even though it is devoid of form,

original: rnam par gzhan du snang bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'chad par 'gyur ba bzhin no //üîΩde kho nar ni gzhan snang ba ma yin la med pa snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par gzhan du snang bar 'gyur // zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba bzhin no // de kho nar ni gzhan snang ba ma yin la med pa snang ba ma yin te /
translated: it appears in a different aspect.

original: rdul phra rab kyi chogs kyis byas pa blo'i rnam pa'i dngos po dang 'dra ba kho na rig pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi chogs kyis byas pa blo'i rnam pa'i dngos po dang 'dra ba kho na rig pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod zin to //
translated: In reality, it does not appear as something else, nor does it appear as nonexistent, because we have already explained that it is known to be just the entity of an aspect of consciousness produced by a collection of subtle atoms.

original: skabs su bab pa rdul phra bab sogs pa tsam gyi rang bzhin bu ram la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams phan tshun phan 'dogs pas de dag nyid khyad par can skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa rdul phra bab sogs pa tsam gyi rang bzhin bu ram la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams phan tshun phan 'dogs pas de dag nyid khyad par can skyes pa yin te /
translated: In the present context, the nature of things such as sugar, which is just a collection of subtle atoms, is a special creation of those things themselves, because they mutually assist each other.

original: de lta de lta bu'i rtogs pa skyed par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta de lta bu'i rtogs pa skyed par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which produces such and such an understanding.

original: des na nyes pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: des na nyes pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: 'dis ni gal te nye bar btags pa las 'dod na blo tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gal te nye bar btags pa las 'dod na blo tha dad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the following: ‚ÄúIf you accept that the cognition is due to the designation, then the cognition would not be different.‚Äù

original: ci ltar phreng ring zhes byar 'gyur //
analyzed: ci ltar phreng ring zhes byar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be a long garland?

original: zhes yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAgain‚Äù means repeatedly.

original: khyad par can gyi rtogs pa yin no cog gang yin pa gal te don tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi rtogs pa yin no cog gang yin pa gal te don tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
translated: If the cognition of a long garland is due to the cause of a different object,

original: de'i tshe phreng ring ngo snyam du dogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes @131a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe phreng ring ngo snyam du dogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes @131a * //
translated: then the cognition of a long garland would not occur.‚Äù

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.üîΩWhy is this?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩphreng zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / phreng zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why?üîΩThe term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is a term that indicates the rest.üîΩ

original: gal te ldan pa la sogs pa nyid phreng ba yin nam /
analyzed: gal te ldan pa la sogs pa nyid phreng ba yin nam /
translated: If the garland is the possession, etc.,

original: des na de skad ci ste brjod snyam na /
analyzed: des na de skad ci ste brjod snyam na /
translated: then why is it said in that way?‚Äù

original: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
translated: Thus it is said.üîΩüîΩ

original: ldan pa med phyir zhes bya ba ni phan tshun ma 'brel bar gnas pa'i phyir ldan ba med do //
analyzed: ldan pa med phyir zhes bya ba ni phan tshun ma 'brel bar gnas pa'i phyir ldan ba med do //
translated: Because there is no possession‚Äù means that there is no possession because they do not exist in mutual relationship.

original: 'di ltar nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is illustrated in this way,üîΩ‚Äú

original: yon tan gyi tshig gi don mtha' dag bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan gyi tshig gi don mtha' dag bkag pa yin no //
translated: All the meanings of the words ‚Äúquality‚Äù are refuted.

original: de'i nang na ldan pa srid pa'i phyir 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i nang na ldan pa srid pa'i phyir 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Since possession is possible among them, it is refuted.

original: de nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni ldan pa med pa nyid kyi phyir phreng ni rdzas ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid phyir zhes bya ba ni ldan pa med pa nyid kyi phyir phreng ni rdzas ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, i.e., because there is no possession, a garland is not a substance.

original: rdzas ni ldan pas rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas ni ldan pas rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A substance is that which begins with possession.

original: de ni rigs la sogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs la sogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not a class, etc.,

original: gang gi phyir rigs la sogs pa la ni ring po nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs la sogs pa la ni ring po nyid yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a class, etc., does not have the quality of length.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bya ba dang spyi dang khyad par rnams 'phangs pa yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bya ba dang spyi dang khyad par rnams 'phangs pa yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù implies action, universals, and particulars.

original: de dag kyang ring po'i tshad dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang ring po'i tshad dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: They also do not have the measure of length.

original: rdzas la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they depend on substance.

original: des na ring po la sogs pa'i khyad par mi 'thad pa'i phyir na rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ring po la sogs pa'i khyad par mi 'thad pa'i phyir na rigs pa ma yin no //

original: ring po la sogs pa'i khyad par dang bral ba yang rigs la sogs pa'i khongs su 'du ba pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni de ni rigs sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa'i khyad par dang bral ba yang rigs la sogs pa'i khongs su 'du ba pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni de ni rigs sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThat is not so, because of the absence of the distinction of long, etc.,‚Äù is the response.

original: de dag kyang ring po'i tshad dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang ring po'i tshad dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: And those are not endowed with the measure of long, etc.

original: shing gi blo bzhin du gcig la yang de lta bu'i blo skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: shing gi blo bzhin du gcig la yang de lta bu'i blo skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that it would follow, absurdly, that the cognition of that would arise in regard to a single thing, just as it does in regard to a tree.

original: gal te grangs gcig ring po yin no snyam na ;
analyzed: gal te grangs gcig ring po yin no snyam na ;
translated: If you think that the number one is long,

original: de lta na yang ring po la sogs par mi 'thad do zhes /üîΩrigs sogs la ni ring nyid med //
analyzed: de lta na yang ring po la sogs par mi 'thad do zhes / rigs sogs la ni ring nyid med //
translated: then even so, it is not tenable that it is long, etc.

original: ces bya ba 'dis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is stated by the line ‚ÄúThere is no length in a class, etc.‚Äù

original: bkod pa'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skabs la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bkod pa'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni skabs la sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the difference in arrangement,‚Äù and so on, is applied to the context.

original: yin zhes rigs zhes bya ba'i zhes kyi sgra nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: yin zhes rigs zhes bya ba'i zhes kyi sgra nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is a contraction of ‚Äúthat is a class.‚Äù

original: don can ni dang por lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don can ni dang por lta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning should be understood first.

original: des na don 'dir 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na don 'dir 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning:

original: gang gi phyir phreng zhes bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /üîΩci ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs khyad par gyis rnam par gnas pa rnams la /üîΩring po la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ba de bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par du gnas ba de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phreng zhes bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir / ci ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs khyad par gyis rnam par gnas pa rnams la / ring po la sogs pa'i blor 'gyur ba de bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par du gnas ba de nyid kyis na /
translated: therefore,üîΩthe cognition of long, etc., arises in regard to things that are arranged in a particular way, as is desired.

original: yan lag can gyi yul can gyi blo de ni rdul phra rab rnams la yin par rigs so //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi yul can gyi blo de ni rdul phra rab rnams la yin par rigs so //
translated: In just the same way, the cognition of the possessor of parts in regard to the minute particles is also tenable, due to the very same particular arrangement that is desired.

original: dper na zhes bya ba 'chad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba 'chad par byed pa'o //
translated: For example,

original: tha ma'i yan lag can gyi rang bzhin gyi me tog rigs mi mthun pa'i rang bzhin gyi phreng ba ni rdzas kyi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha ma'i yan lag can gyi rang bzhin gyi me tog rigs mi mthun pa'i rang bzhin gyi phreng ba ni rdzas kyi ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: the nature of the final possessor of parts, the garland, is not a substance, because it is the nature of a garland that is a different type.

original: gnas ba'i khyad par tsam gyis me tog rnams kyi phreng ba ring po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin @131b no ;
analyzed: gnas ba'i khyad par tsam gyis me tog rnams kyi phreng ba ring po zhes bya ba'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin @131b no ;
translated: Therefore, the convention ‚Äúlong garland of flowers‚Äù is due to the mere particular arrangement of the flowers.

original: / rang bzhin du zhes bya ba de kho na ltar te /
analyzed: / rang bzhin du zhes bya ba de kho na ltar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: phreng ba la sogs pa'i ring po nyid lta bu kho nar ro zhas bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phreng ba la sogs pa'i ring po nyid lta bu kho nar ro zhas bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is like the length of a rosary, etc.

original: rtsod pa'i gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag can gyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa'i yul gyi don dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yan lag can gyi mtshan nyid du 'dod pa'i yul gyi don dngos po ma yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúdisputed‚Äù means that the object, which is asserted to be the characteristic of the whole, is not a real entity.

original: de ltar rang gi ngo bo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi ngo bo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the phrase ‚Äúin terms of its own nature,‚Äù etc.,

original: 'jug par byed pa ni gang las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa ni gang las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says, ‚Äúthat from which it is derived.‚Äù

original: smras pa ni zhes bya ba la ci zhig smra snyam na /
analyzed: smras pa ni zhes bya ba la ci zhig smra snyam na /
translated: He says, ‚Äúit is said,‚Äù but what is said?

original: ldan pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrigs pa mtshungs pas na skabs kyi ldan pa sun dbyung ba nye bar mtshon par byed par smras pa ni /
analyzed: ldan pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o // rigs pa mtshungs pas na skabs kyi ldan pa sun dbyung ba nye bar mtshon par byed par smras pa ni /
translated: He says, ‚Äúpossession, etc.‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes smos so //
translated: In order to illustrate the refutation of possession in this context by means of a similar argument, he says, ‚Äúform, etc.‚Äù

original: 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba ni rdzas gzhan bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba ni rdzas gzhan bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He says, ‚Äúonly‚Äù in order to refute the existence of a separate substance.

original: 'byor pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: The opponent says, ‚Äúit is a combination.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i spyod yul du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i spyod yul du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the same way‚Äù means in the objective domain.

original: 'di gnyis 'byor pa yin no snyam pa'i blos ni ldan pa khyad par nyid du 'phen par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di gnyis 'byor pa yin no snyam pa'i blos ni ldan pa khyad par nyid du 'phen par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the mind that thinks ‚Äúthese two are endowed‚Äù projects the special possession.

original: sun 'byin pa ni 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ni 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The refutation is ‚Äúthe word ‚Äòendowed‚Äô . . .‚Äù

original: ldan pa can nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni don gnyis las tha dad par gyur pa ldan pa'i rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ldan pa can nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni don gnyis las tha dad par gyur pa ldan pa'i rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the cognition of possession does not become different from the two objects.

original: 'o na sgra la yul tha dad pa yod pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na sgra la yul tha dad pa yod pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the word has a different object,

original: 'byor pa'i sgra la zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'byor pa'i sgra la zhes smos so //
translated: the word ‚Äúendowed‚Äù . . .

original: yang gi sgras ni ldan pa can gyi sgra sdud pa'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni ldan pa can gyi sgra sdud pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes the word ‚Äúendowed.‚Äù

original: gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i khyad par ro //üîΩ'o na lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas kyang /
analyzed: gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'i khyad par ro // 'o na lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas kyang /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no other‚Äù refers to the special possession.

original: sgra dang rtogs pa dag gi yul gang yin snyam na /
analyzed: sgra dang rtogs pa dag gi yul gang yin snyam na /
translated: If you think that the word and the cognition also have an object in dependence on the object of adherence,

original: der ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: der ni zhes smos so //
translated: the word ‚Äúthere‚Äù . . .

original: ldan pa can de las gzhan 'byor ba'i bla'i yul du gyur pa'i ldan pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ldan pa can de las gzhan 'byor ba'i bla'i yul du gyur pa'i ldan pa ni yod pa ma yin no //

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'byor pa'i sgra brjod par bya ba med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'byor pa'i sgra brjod par bya ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the term ‚Äúendowed‚Äù is not used.

analyzed: ldan pa gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: How do you know that there is no other kind of possession?

original: ci ltar zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: ci ltar zhes gsungs so ;
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúHow could it be . . .‚Äù

original: / bar ma chod pa'i don gnyis las tha dad par gnas pa ni med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / bar ma chod pa'i don gnyis las tha dad par gnas pa ni med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no possession that is different from the two things that are possessed.

original: 'o na ci ltar ldan pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad tha dad par 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar ldan pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad tha dad par 'gyur snyam na /

original: rjes 'gro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rjes 'gro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúIt is said that . . .‚Äù

original: ldan par ma gyur pa dag la gnas skabs de ma dmigs pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: ldan par ma gyur pa dag la gnas skabs de ma dmigs pa'i phyir na /
translated: The meaning is that when things are not endowed, the state of being endowed is not perceived.

original: gnas skabs de ldog par brjod pa yin no ;
analyzed: gnas skabs de ldog par brjod pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the state of being endowed is said to be reversed.

original: / de dag ni dmigs pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: / de dag ni dmigs pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: When things are endowed, the state of being endowed is perceived.

original: gal te ldan pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum nyid yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te ldan pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum nyid yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If direct perception does not establish possession and the other two kinds of things,

original: de la log par rtog pa ci 'dra ba zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: de la log par rtog pa ci 'dra ba zhig yod ce na /
translated: what kind of misconception could there be about them?

original: mngon sum gyis ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni zhes gsungs so //
