original: des bskyed pa'i bag chags gang yin pa des 'dus byas pa'i bdag nyid gang yang yod pa de dag gi thog ma med pa'i skad cig 'di ni rtog pa rnam par rtog pa dang sgra ste de la yod pa'o //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i bag chags gang yin pa des 'dus byas pa'i bdag nyid gang yang yod pa de dag gi thog ma med pa'i skad cig 'di ni rtog pa rnam par rtog pa dang sgra ste de la yod pa'o //
translated: The latent potentialities that are produced by that cause the existence of any nature that is compounded.  Those beginningless moments are conceptual thoughts, discriminations, and words.

original: gang gi phyir tha snyad 'di thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i dbang gis nges pa yin pa des na gang la'ang zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pa la mi brtsad de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha snyad 'di thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi rnam par 'gyur ba'i dbang gis nges pa yin pa des na gang la'ang zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pa la mi brtsad de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since this convention is ascertained by the power of beginningless latent potentialities, therefore, ‚Äúin regard to anything‚Äù means that one should not dispute with the Buddhists.

original: don dam pa'i khyad par med na khyad par dang khyad par can la sogs pa'i dngos por ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya bar ro //üîΩ'dis ni brgal zhing brtag par bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i khyad par med na khyad par dang khyad par can la sogs pa'i dngos por ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya bar ro // 'dis ni brgal zhing brtag par bya ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is no difference in the ultimate, how could there be things that are the differentiators and the differentiated?üîΩThis does not teach that there is nothing at all to be disputed or investigated.

original: rgol zhing rtog pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gang gi kyang ni brtsad mi bya zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgol zhing rtog pa yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gang gi kyang ni brtsad mi bya zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthere is no dispute or investigation‚Äù means that ‚Äúno one should dispute.‚Äù

original: rigs pa can la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rigs pa can la sogs pas so //
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas and so on.

original: gal te de ltar sgra don rnam par gzhag pa la 'chad pa med mod /
analyzed: gal te de ltar sgra don rnam par gzhag pa la 'chad pa med mod /
translated: If it is not so, then the meaning of the word is not established.

original: de lta na yang spyi la sogs pa ltos par bya ba yin no zhes gzhan dag brgya la smra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gal te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta na yang spyi la sogs pa ltos par bya ba yin no zhes gzhan dag brgya la smra bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gal te zhes gsungs so //
translated: But still, others might say that the universal and so on are dependent.

original: ji skad du brjod pa'i blo'i rnam par 'gyur ba tsam gyis bkod pa don dam pa ma yin pa la /
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa'i blo'i rnam par 'gyur ba tsam gyis bkod pa don dam pa ma yin pa la /
translated: The mere arrangement of the mind as it is expressed is not ultimate.

original: spyi bzhi mthun pa la sogs pa rnam la /
analyzed: spyi bzhi mthun pa la sogs pa rnam la /
translated: The universal, the particular, inherence and so on are all non-existent.

original: gal te ji skad brjod pa'i rigs pas cad pa 'ga' yang med na /üîΩde de'i tshe gang gi spyi sogs pa de yod pa la ltos par bya ba yin no zhes rtsod par byed pa rigs ldan min la 'dir ci smos te /
analyzed: gal te ji skad brjod pa'i rigs pas cad pa 'ga' yang med na / de de'i tshe gang gi spyi sogs pa de yod pa la ltos par bya ba yin no zhes rtsod par byed pa rigs ldan min la 'dir ci smos te /
translated: If there is no such thing as the universal as it is expressed by reasoning,üîΩthen at that time it is reasonable to argue that the universal and so on exist in dependence on something.

original: yan lag can dang ldan pa la sogs pa rigs ldan min la ste /
analyzed: yan lag can dang ldan pa la sogs pa rigs ldan min la ste /
translated: What need is there to mention the non-existence of the possessor of parts and so on?üîΩWhat is the point of a non-valid cognition being dependent? What is there to depend on?

original: tshad ma can ma yin pa la ci ltos te ltos par bya ba ci yod de ltar brjod bya bslad par bstan nas /
analyzed: tshad ma can ma yin pa la ci ltos te ltos par bya ba ci yod de ltar brjod bya bslad par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the corruption of the object of expression,

original: skabs kyis rjod par byed pa yang log pa dang log pa ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba rnam pa'i bslad par bstan pa'i don du tha mal zhes smos so /
analyzed: skabs kyis rjod par byed pa yang log pa dang log pa ma yin pa'i rnam par dbye ba rnam pa'i bslad par bstan pa'i don du tha mal zhes smos so /
translated: The word ‚Äúordinary‚Äù is used to show that the expression is also divided into false and non-false according to the division of the forms of the expression.

analyzed: tha mal pa'i bstan bcos la sgra'i 'dus byas pa gang yin pa der ma 'chol ba mthong ba med do //
translated: In ordinary treatises, one does not see any unmixed use of verbal forms.

original: gang zhig ce na rtags so //
analyzed: gang zhig ce na rtags so //

original: dper na ston sha ra do zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: dper na ston sha ra do zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: For example, in the word ≈õƒÅrada,

original: sha rad de dang san  gyi mtha' can dang / pra ned dang / shi ro dang / na bha dang / skyes bu'o zhes bya bas pho rtags su 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sha rad de dang san  gyi mtha' can dang / pra ned dang / shi ro dang / na bha dang / skyes bu'o zhes bya bas pho rtags su 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: it is the gender of a male, as in ≈õƒÅrada, ≈õa·πÉkara, pra·πáet·πõ, ≈õarƒ´ra, nƒÅbha, and puru·π£a.

original: tshig kyang ma 'chol bar mthong ba med de per na khyed cag rnams kyi nor zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig kyang ma 'chol bar mthong ba med de per na khyed cag rnams kyi nor zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: @139a * // tumha nang zhes bya ba drug pa mang po'i tshig gi mtha' can khyed gnyis zhes bya ba'i don la sbyor ba bzhin no //

analyzed: de skad du yang mdo las gnyis la mang po'i tshig go zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe word ‚Äòtwo‚Äô is a plural.üîΩ‚Äù

analyzed: gal te de ltar rtags la sogs pa tha dad bar 'gyur mod / don ni gcig bo nas yin no snyam na ;

translated: For example, in the expression ‚ÄúƒÅsa·πÉ,‚Äù

analyzed: tha ma la par ni bdag nyid rjod par byed pa yin la /
translated: the final letter ‚Äúm‚Äù expresses itself,

analyzed: legs par sbyar ba ni chu 'thung ba rjod par byed pa bzhin no //

translated: What is the problem with that?

analyzed: zhes smos so //

analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rtags la sogs pa phyin ci log dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: 'gyur bar srid pa yin no zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'i don to //

analyzed: de yang ma yin no zhes bya ba brjod pa ni /

analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni legs bsgrubs la // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Well-formed by its own characteristics,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ji lta ba yis bye brag tu bsgrubs pa'i sgra las legs par byas brjod pa yin la /

analyzed: de ni legs bar sbyar ba dang tha mal pa la mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: And that is the same for both the well-formed and the ordinary.

analyzed: des ji ltar gcig legs par sbyar ba yin la gzhan ma yin te /

analyzed: rang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis legs par bsgrubs pa ni thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because all are well-formed by their own characteristics.

original: 'on te legs par sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid ston pa'i skyes bu tshad ma yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te legs par sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid ston pa'i skyes bu tshad ma yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that a person who teaches the characteristics of the well-formed is authoritative, not another,

original: 'di la rigs pa 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: 'di la rigs pa 'ga' yang med de /
translated: then there is no logic to that at all.

original: 'di ni dod pa'i don 'don pa tsam du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dod pa'i don 'don pa tsam du ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows that it is merely a substitute for the original meaning.

original: de'i phyir tha mal pa la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha mal pa la sogs pa yang /
translated: Therefore, even ordinary words

original: mtshan nyid kyis bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir na legs par sbyar ba dang cig shos kyis rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir legs pa dang mi legs par rnam par gnas pa med do //üîΩ'on te / legs sbyar zhes bya lha yi ngag / drang srong chen po rnams kyis bshad //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir na legs par sbyar ba dang cig shos kyis rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir legs pa dang mi legs par rnam par gnas pa med do // 'on te / legs sbyar zhes bya lha yi ngag / drang srong chen po rnams kyis bshad //
translated: are established by their definitions, and since there is no distinction between correct and incorrect forms, there is no distinction between correct and incorrect forms.üîΩBut if you think that the divine language is correct Sanskrit,

original: zhes bya bas lha'i tshig ni legs bar sbyar ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya bas lha'i tshig ni legs bar sbyar ba yin la /

analyzed: de las gzhan ni legs par sbyar ba ma yin no snyam du dgongs na / legs par sbyar dang legs sbyar min //

original: zhes smos so //üîΩ@139b 'di kho na lha'i ngag yin no zhes bya ba la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes smos so // @139b 'di kho na lha'i ngag yin no zhes bya ba la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: des na 'di ltar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni 'dir ni zhes bya ba ste /

analyzed: don yod ma yin yang zhes bya ba'i sgra rnams ni don rtogs pa tsam la nye bar mkho ba yin na de ni legs par sbyar ba ma yin pa la yang nyams pa med do //
translated: The words ‚Äúnot only‚Äù are needed to understand the meaning, but that is not impaired in incorrect speech.

original: 'di zhes bya na ni sgra bye brag tu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya na ni sgra bye brag tu bshad pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú This‚Äù refers to the explanation of the words.

original: phyis gzhan nyid bcos zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi tshogs kyi tshul du de'i lam du 'jug pa dag go /
analyzed: phyis gzhan nyid bcos zhes bya ba ni ba lang gi tshogs kyi tshul du de'i lam du 'jug pa dag go /

original: des 'dis 'di dag la //
analyzed: des 'dis 'di dag la //
translated: ‚Äú By that, this, these‚Äù

original: ci zhig brjod pa mi shes so //
analyzed: ci zhig brjod pa mi shes so //
translated: ‚Äú I do not know what is being said‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni shin du tshabs chen por legs pa dang legs pa ma yin par 'dzin pa'i rmongs pa bsal ba'i don du ci gzhig brjod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shin du tshabs chen por legs pa dang legs pa ma yin par 'dzin pa'i rmongs pa bsal ba'i don du ci gzhig brjod par bya ba yin te /
translated: means that in order to remove the confusion of grasping at what is very good and what is not good, what is to be said?

original: 'dzin pa dam pa nyid kyis rigs pa brjod kyang mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dam pa nyid kyis rigs pa brjod kyang mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the reasoning is stated by the firm grasping, it is not understood.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyang legs par sbyar dang legs par sbyar ba ma yin pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyang legs par sbyar dang legs par sbyar ba ma yin pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /

original: ma mthong ba'i don brjod ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i don brjod ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said: ‚ÄúThe meaning of what is not seen is expressed.‚Äù

original: gal te las ni 'dis chos su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bro ba'i tshig la yid ches pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te las ni 'dis chos su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bro ba'i tshig la yid ches pa med pa ma yin nam /

analyzed: legs par sbyar ba ma brjod na phung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig la ni yid ches pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then one has confidence in the statement ‚ÄúIf one does not express proper composition, one will be ruined,‚Äù and so on.

original: khyad par che zhe na /üîΩde la zhes smos te /
analyzed: khyad par che zhe na / de la zhes smos te /
translated: If you say that there is a great difference,

original: bro ba'i ngag bzhin no //
analyzed: bro ba'i ngag bzhin no //
translated: then we say that it is like the statement ‚ÄúIn that case.‚ÄùüîΩIt is like the statement ‚ÄúIn that case.‚Äù

original: des zhes bya ba ni nye bar sdud pa'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni nye bar sdud pa'o //

original: de'i phyir brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi dngos po la yang rtog ba rtsam skyabs yin pa'i phyir sgra tsam las ma gtogs par ni yan lag can la sogs pa grub pa med do zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod bya dang rjod byed kyi dngos po la yang rtog ba rtsam skyabs yin pa'i phyir sgra tsam las ma gtogs par ni yan lag can la sogs pa grub pa med do zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, since the entity of the expressed and the expresser is also a mere conceptual superimposition, it is established that apart from mere sound, the possessor of parts and so on do not exist.

analyzed: de ltar yan lag can bsal ba'i phyir na lus 'byung ba'i rdul phra rab kyi tshogs tsam zhig yin par lus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in order to eliminate the whole, only the collection of the subtle particles of the elements of the body remains.

original: des na shes pa de'i nye bar len pa can yin par smra ba rnam par brtag pa'i don du gal te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na shes pa de'i nye bar len pa can yin par smra ba rnam par brtag pa'i don du gal te zhes gsungs so //

original: skyes pa yin na zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa yin na zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //

original: rtsa ba la sogs pa rgyu yin pa lta bu zhig go zhes 'brel to //üîΩyan lag gcig dang bral na'ang min //
analyzed: rtsa ba la sogs pa rgyu yin pa lta bu zhig go zhes 'brel to // yan lag gcig dang bral na'ang min //

original: zhes bya ba ni lus so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus so //

original: min zhes bya ba ni shes pa skyed bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: min zhes bya ba ni shes pa skyed bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNor‚Äù refers to the consciousness.

original: rdul phra rab 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ni rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir na ser mo la sogs pa brjod pa yan lag gi sgras tha snyad du byas so //üîΩrnam par rtog pa @140a * //
analyzed: rdul phra rab 'phel ba dang 'grib pa ni rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir na ser mo la sogs pa brjod pa yan lag gi sgras tha snyad du byas so // rnam par rtog pa @140a * //
translated: Since the increase and decrease of the subtle particles cannot be realized, the statement ‚Äúyellow, etc.‚Äù is conventionally designated by the word ‚Äúpart.‚Äù

original: gnyis pa sel ba ni re re zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa sel ba ni re re zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second conception is eliminated by ‚Äúeach.‚Äù

original: mang por 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro gal ta 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag nges par byed pa yin pa'i phyir cig car mang po 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: mang por 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa mang po 'byung bar 'gyur ro gal ta 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag nges par byed pa yin pa'i phyir cig car mang po 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /

original: du ma nyid du zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: du ma nyid du zhes gsungs so //

original: lus bzhin du 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang yul tha dad par dang 'brel ba'i phyir du ma nyid yin par nges bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus bzhin du 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag kyang yul tha dad par dang 'brel ba'i phyir du ma nyid yin par nges bar byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: de med kyang zhes bya ba ni gcig med kyang po //
analyzed: de med kyang zhes bya ba ni gcig med kyang po //

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa slong ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa slong ba'o //
translated: If, however, etc. raises the second doubt.

original: rnam 'grel gyi lhag ma phyed po 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: rnam 'grel gyi lhag ma phyed po 'chad pa ni /
translated: The remaining half of the commentary on the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å ava is explained.

original: de skyes par byed pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de skyes par byed pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which causes it to arise is.

original: gal te 'di dag skyed byed yin mod /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag skyed byed yin mod /
translated: If these are the causes of arising,

original: de lta na yang lus kyi chu du ma lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir cha gcig med na yang rnam bar shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang lus kyi chu du ma lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir cha gcig med na yang rnam bar shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur snyam na /

analyzed: cha shas gcig 'ga' gang yin pa // zhes gsungs te //

original: thams cad ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin pa'o //

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni lus kyi'o //

original: lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis 'byung rngub dag gi'o //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa zhes bya ba ni skabs kyis 'byung rngub dag gi'o //
translated: The ‚Äúco-operating‚Äù refers to the co-operating of the inhalations and exhalations.

original: des na rnam par shes pa mi skye ba yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa mi skye ba yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //

analyzed: 'on ni lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa gzhan dang gzhan las rnam par shes pa tha dad par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: But if the co-operating factors are different, consciousness will be different.

original: lhan cig byed pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa zhes smos so //

original: 'byung rngub dag kyang zhes bya ba ni lus 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung rngub dag kyang zhes bya ba ni lus 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni lus la brjod pa gan yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni lus la brjod pa gan yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù refers to what is said about the body.

original: 'di dag du ma nyid kyang yul du ma dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag du ma nyid kyang yul du ma dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: thal bde gang yin snyam na yang lag gcig ces gsungs so //
translated: What is the consequence? It is said that there is only one hand.

analyzed: skyes bu gang la dbugs ji tsam yod pa de tsam las dman pa'i gnas skabs na'o //

original: 'di ni thal ba gcig go //
analyzed: 'di ni thal ba gcig go //

analyzed: du ma 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba so sor bus pa'i phyogs la thal ba gnyis pa'o//

original: gal te 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag la gcig nyid du grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba dang rngub pa dag la gcig nyid du grub pa ma yin nam /

analyzed: des na lus bzhin du thal bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /

original: lus bzhin du zhes smos so //
analyzed: lus bzhin du zhes smos so //

original: gang gi phyir 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa thams cad la mtshungs pa'i phyir na lus bzhin du 'di gnyis gcig nyid du ma grub pa de'i @140b phyir thal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa thams cad la mtshungs pa'i phyir na lus bzhin du 'di gnyis gcig nyid du ma grub pa de'i @140b phyir thal ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the existence of contradictory properties is the same for all, these two are not established as one, like the body. Therefore, that consequence still stands.

original: 'on te gcig nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'am rngub pa de dus gzhan du yang rang bzhin gcig nyid yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te gcig nyid du zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba'am rngub pa de dus gzhan du yang rang bzhin gcig nyid yin nam /

original: skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rang bzhin yin //
translated: It is the nature of a moment.

original: de la phyogs dang po la brjod pa ni gcig nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la brjod pa ni gcig nyid yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In regard to the first position, it is said: If it is the same,

original: ma gsal 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rim ma yin bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde rgyu ni rnam par shes pa du ma'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ma gsal 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rim ma yin bar 'gyur ro // de rgyu ni rnam par shes pa du ma'i rgyu'o //
translated: it would not be clear.üîΩThe cause of that is the cause of many consciousnesses.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni du ma gsal bar 'gyur ba sa na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni du ma gsal bar 'gyur ba sa na'o //
translated: Therefore,

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the latter half is explained: Or, is it the same in the other moment?

original: ci'i phyir brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir brgal zhing brtag par 'os pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not proper to dispute?

original: me ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: me ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said: FireüîΩis not.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //

original: khyad par med phyir zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni khyad par med pa'i phyir ri zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: khyad par med phyir zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni khyad par med pa'i phyir ri zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The explanation of this is: Because there is no distinction.

original: 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The elements, etc.

original: re zhig ji ltar me la thal ba med pa de ltar brjod pa ni me las ni zhe pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar me la thal ba med pa de ltar brjod pa ni me las ni zhe pa'o //
translated: Just as it is with fire and ashes, so it is with the other two.

original: dmigs pa ni skye ba'am tshad mas nges pa'o /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni skye ba'am tshad mas nges pa'o /
translated: The object is the arising or the ascertainment by a means of valid knowledge.

original: gal te med de nyid las rim ba dang ldan pa'i du ba mtha' dag skye bar 'gyur na ni de las yang thal bar 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te med de nyid las rim ba dang ldan pa'i du ba mtha' dag skye bar 'gyur na ni de las yang thal bar 'dir 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If smoke were to arise from non-existent fire, then it would follow that it would arise from everything.

original: de lta ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: me gzhan dang gzhan nyid yin bar gsal bar nges par gzungs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me gzhan dang gzhan nyid yin bar gsal bar nges par gzungs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is clearly ascertained that fire is different from everything else.

original: skabs la ni thal bar 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe khyad par brjod pa ni 'dir ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skabs la ni thal bar 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe khyad par brjod pa ni 'dir ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúhere‚Äù is used to indicate that the argument applies only to the present case.

original: sad par byed pa'i rkyen ni yul nye ba'o ;
analyzed: sad par byed pa'i rkyen ni yul nye ba'o ;
translated: The condition that awakens is the proximity of the object.

original: / de yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems kyi rgyu ma yin te ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni sad par byed pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / de yang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems kyi rgyu ma yin te ma nges pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni sad par byed pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: And that is not the cause of the mind of attachment, etc., because it is not ascertained.

original: gcig gi snying du sdug pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan la ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig gi snying du sdug pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan la ma yin no //
translated: What is pleasing to one‚Äôs heart is not so to another.

original: gcig nyid la yang sdug pa nyid //üîΩres 'ga' mi sdug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid la yang sdug pa nyid // res 'ga' mi sdug par 'gyur ro //
translated: and sometimes unpleasant.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nges pa med pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nges pa med pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúindeterminate.‚Äù

original: des na yul ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na yul ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the object is not the cause of desire, etc. This is the idea.

original: sad par byed pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin snyam na /
analyzed: sad par byed pa 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin snyam na /
translated: How do you know that the cause of desire, etc. is not the arousing of the object?

original: sngon gyi 'du byed ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sngon gyi 'du byed ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The text says, ‚Äúby previous dispositions.‚Äù

original: stobs dang ldan pas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa grags par 'gyur la mi ldan pas ni dman par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa grags par 'gyur la mi ldan pas ni dman par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are strong, desire, etc. are strong; when they are weak, they are weak.üîΩ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means: because of the reason that desire, etc. arise from the mind alone, through the exhalation, etc. of breath.üîΩ‚Äú If it is not the cause of the mind‚Äù refers to the previous verse.üîΩ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means: because of the reason that desire, etc. arise from the mind alone, through the exhalation, etc. of breath.üîΩ‚Äú If it is not the cause of the mind‚Äù refers to the previous verse.

original: des na zhes bya na ni gang gi phyir dbugs dbyung ba la sogs pa gcig nyid las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs des na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya na ni gang gi phyir dbugs dbyung ba la sogs pa gcig nyid las 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs des na'o //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means: because of the reason that desire, etc. arise from the mind alone, through the exhalation, etc. of breath.üîΩ‚Äú If it is not the cause of the mind‚Äù refers to the previous verse.üîΩ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means: because of the reason that desire, etc. arise from the mind alone, through the exhalation, etc. of breath.üîΩ‚Äú If it is not the cause of the mind‚Äù refers to the previous verse.üîΩ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means: because of the reason that desire, etc. arise from the mind alone, through the exhalation, etc. of breath.üîΩ‚Äú If it is not the cause of the mind‚Äù refers to the previous verse.üîΩ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means: because of the reason that desire, etc. arise from the mind alone, through the exhalation, etc. of breath.üîΩ‚Äú If it is not the cause of the mind‚Äù refers to the previous verse.üîΩ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means: because of the reason that desire, etc. arise from the mind alone, through the exhalation, etc. of breath.

original: sems kyi rgyu ma yin na zhes bya ba ni sngar ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu ma yin na zhes bya ba ni sngar ro //
translated: ‚Äú If it is not the cause of the mind‚Äù refers to the previous verse.üîΩ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means: because of the reason that desire, etc. arise from the mind alone, through the exhalation, etc. of breath.üîΩ‚Äú If it is not the cause of the mind‚Äù refers to the previous verse.

original: de bas na sngar @141a * //
analyzed: de bas na sngar @141a * //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means: because of the reason that desire, etc. arise from the mind alone, through the ex

original: dang phyis kyang rgyu ma yin ba'i phyir dbugs dbyung ba la sogs pa ni rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang phyis kyang rgyu ma yin ba'i phyir dbugs dbyung ba la sogs pa ni rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is not a cause either before or after.

original: de ste rgyu yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ste rgyu yin na de'i tshe /
translated: If it is a cause, then

original: de'i rang bzhin nam yang na nyams pa med pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir gcig yin yang gcig nyid kyis tshe mang po gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes grub po //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nam yang na nyams pa med pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir gcig yin yang gcig nyid kyis tshe mang po gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes grub po //
translated: because of the nature of that, or because of the absence of deterioration, even if it is one, it is established that many lives are illuminated by that one.

original: de bas na rim gyis kyang du ma'i rgyu nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de bas na rim gyis kyang du ma'i rgyu nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that it is the cause of many even gradually.

original: des na tshu rol mdzes pa las sngon gyi 'du byed pa nyid rgyu yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na tshu rol mdzes pa las sngon gyi 'du byed pa nyid rgyu yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that the cause is the prior formative forces of this life itself.

original: sangs rgyas la ltos nas ni 'di thal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la ltos nas ni 'di thal ba ma yin te /
translated: In relation to the Buddha, this is not a consequence,

original: mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is precisely what is intended.

original: brjod pa yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: brjod pa yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The response is this:

original: gcig nyid na'ang mang gsal 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig nyid na'ang mang gsal 'gyur //
translated: Even if it is one, there is the illumination of many.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: This is the refutation,

original: gcig nyid du 'thad pa ni'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid du 'thad pa ni'o //
translated: and the tenability of oneness is this:

original: de las zhes bya ba ni 'byung rngub las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni 'byung rngub las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from inhalation and exhalation.

original: yang na gal te 'byung rngub las nges pa ma yin na 'o na gang las nges pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: yang na gal te 'byung rngub las nges pa ma yin na 'o na gang las nges pa yin snyam na /
translated: Or, if it is not ascertained from inhalation and exhalation, then from what is it ascertained?

original: de las nges pa yin zhes yang bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las nges pa yin zhes yang bzla bar bya'o //
translated: It should be repeated: ‚ÄúIt is ascertained from that.‚Äù

original: snga ma snga ma'i 'du byed pa las sems phyi ma phyi ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga ma snga ma'i 'du byed pa las sems phyi ma phyi ma nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the subsequent mind is ascertained from the prior formative forces.

original: 'on te snga ma dang phyi mar rang bzhin gcig pa'i blo nyid kyis don du ma 'dzin pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te snga ma dang phyi mar rang bzhin gcig pa'i blo nyid kyis don du ma 'dzin pa yin na /
translated: But if the cognition itself has the same nature in the prior and subsequent moments, and it apprehends many objects,

original: de'i tshe gcig gis du ma shes par mkhas par gyur pa na /
analyzed: de'i tshe gcig gis du ma shes par mkhas par gyur pa na /
translated: then at that time, when it is established that one knows many,

original: don du ma cig car nyid shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don du ma cig car nyid shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that one knows many objects simultaneously.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'gal ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'gal ba med phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because there is no contradiction.

original: rtag pa'i rang bzhin don cig car 'dzin pa la 'gal ba ci yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtag pa'i rang bzhin don cig car 'dzin pa la 'gal ba ci yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no contradiction at all in apprehending many objects simultaneously.

original: 'on te don cig car 'dzin par nus pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te don cig car 'dzin par nus pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: But if it is thought that it is not possible to apprehend many objects simultaneously,

original: rim gyis kyang min zhes smras so //
analyzed: rim gyis kyang min zhes smras so //
translated: then it is said that it is not possible even gradually.

original: dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa las blo gcig nyid du nges pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa las blo gcig nyid du nges pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The mind is not ascertained to be one from the arising of the breath, and so on.

original: des na mang po gsal bar thal ba ji ltar spang bar bya snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na mang po gsal bar thal ba ji ltar spang bar bya snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, how can the consequence of the manifestation of many be avoided?

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni gzhan sangs rgyas pa la 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni gzhan sangs rgyas pa la 'dri ba'o //
translated: Now, the opponent, the Buddhist, asks:

original: gal te rim gyis don mdzad pa'i blo du mar gyur ba de ni de'i tshe de dag cig car 'byung bar brjod pa mdzes pa mdzes pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te rim gyis don mdzad pa'i blo du mar gyur ba de ni de'i tshe de dag cig car 'byung bar brjod pa mdzes pa mdzes pa zhig na /
translated: If the mind that performs its function in sequence becomes many, then it is better to say that they arise simultaneously.

original: 'on kyang de ni gcig kho na yin no zhes dgongs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni gcig kho na yin no zhes dgongs par byed pa ni /
translated: But if you think that it is one alone,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then,

original: gang gi phyir gcig nyid don du mar rim gyis 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig nyid don du mar rim gyis 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na'o //
translated: because of the reason that one is the nature of the gradual apprehension of many objects,

original: 'di la re zhig rang nyid lan 'debs pa ni de yang zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la re zhig rang nyid lan 'debs pa ni de yang zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: here, first, the response is ‚ÄúThat is also not so.‚Äù

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i @141b rnam pa las ma gtogs par yid dmigs pa med pa'i phyir de don du ma 'dzin pa nyid du ji ltar brjod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i @141b rnam pa las ma gtogs par yid dmigs pa med pa'i phyir de don du ma 'dzin pa nyid du ji ltar brjod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the mind does not have an object apart from the aspects of pleasure, etc., how can it be said to apprehend many objects?

original: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni don nyid kyi yin gyi shes pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni don nyid kyi yin gyi shes pa'i bdag nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But the aspects of form, etc. are the objects themselves, not the nature of consciousness.

original: de la snang ba yang gzugs brnyan yin te /
analyzed: de la snang ba yang gzugs brnyan yin te /
translated: The appearance in that is a reflection.

original: rnam pa med pa blo tsam gyi rang bzhin ni rnam pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa blo tsam gyi rang bzhin ni rnam pa thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams nas /
translated: The mere consciousness, which is without aspects, is the nature of all aspects, because it is the basis of all the aspects.

original: gzhan gyis gal te yid ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gal te yid ni zhes smos so //
translated: Thinking this, the opponent says, ‚ÄúIf the mind is without aspects, etc.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa bya ba med pa nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa bya ba med pa nyid la brten nas /
translated: If consciousness is without activity,

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang ma 'brel pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang ma 'brel pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten nas so //
translated: it is consciousness that is not related to the aspect that is its own nature.

original: don gyi gzugs brnyan tsam skye ba yin na /
analyzed: don gyi gzugs brnyan tsam skye ba yin na /
translated: If the mere reflection of the object is produced,

original: de'i tshe don rnam la shes pa dang nye ba'i rim pa khyad par med pa'i phyir nye ba'i don thams cad cig car 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe don rnam la shes pa dang nye ba'i rim pa khyad par med pa'i phyir nye ba'i don thams cad cig car 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, since there would be no difference in the proximity of the object and the consciousness, it would follow that all objects would be apprehended simultaneously.

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su ni 'ga' zhig kho na la shes par yang mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su ni 'ga' zhig kho na la shes par yang mthong ba yin no //
translated: But in the case of attachment and so on, it is seen that consciousness arises in regard to only some objects.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //üîΩgoms pa'i khyad par gyi rim pas gang la chags pa de la gzugs brnyan skye ba'i phyir shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o // goms pa'i khyad par gyi rim pas gang la chags pa de la gzugs brnyan skye ba'i phyir shes pa yin gyi /
translated: But if, on the other hand, it is the other‚Äôs,

original: gzhan la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin te /
translated: then consciousness arises from the image of the object to which one is attached through the process of the special development of habit, but not from any other object.

original: des na cig car don 'dzin par thal ba ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: des na cig car don 'dzin par thal ba ma yin no snyam na /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is the fault of the simultaneous apprehension of objects.

original: lan du 'o na de nyid ces gsungs te ;
analyzed: lan du 'o na de nyid ces gsungs te ;
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúWell then, that itself . . . ‚Äù

original: bsgoms pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsgoms pa nyid do //
translated: is the development of habit.

original: don gyi rnam pa'i zhes bya ba gzugs brnyan gyi'o //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa'i zhes bya ba gzugs brnyan gyi'o //
translated: The form of the object is the image.

original: dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag ni yod kyang 'ga' zhig la chags pa na bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag ni yod kyang 'ga' zhig la chags pa na bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Inhaling and so on are the objects of the mind.

original: de la ni kho bo cag kyang shes pa dang rnam pa dag tha mi dad par sgrub par byed pa de 'dra nga la 'chol ba med do //
analyzed: de la ni kho bo cag kyang shes pa dang rnam pa dag tha mi dad par sgrub par byed pa de 'dra nga la 'chol ba med do //
translated: We also do not accept that the cognition and the aspect are established as being not different.üîΩThe cognition is posited as the apprehender of the object

original: gang gi dbang gis yul rtogs par rnam par gzhag pa /üîΩgoms pa snga ma snga ma sngon du 'gro ba can gyi gzugs brnyan de grub sta /
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis yul rtogs par rnam par gzhag pa / goms pa snga ma snga ma sngon du 'gro ba can gyi gzugs brnyan de grub sta /
translated: on the basis of the prior habituation to the cognition of the object.

original: 'byung dang rngub pa rgyu ma yin na /üîΩde tsam gyis rnam par shes pa thog ma med pa grub pa dang shes pa dang shes bya'i tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pas 'dir gzugs brnyan dang tha mi dad pa'i shes pa btsal ba sa sa ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'byung dang rngub pa rgyu ma yin na / de tsam gyis rnam par shes pa thog ma med pa grub pa dang shes pa dang shes bya'i tha snyad yongs su rdzogs pas 'dir gzugs brnyan dang tha mi dad pa'i shes pa btsal ba sa sa ci zhig bya /
translated: If the prior habituation to the cognition of the object is not the cause,üîΩthen the mere fact that the cognition of the object is established on the basis of the prior habituation to the cognition of the object is not sufficient to establish that the cognition is not different from the object.üîΩThe mere fact that the cognition of the object is established on the basis of the prior habituation to the cognition of the object is not sufficient to establish that the cognition is not different from the object.üîΩThe mere fact that the cognition of the object is established on the basis of the prior habituation to the cognition of the object is not sufficient to establish that the cognition is not different from the object.

original: gzugs brnyan gyi sgras brjod par bya ba'i don /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan gyi sgras brjod par bya ba'i don /
translated: The mere fact that the cognition of the object is established on the basis of the prior habituation to the cognition of the object is not sufficient to establish that the cognition is not different from the object.

original: snga ma snga ma'i goms pa las rgyun 'jug pa de nyid kho bo cag shes pa brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: snga ma snga ma'i goms pa las rgyun 'jug pa de nyid kho bo cag shes pa brjod pa yin te /
translated: The mere fact that the cognition of the object is established on the basis of the prior habituation to the cognition of the object is not sufficient to establish that the cognition is not different from the object.

original: de las gzhan pa'i shes pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde las tha dad @142a * //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i shes pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde las tha dad @142a * //
translated: The mere fact that the cognition of the object is established on the basis of the prior habituation to the cognition of the object is not sufficient to establish that the cognition is not different from the object.üîΩThe mere fact that the cognition of the object is established on the basis of the prior habituation to the cognition of the object is not sufficient to establish that the cognition is not different from the object.üîΩThe mere fact that the cognition of the object is established on the basis of the prior habituation to the cognition of the object is not sufficient to establish that the cognition is not different from the object.üîΩThe mere fact that the cognition of the object is established on the basis of the prior habituation to the cognition of the object is not sufficient to establish that the cognition is not different from the object.üîΩThe mere fact that the cognition of the object is established on the basis of the prior habituation to the cognition of the object is not sufficient to establish that the cognition is not different from the object.üîΩThe mere fact that the cognition of the object is established on the basis of the prior habituation to the cognition of the object is not sufficient to establish that the cognition is not different

original: pa'i shes pa grub pa ni rigs pas kyang gsal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i shes pa grub pa ni rigs pas kyang gsal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The establishment of the cognition of the reflection is also clear by reasoning.

original: de bas na gzugs brnyan 'di ni lus kyis bskyed pa yin yang goms pa snga ma snga ma'i bdag po la stos pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs brnyan 'di ni lus kyis bskyed pa yin yang goms pa snga ma snga ma'i bdag po la stos pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, although this reflection is produced by the body, it is only dependent on the former habitual lord.

original: ltos pa med na ni shes pa tha dad par khas blangs kyang nyes pa de gnas pa kho na'o zhes ston pa ni phyed po phyi ma 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: ltos pa med na ni shes pa tha dad par khas blangs kyang nyes pa de gnas pa kho na'o zhes ston pa ni phyed po phyi ma 'chad pa ni /
translated: If there is no dependence, then even if one admits the difference of cognition, that fault remains. To show this, the latter half is explained.

original: me long bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: me long bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: As in a mirror is said.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i yul las gzhan 'dzin pa'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i yul las gzhan 'dzin pa'i nus pa'o //
translated: But is the ability to apprehend something other than the object of attachment.

original: don gzhan de 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gzhan de 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not apprehend that other object.

original: de yan chad kyis ni brtag pa'i phyogs la dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa bsal nas /
analyzed: de yan chad kyis ni brtag pa'i phyogs la dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa bsal nas /
translated: Up to this point, having refuted the position of investigation as the cause of the cognition of inhalation, etc.,

original: skad cig gi phyogs dgag pa'i don du gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: skad cig gi phyogs dgag pa'i don du gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: for the sake of refuting the position of momentariness, the doubt of others is introduced.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But is said.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med pa'i shes pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad de dbugs 'byung rngub la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni rnam pa med pa'i shes pa 'ga' zhig tu ma zad de dbugs 'byung rngub la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù means not only a certain consciousness without aspects, but also inhalation and exhalation.

original: skad cig mang po ni yan lag can sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig mang po ni yan lag can sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Many moments are refuted as a whole.

original: brgya la dus gcig tu nye bar gnas pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: brgya la dus gcig tu nye bar gnas pa nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du dogs na /
translated: If you suspect that they might exist simultaneously,

original: snga ma dang phyi mar yang de lta bur gyur pa nyid du ston pas rim pa can du ston pa ni /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi mar yang de lta bur gyur pa nyid du ston pas rim pa can du ston pa ni /
translated: he shows that they are sequential, saying:

original: rang rigs min pa'i dus can gyi //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rigs min pa'i dus can gyi // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are not of the same time as their own class.

original: 'di dag rang gi rigs kyi dus na nges par yod pa de bzhen du snga ma dang phyi mar yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag rang gi rigs kyi dus na nges par yod pa de bzhen du snga ma dang phyi mar yang yin te /
translated: They are definitely present at the time of their own class, and likewise, they are also present before and after.

original: de 'dra ba'i tshogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i tshogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a collection exists.

original: de 'dra ba'i sems nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni skad cig mang po dus gcig po der ma nges pa'i'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sems nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni skad cig mang po dus gcig po der ma nges pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch a mind‚Äù means that many moments are not ascertained to be at the same time.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni dbugs dbyung ba dang go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni dbugs dbyung ba dang go //
translated: ‚ÄúThey‚Äù refers to inhalation and exhalation.

original: dang po ni skye pa dang po'o //
analyzed: dang po ni skye pa dang po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe first‚Äù means the first arising.

original: de'i snga rol na rang gi rigs kyi dbugs 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i snga rol na rang gi rigs kyi dbugs 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because prior to that, the exhalation of its type does not exist.

original: de nyid brjod pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba bsnan te /
analyzed: de nyid brjod pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba bsnan te /
translated: That is stated: because,

original: de rgyu de 'dra yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de rgyu de 'dra yod ma yin // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: that cause does not exist.

original: 'jig rten pha rol mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not assert a world beyond.

original: yod kyang zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu de 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yod kyang zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu de 'dra ba'o //
translated: Even if it does exist, that is, even if that cause does exist,

original: de ni med bzhin du la sogs pa khas blangs ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni med bzhin du la sogs pa khas blangs ba yin no //
translated: it is nonexistent, etc.

original: dbugs dbyung ba rnams du ma nyid du nges so //
analyzed: dbugs dbyung ba rnams du ma nyid du nges so //
translated: Exhalations are ascertained to be many.

original: ci'i phyir snyam na dbugs 'byung tha snyad yul can phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snyam na dbugs 'byung tha snyad yul can phyir te /
translated: Why? Because exhalations are the domain of conventional expressions.

original: yul rgya cher khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul rgya cher khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they pervade a vast domain.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba rnams gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba rnams gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because exhalations are one,

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam cig car skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam cig car skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: many conceptualizations would arise simultaneously.

original: 'di ni tshu rol mdzes pa la la 'jig rten pha @142b rol grub par thal ba yang bar dor nas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tshu rol mdzes pa la la 'jig rten pha @142b rol grub par thal ba yang bar dor nas brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is a refutation of the assertion that the world beyond is established from the perspective of those who assert that the world is beautiful here and now.

original: rnam par 'grel pa ni dbugs skad cig ma zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'grel pa ni dbugs skad cig ma zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The commentary is called ‚Äúmomentary breath.‚Äù

original: 'dis rang gi gzhung las 'das kyang gzhan gyi bsgrub bya mi 'grub ba zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis rang gi gzhung las 'das kyang gzhan gyi bsgrub bya mi 'grub ba zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows that even though it goes beyond our own scriptures, it does not establish the thesis of the opponent.

original: rim gyis 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba yang rim gyis 'byung ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung ba ni zhes bya ba ni dbugs 'byung ba yang rim gyis 'byung ba yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Gradual occurrence‚Äù means that the exhalation of breath also occurs gradually.

original: rnam 'grel gnyis pa rnam par 'grel pa na lan gsung pa ni /
analyzed: rnam 'grel gnyis pa rnam par 'grel pa na lan gsung pa ni /
translated: In the commentary on the second verse, the reply is given.

original: dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú That very exhalation of breath, etc.‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol khas ma blangs kyang dbugs nyid dbugs kyi rgyu yin pa de ltar gzhan dag 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni pha ma'i dbugs nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol khas ma blangs kyang dbugs nyid dbugs kyi rgyu yin pa de ltar gzhan dag 'dod pa'i dogs pa bsu ba ni pha ma'i dbugs nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Just as the world does not accept a next world, but breath is the cause of breath, so the reply to the doubt of the opponent is given in ‚Äúthe breath of the parents.‚Äù

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú No‚Äù is the refutation.

original: de lta bu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni pha ma dag gi dbugs zhan pa dang drag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ci 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni pha ma dag gi dbugs zhan pa dang drag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ci 'dra ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Of that kind‚Äù means that the nature of the breath of the parents is weak, strong, and so on.

original: gzhan yang de lta na pha ma nyid kyi sems 'phos pas ci ste mi brjod /
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta na pha ma nyid kyi sems 'phos pas ci ste mi brjod /
translated: Moreover, if that were so, why would it not be said that the mind of the parents is transferred?

original: de la yang sngar brjod zin to //
analyzed: de la yang sngar brjod zin to //
translated: But this has already been said above.

original: de'i phyir dang po dbugs 'byung ba mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang po dbugs 'byung ba mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the first exhalation is not tenable.

original: dbugs 'byung tha dad yul can phyir //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung tha dad yul can phyir //
translated: Because the exhalation is different, the object is different, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel ba ni khas blangs nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'grel ba ni khas blangs nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is ‚Äúhaving accepted.‚Äù

original: dbugs dang po 'byung bar khas blangs nas brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs dang po 'byung bar khas blangs nas brjod pa'o //
translated: Having accepted the first exhalation, it is stated.

original: ci brjod pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: ci brjod pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that which is stated?

original: bshad pa dbugs rnams ni du ma nyid de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa dbugs rnams ni du ma nyid de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is ‚Äúthe exhalations are many.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yul zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The object is different.

original: 'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni yul du ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal 'debs pa ni yul du ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is clarified by ‚Äúthe object is different.‚Äù

original: de ltar gyur na nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na nyes pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: If that were so, what is the fault?

original: dbugs du ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbugs du ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The exhalations are many.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ngu ma cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ngu ma cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: It follows that many mental consciousnesses would arise simultaneously.

original: ; skad cig ma'i phyogs la ltos nas kyang /
analyzed: ; skad cig ma'i phyogs la ltos nas kyang /
translated: Even in terms of the momentary position,

original: kyang gi sgras bsdus pa'i gnod par byed pa gzhan brjod pa ni rigs mthun pa'i yid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras bsdus pa'i gnod par byed pa gzhan brjod pa ni rigs mthun pa'i yid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes other forms of harm, such as the mind that is of the same type.

original: dbugs la sogs pa skad cig gcig la ci 'dra bar gyur pa de 'dra ba ni skad cig gzhan du yang yin te /
analyzed: dbugs la sogs pa skad cig gcig la ci 'dra bar gyur pa de 'dra ba ni skad cig gzhan du yang yin te /
translated: The breath, etc., are the same in one moment as they are in another moment.

original: des na yid kyi rnam par shes pa ci 'dra ba zhig gcig gi tshe skyes pas de 'dra nyid gzhan gyi tshe yang 'gyur gyi de 'dra ba ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na yid kyi rnam par shes pa ci 'dra ba zhig gcig gi tshe skyes pas de 'dra nyid gzhan gyi tshe yang 'gyur gyi de 'dra ba ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the mental consciousness that arises at one time is the same as that which arises at another time, and it is not different,

original: rgyu rnams mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te skad cig tha dad pa nyid las rigs mi mthun ba skyed par 'gyur ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: rgyu rnams mtshungs pa'i phyir ro // 'on te skad cig tha dad pa nyid las rigs mi mthun ba skyed par 'gyur ba yin no snyam na /
translated: because the causes are the same.üîΩBut if you think that a different type is produced from a different moment,üîΩthen the text says, ‚Äúbecause of the difference in moments.‚Äù

analyzed: skad cig tha dad pa nyid kyis @143a * //

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //

original: 'o na cis 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na cis 'gyur snyam na /

analyzed: ji ltar rigs mthun pa'i zhes gsungs so //üîΩdu ma zhes bya ba ni rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag yid kyi rnam par shes pa du ma cig car skye bar thal ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag yid kyi rnam par shes pa du ma cig car skye bar thal ba yod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù refers to the consequence that many mental consciousnesses would arise simultaneously.

original: zhing dang sa bon dang chu la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du yid la gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: zhing dang sa bon dang chu la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du yid la gzhag pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is like a field, seed, water, etc.

original: 'on te gzhan du yin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid pas so //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du yin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar srid pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOr if it is otherwise‚Äù means according to what is possible.

original: de la phyogs dang po sel bas ni /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po sel bas ni /
translated: The first alternative is eliminated by saying,

original: tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of the collection.‚Äù

original: tshogs pa ma tshang ba ni tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa ma tshang ba ni tshogs pa'o //
translated: The collection is incomplete.

original: gzhan du yin zhes bya ba'i phyogs la brten nas bshad pa ni 'on te ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'di ni ji ltar yod rgyu yin //
analyzed: gzhan du yin zhes bya ba'i phyogs la brten nas bshad pa ni 'on te ji ltar zhes bya ba'o // 'di ni ji ltar yod rgyu yin //
translated: The explanation based on the alternative that it is otherwise is ‚ÄúOr if it is like what?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i 'grel pa'o //
translated: The commentary on ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of its existence?‚Äù is

original: nye bar gnas pa rgyu nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu de 'dra ba nyid kyi zhes bya ba bsams pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa rgyu nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu de 'dra ba nyid kyi zhes bya ba bsams pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe presence is not the cause.‚Äù The meaning is that the effect is similar to it.

original: 'on kyang nye bar gnas pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang nye bar gnas pa ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: But it is not present.üîΩ‚ÄúThe presence is not the cause‚Äù means that the effect is similar to it.

original: de ltar ni brjod par 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni brjod par 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable to say that,

original: chod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chod pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the presence and absence of the effect do not follow the presence and absence of the cause.

original: ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed kyang rgyu ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: ldog pa'i rjes su mi byed kyang rgyu ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: If you think that even though the effect does not follow the cause, how could it not be a cause?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThe nature of cause and effect . . . .‚Äù

original: des na nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa ni rgyu ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa ni rgyu ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the intended meaning is that that which is not present is not a cause.

original: de bas na me'i bud shing bzhin du tshang ba dang mtshang ba'i rgyu ngag ni de 'dra ba nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes ston pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na me'i bud shing bzhin du tshang ba dang mtshang ba'i rgyu ngag ni de 'dra ba nyid kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes ston pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the cause of the existence and nonexistence of the effect is not like that, like the fuel of fire. To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúFor that reason . . .‚Äù

original: de yod na yod pa nying ces bya ba'i dgos pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de yod na yod pa nying ces bya ba'i dgos pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The purpose of the statement ‚ÄúIf it exists, it exists‚Äù is this.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de yod na yod pa nyid yin te 'dir de'i khyad par skyed pa las ltos pa la ci bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan ni de yod na yod pa nyid yin te 'dir de'i khyad par skyed pa las ltos pa la ci bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason for the fixed nature of cause and effect is that if it exists, it exists. Here, what is the point of considering the production of its specific attributes?

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de yod na yod pa nyid rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni de yod na yod pa nyid rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: No, it is not so. The reason is that if it exists, it exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de yod na yod pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yod na yod pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it exists, it exists.

original: khyab par zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: khyab par zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is pervasion.

original: de 'gyur na 'gyur ba nyid med par de yod na yod pa nyid mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de 'gyur na 'gyur ba nyid med par de yod na yod pa nyid mi rtogs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it were not so, then if it exists, it exists would not be understood.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni de yod ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni de yod ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being taught: if it exists, it exists.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam 'gyur rgyu med pa can yin na'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam 'gyur rgyu med pa can yin na'o //
translated: Thus means if the manifestation is without a cause.

original: thams cad rgyu med par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de yod na yod pa nyid kyang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya @143b ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad rgyu med par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de yod na yod pa nyid kyang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya @143b ba'i don to //
translated: Everything would be without a cause means that if it exists, it exists would not exist.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: Or means the other.

original: de tsam nyid las zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang bral ba'i rgyu tsam 'ba' zhig las so //
analyzed: de tsam nyid las zhes bya ba ni khyad par dang bral ba'i rgyu tsam 'ba' zhig las so //
translated: From that alone means from a cause alone that is devoid of distinction.

original: lan ni dang po nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni dang po nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is at the very beginning.

original: gang gi tshe me dang bud shing stobs dang ldan pa ma yin pa de'i tshe yang du ba drag po nyid du 'gyur ram ci zhes bya pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe me dang bud shing stobs dang ldan pa ma yin pa de'i tshe yang du ba drag po nyid du 'gyur ram ci zhes bya pa'i don to //
translated: When the fire and fuel are not powerful, then what? The point is that the smoke would not be intense.

original: de'i phyir de'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa de'i tshe yang du ba drag po nyid du 'gyur ram ci zhes bya khyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa de'i tshe yang du ba drag po nyid du 'gyur ram ci zhes bya khyab pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the effect is pervaded by the power of the cause, then what? The smoke would not be intense.

original: de yod na yod pa nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan du ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: de yod na yod pa nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu mtshan du ji ltar rtogs /
translated: How can the mere existence of the effect when the cause exists be ascertained as the reason for the existence of the relation of cause and effect?

original: 'dis ni zhes bya bas ni rgyu khyad par med pas 'bras bu khyad par med par bstan pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya bas ni rgyu khyad par med pas 'bras bu khyad par med par bstan pas so //
translated: This is because it has been shown that the effect is not different from the cause.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par la ltos pa'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan dang gzhan dag dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par la ltos pa'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan dang gzhan dag dang ldan pa ste /
translated: In dependence on the particular transformation means in dependence on the possession of other and other particularities.

original: de lta bu'i lus las rnam par shes pa gzhan dang gzhan skye ba yin la khyad par thams cad med na 'chi ba'i gnas skabs na mi skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i lus las rnam par shes pa gzhan dang gzhan skye ba yin la khyad par thams cad med na 'chi ba'i gnas skabs na mi skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Consciousness arises from a body of that kind, and from another consciousness, and so on. If there were no differences, then at the time of death, consciousness would not arise.

original: lus khyad med pa'i phyir na yongs su gyur pa 'di'i yang khyad par gang las 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: lus khyad med pa'i phyir na yongs su gyur pa 'di'i yang khyad par gang las 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Since there is no difference in the body, from what would the difference in the transformation arise?

original: rim pa dang ldan pa'i lus rnams ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi tsam gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis khyad par 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba khyad par can du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rim pa dang ldan pa'i lus rnams ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi tsam gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis khyad par 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir yongs su 'gyur ba khyad par can du mi 'gyur la /
translated: Since the bodies that are in a series are not different, because they are just the nature of the four great elements, the transformation would not be different.

original: de med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa khyad par med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because of that, consciousness would not be different.

original: de med par yang 'byung na ni rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med par yang 'byung na ni rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it arose without that, it would be without a cause.

original: des na lnga ma snga ma'i 'du byed pa'i dbang gi skyes pa la skyon med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na lnga ma snga ma'i 'du byed pa'i dbang gi skyes pa la skyon med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in saying that consciousness arises from the power of the formative forces of the previous life.

original: rang bzhin khyad par med kyang yongs su gyur pa khyad par yod par ston pa ni gal te 'o ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin khyad par med kyang yongs su gyur pa khyad par yod par ston pa ni gal te 'o ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Although there is no difference in their intrinsic nature, the transformation is different.

original: snod gnyis na gnas pa'i 'o ma la /
analyzed: snod gnyis na gnas pa'i 'o ma la /
translated: The milk that is in two different containers

original: gcig la ni zho ska ba dang gzhan la ni sla bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: gcig la ni zho ska ba dang gzhan la ni sla bar mthong ngo //
translated: is seen to be curdled in one and liquid in the other.

original: ska ba dang cig shos kyi khyad par gang las yin snyam na /
analyzed: ska ba dang cig shos kyi khyad par gang las yin snyam na /
translated: From what difference in the milk does the difference in the curds arise?

original: dus kyi mthar thug pa tsam las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus kyi mthar thug pa tsam las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From the difference in the time of their production.

original: grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa rten gzhan gyi lhan cig bye ba tsam las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa rten gzhan gyi lhan cig bye ba tsam las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: from the mere difference in the supporting conditions, such as cold or heat.

original: de bzhin du lus kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su gyur pa khyad par med pa can yin yang 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩzho la sogs kyi rnam 'gyur ni //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su gyur pa khyad par med pa can yin yang 'gyur ba yin no // zho la sogs kyi rnam 'gyur ni //
translated: In the same way, the body is also like that, i.e., although there is no difference in its transformation, it changes.üîΩThe transformation of milk, etc.üîΩis the transformation of milk, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'o ma la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩmi @144a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'o ma la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩmi @144a * //
translated: The meaning is: the transformation of milk, etc.üîΩis the transformation of milk, etc.

original: mtshungs pa gang yin pa de ni 'o ma mtshungs pa las byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshungs pa gang yin pa de ni 'o ma mtshungs pa las byung ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is similar is not produced from similar milk.

original: lus kyi rnam 'gyur ni /üîΩkhyad par can du gyur pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin nyid du mtshungs pa'i lus rnams la /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam 'gyur ni / khyad par can du gyur pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin nyid du mtshungs pa'i lus rnams la /
translated: The bodily dispositionüîΩis the special transformation.

original: 'ga' zhig tu yongs su gyur pa 'ga' zhig sems kyi khyad bar gyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu yongs su gyur pa 'ga' zhig sems kyi khyad bar gyi rgyu yin no //
translated: The bodily dispositions that are similar in being composed of the four great elements are the cause of some special mental states.

original: das na lus ni mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa dag la rjes su mthun pa goms pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de nyid rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa ni shes pa dag tha dad ba'am tha mi dad pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: das na lus ni mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa dag la rjes su mthun pa goms pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de nyid rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa ni shes pa dag tha dad ba'am tha mi dad pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the bodily disposition is the cause of the difference or non-difference of conceptual and non-conceptual consciousnesses, which is the habitual tendency of the concordant familiarization with the similar and dissimilar.

original: lus mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa dag yod kyang /
analyzed: lus mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa dag yod kyang /
translated: Even though there are similar and dissimilar bodies,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa rnams la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa rnams la tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the conceptual and non-conceptual consciousnesses are not different or non-different.

original: zhar la byung ba rdzogs par byas nas gnyug ma nye bar sdud pa ni /
analyzed: zhar la byung ba rdzogs par byas nas gnyug ma nye bar sdud pa ni /
translated: Having completed the digression, he now summarizes the innate:

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: tshogs pa rgyu nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni thams cad rgyu nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa rgyu nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni thams cad rgyu nyid yin na'o //
translated: If the collection were the cause, etc. means if everything were the cause.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni so sor skyed par nus pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni so sor skyed par nus pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: Otherwise, etc. means in the position of being able to generate individually.

original: du ma nyid do zhes bya ba ni yid kyi shes pa cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gang brjod pa'o //
analyzed: du ma nyid do zhes bya ba ni yid kyi shes pa cig car skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes gang brjod pa'o //
translated: Plurality means the consequence that mental consciousness would arise simultaneously.

original: de ltar mi mthong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi mthong ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: It is not that it is not seen means the opposite.

original: des na dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa ni sems kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes tshad ma'i 'bras bu 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dbugs 'byung ba la sogs pa ni sems kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes tshad ma'i 'bras bu 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, inhalation, etc. are not the cause of mind. The result of valid knowledge is implied.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: Whose, etc. means another‚Äôs.

original: de la du ma ci'i phyir mi skye zhes bya ba de ni re zhig mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la du ma ci'i phyir mi skye zhes bya ba de ni re zhig mi rigs te /
translated: Why does not a plurality arise there? That is not reasonable.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa rnams sam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa 'ba' zhig pa rnams sam /
translated: Either those without conceptualization alone,

original: rnam par rtog pa gcig dang ldan pa rnams ni lhan cig skyed par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gcig dang ldan pa rnams ni lhan cig skyed par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that they are produced together with a single conception.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar lus las yin pa la thal bar 'gyur ba ltar yid kyi rnam bar shes pa du ma nyid skye bar ji ste mi 'gyur zhes brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar lus las yin pa la thal bar 'gyur ba ltar yid kyi rnam bar shes pa du ma nyid skye bar ji ste mi 'gyur zhes brjod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: But why should it not be the case that many mental consciousnesses arise, as it is in the case of the body?

original: de la brjod pa ni rnam shes nus pa nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdon gzhan la chags pas sam /
analyzed: de la brjod pa ni rnam shes nus pa nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o // don gzhan la chags pas sam /
translated: The answer is: because the potential of consciousness is restricted.

original: don gzhan la 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes phyogs gzhan du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don gzhan la 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes phyogs gzhan du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Or, the meaning can be understood in another way: because it is attached to another object, or because it apprehends another object.

original: bshad pa la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa gcig cig gi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi rang bzhin gyi rnam par shes pa gcig cig gi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: The thesis in the above explanation is: ‚ÄúThe immediately preceding condition is the cause of a single consciousness, because of the restriction of the potential of consciousness.‚Äù
